**Inner Recitation Formula of the Divine Empyrean**
The Realized One acts as before, entering the Three Heavenly Gates, proceeding directly to the southeast, the august Xun position. Amidst verdant forests and azure mists, cascading streams swirl—there stands a grand palace, the abode of the Great Emperor of Longevity. The guards are arrayed in solemn formation, as in the Great Mystery’s court.

The Realized One, from the Crimson Palace, ascends the layered towers, crosses the rainbow bridge, and enters the Central Heavenly Gate. Passing through the Three Heavenly Gates, he beholds the towering palace halls, golden tablets and jade inscriptions proclaiming the *Divine Empyrean Jade Treasury*. The Realized One then enters to pay homage and recite the scripture, whether for others or himself. After reciting the scripture seven times, he repents of sins and prays for blessings as before. Bowing twice, he takes leave, exiting the Three Heavenly Gates, crossing the rainbow bridge, descending the layered towers, and returning to the Crimson Palace, where he swallows saliva to conclude.

The recited scripture is the *Divine Empyrean’s Jade Chapters*.

**Silent Audience Formula of the Divine Empyrean**
For the silent audience, proceed to the Three Heavenly Gates marked by golden tablets and jade inscriptions. Do not enter this gate; instead, face the southeast and pay homage to the Divine Empyrean’s palace. Donning red robes, recite the Feathered Chapters. Visualize the True King and the host of Realized Ones on his left and right, all chanting in unison the True King’s golden radiance of right qi, merging with one’s body. Then bow deeply or kneel to present the petition.

If seeking rain, request the descent of a certain general to bring rain, and await the imperial assent. If intending to pay homage at the Golden Palace, take leave of the True King and return directly to the Three Heavenly Gates. Declare the matter to the guardian officials as prescribed, recite the middle chapter, present the petition, and await the decree.

Once the Celestial Emperor has granted the imperial edict, summoning the Divine Empyrean, the True King is seen facing the palace to receive the Celestial Emperor’s mandate, dispatching thunder to bring rain. The True King, bearing the command, exits the Three Heavenly Gates. The practitioner follows the True King out, witnessing him summon the Three Marshals, Five Generals, and all Thunder Gods. The True King orally transmits the Celestial Emperor’s decree: “Due to prolonged drought in such-and-such a place, you, the Thunder Gods, are commanded to bring rain to relieve the drought.” Immediately, clouds gather, lightning flashes, thunder roars, and rain descends.

When the rain is sufficient, the True King again pays homage at the Golden Palace to express gratitude before withdrawing. The Realized One likewise expresses gratitude and returns to the Crimson Palace, following the usual procedure. If not paying homage at the Golden Palace, the True King is still seen arriving at the Three Heavenly Gates to summon thunder and bring rain, after which the usual procedure is followed.

The heavens comprise Nine Empyreans, with the Divine Empyrean at the center. Its scenery is of azure cinnabar, turquoise, and purple jade. The Supreme Emperor resembles the Supreme Clarity’s form. The Thunder City lies at the southeast corner.

*Dharma Sea’s Lost Pearls, Scroll Twenty-Nine—Concluded*
*Dharma Sea’s Lost Pearls, Scroll Thirty*

**Secret Method of the Great Year for Excavation Talismans**

The Heavenly Master said: In worldly construction, those who violate taboos and die number eight or nine out of ten. The Dharma holds the incantation for excavation, corresponding to the five surnames’ households. If one violates the earth and contracts illness, no medicine can save them. Submit a written petition, then take a peach-wood board nine *cun* long and one *cun* five *fen* wide, tapering from top to bottom. Inscribe the talisman upon it, perform the ritual as prescribed, and install it at the afflicted site. Only afterward may talismanic water be administered for ingestion, ensuring immediate recovery. This must not be recklessly transmitted.

When inscribing the talisman, arrange an incense altar, pace the *Ding*-steps, transform the spirit, and summon the generals, stating the matter at hand. Now inscribe the celestial talisman in seal script, dispatching it to the household to expel all malevolent spirits and deities, pacifying the residence so the afflicted may recover. Strike the brush five times, then inscribe the talisman:

Middle Terrace: Two white, protects the body and secures the home (午)
Lower Terrace: Three azure, extinguishes calamity and eliminates spirits (未)
Where the Terrace Stars arrive, great might is bestowed*

*"I, in service to the Supreme Emperor, beseech the Seven Stars of the Northern Dipper, the great deities of the celestial center, ascending to the Golden Palace to rescue the imperial subjects. As one, descend and command the Year Lord: swiftly dispatch the malevolent spirits, allowing no delay! Hasten as decreed by law!"*

*"By the edict of the Most High, the Year’s Virtuous Deity, master of this year’s incantation, urgently dispatches the malevolent spirits:
卯 Sweep away demonic essences
丑 Let no disasters arise
酉 Rescue the imperial subjects
寅 唵□□子
Fire-haste obey! 午 Repel, and no living malevolence shall dare defy the command!

May the imperial subjects thrive 子文

Peach emerges
The Five Thunder Division’s thunder incantation 安镇宅庭卯文
Evil spirits, rise swiftly, tarry not! 卯文
Upon talisman’s arrival, obey! 中文"*

Take the qi from the direction of the current Year Lord, blow it forth, and recite the incantation. With the left hand in *zhongwen* mudra and the right in *maowen* mudra, hands on hips, cry aloud: *"Officials of the Excavation Bureau, reverently obey the talismanic command! Proceed to the household of so-and-so, expel all malevolent spirits, and suffer no delay! Defiance of the imperial decree shall be met with execution by the Wheel of Law!"* Only then may the talisman-bearer be instructed to prepare, at the afflicted site, five portions of wine and fruit as offerings to the talisman’s generals, the Year Lord’s honored deities, the Five Thunder Generals, the scribes, and the twenty-four malevolent spirits. Present twelve sheets of spirit money and twelve paper horses. Use an axe to drive the talisman into the earth until the character "断" is severed. If recovery is incomplete, drive it deeper the next day until fully buried, then sprinkle pure water to pacify the site.

*Keep this secret, keep it secret.*

Should the adept proceed in person, recite the incantation and empower the talisman as previously instructed.

The Northern Emperor, Supreme Commander of the Demon-Subduing Host—Marshal Tianpeng, Great Primordial Perfected Lord;

The two *sha*-demons face their doom.

*Mā □, by imperial decree—hūṃ!*

Summon my Four Perfected Ones:

After reciting the incantation thrice, draw the primordial qi of the Dark Heavens, trace the mudra over the incense, and visualize its ascent. State your intent, then inscribe the talisman. Clasp the death-sealing script, assume the sword mudra, and cross into the Mystic Gate. Visualize a golden beam of light between your kidneys, ascending through the spine, passing the Wind Mansion, and emerging from the Hall of Impressions. From your eyes, it transforms into a golden rainbow, surging toward the boundless heights of the Dark Heavens. Envision the Northern Emperor seated within a golden radiance, a hundred spirits in attendance, the Four Saints and their celestial legions guarding the four poles. **Talisman Procedure:**
Use one sheet of yellow paper, cut to a square, trimming excess corners. First, with black ink, write the bureau’s header at both ends of the document. Once all is prepared, invoke the marshal generals to act at the center. First, impress one seal to fix the position, then write the talisman above it, and seal it again. Below the bureau’s header, impress one seal; above the endorsement, impress another—arranged like the three points of a triangle. Then dry it over incense, burn paper money and horses with it, and dispatch the flying talisman to determine fortune or misfortune.

When encountering flying heavenly or roaming earthly great demonic spirits, malevolent gods, evil ghosts, or demonic entities—mountain specters, sprites, and the like—harming the people, whose crimes warrant annihilation: first perform a jiao offering and memorial. Reward the generals lavishly, using twelve feet of yellow silk, cut to a square, to write the talisman. Further, take an iron brick, seven inches long, one foot wide, and half an inch thick. On its face, write "By edict, execute" and record the transgressions of the demonic entity, the official’s rank, name, and the date and time of the order. On the reverse, write the Jade Emperor’s name, the Four Saints’ names on either side, and the names of the Four Ding and Four Spirits below. On the talisman, add the Three Terraces, yin-yang, and the Dipper, then sink the brick at the site of the transgression. If on land, the iron brick is unnecessary—simply write on the yellow silk talisman and burn it with paper money.

For mid-level obstinate demonic entities, use a proclamation written on a talisman for the altar assembly, listing the Northern Emperor’s position after "Your servant, receiving the decree, obeys."

For rain rituals, use an iron tablet inscribed with the talisman and cast it into a deep pool. For regular practice, use the standard form.

**Standard Practice Procedure:**
When performing the ritual, dispatch the talisman according to the form, then turn around and recite the incantation while casting the net.

**Incantation:**
By the Northern Land’s edict, summon Luo [and] Tu Constellations.

**Flying Talisman Response Divination**
When the talisman reaches the east, the person recovers;
if it wildly flies to the west, their life is imperiled.
Greatly avoid sudden flight to the south—
if it passes smoothly, illness lingers.
When the talisman reaches the northern dead land,
this person will surely enter the Yellow Springs.
If evil lies in the northeast, they will die upon falling;
if in the southeast, malevolent spirits bring misfortune.
If it passes smoothly in the southwest, heaven hastens vows;
if it falls in the northwest, illness persists as before.
If the talisman splits in two, death is certain;
if it pierces beams or crosses pillars, vows torment them.
Burying gold or resisting gold in the paper ash brings fulfillment—
both outcomes may ensure safety.
Only offering gold causes calamity and stagnation—
swift rise and fall foretell a life cut short.
If rats scurry with spirits, treat according to direction;
if the talisman soars to the heavens, the affliction is cured.
Sudden flight with many spirits requires capture and binding;
if money flies and the talisman sinks, misfortune befalls.
If the talisman transforms into a chariot rumbling like thunder,
spirits hasten vows—this is no divine act.
If it suddenly scatters like stars, the person cannot be saved;
if it briefly reunites, the patient survives without grave harm.
This is the true esoteric method of the immortals—
do not transmit it to those unworthy of the divine.

**East:** Auspicious if rising high or passing smoothly, no spirits—beware the 3rd and 7th days.
**South:** Greatly inauspicious if sudden flight, portending danger and shock; if passing smoothly, illness may change; if passing with delay, spirits are present.
**West:** Greatly ominous if wild flight, portending danger and shock; if passing with delay, spirits are present; if passing smoothly, no harm—beware the 3rd and 5th days.
**North:** Utterly dire if wild flight; beware the 3rd and 7th days. Death is certain if passing with delay—no salvation; if flying past, spirits are present.
**Northeast:** Ghost gate—if flying past, spirits cause illness; recovery uncertain. If wild flight passes with delay and lands here, death follows.
**Southeast:** Earth gate—two or three days, greatly inauspicious. High flight brings spirit harassment; smooth flight brings spirit-hastened vows, minor disturbances.
**Southwest:** Human gate—three or four days, greatly inauspicious. Sudden flight or direct fall here is ominous; smooth passage indicates vow activation.
**Northwest:** Heavenly gate—if the patient is mild, the talisman falling here will immediately ease their head while weighing down their feet.

**Soaring Talisman:** If it shoots straight upward then falls, no harm—observe the direction of descent for judgment.
**Split-Form Talisman:** If it rises and splits into two, it signifies a violent death.
**Buried-Gold Talisman:** If it does not rise and sinks into the paper ash, it is called "buried gold"—no harm, still safe.
**Resisting-Gold Talisman:** If it does not rise and instead pierces downward into the paper ash, it is called "resisting gold"—no harm.
**Offered-Gold Talisman:** If it does not rise and floats atop the paper ash, it portends delay and difficulty in recovery.
**Piercing-Beam Talisman:** If it rises and pierces a beam, it hastens vows.
**Adhering-Beam Talisman:** If it rises and clings to a beam or ridgepole, it hastens vows.
**Flying-Money Talisman:** If it does not rise but the money ash does, the person faces misfortune and financial loss—unfavorable.
**Thunder Talisman:** If the ash swirls like thunder with the paper ash, spirits hasten vows—ominous.
**Chariot-Wheel Talisman:** If it stands on the ground and rotates like a wheel, mountain spirits hasten vows.
**Shattered-Star Talisman:** If it rises in three or four pieces, none intact, it portends death.
**Reuniting-Form Talisman:** If it rises in two or three pieces then briefly reunites, the patient will not die, nor suffer grave harm.
**Up-and-Down Talisman:** If it rises and falls intermittently, it portends no harm in advance or retreat.
**Rat-Scurrying Talisman:** If it does not rise but stands like a scurrying rat, spirits are present—treat according to its direction.
**Smooth-Rise-Smooth-Fall Talisman:** If it rises and falls smoothly beneath the roof, a hidden corpse is present—seal it with the talisman.
**Returning-Form Talisman:** If it does not rise until passing the paper, it is called "returning form"—no harm.
**Swift-Fall Talisman:** If it suddenly flies then swiftly falls, it cannot be saved if slow to act—timely treatment averts harm.
**Sudden-Transformation Talisman:** If it ignites and instantly flies like thunder, fierce spirits are present—most suitable for capture and binding.

**Upper Altar Method: Five-Dipper Northern Dipper Seal Formula**
The method states: With the left hand form the Dipper seal, the right hand curls the fourth and fifth fingers while extending the second and third, the thumb pressing the *sha* script. Then bring the left hand’s *sha* script seal to meet the right hand’s *sha* script, crossing the three fingers and brushing the forehead for use.

Cross the two index fingers firmly, then the two little fingers, curl the remaining three fingers of each hand, and press both thumbs into the *sha* script.

**Lunar Evasion Method**
Begin at the current hour, starting from the first day as the Twenty-Eight Constellations, rotating counterclockwise to the current day’s position—this is the location.

**Celestial Stem Evasion**
Add the monthly Jupiter station to the current hour; when encountering *chen*, it is the Celestial Stem. Starting from *hai* in the first month, rotate counterclockwise to the monthly Jupiter station, then add *xu* and rotate clockwise to *chen*—this is the Celestial Stem’s position.

**Volume 32 of *Dharma Sea’s Lost Pearls* Concluded #1: *The Four Sage Marshals’ Secret Method of Subduing Demons of the Northern Emperor***

This method was transmitted by the Northern Emperor lineage of the Tang and Song dynasties. The *Northern Emperor* refers to the Great Emperor of the Purple Tenuity of the North Pole. The *Four Sages* are the four great marshals under the Northern Emperor’s command: Marshal Tianpeng, Marshal Tianyu, Marshal Xiangsheng, and Marshal Yousheng. *The Essence of Daoist Methods*, volumes 169 and 170, contains *The Great Method of Subduing Demons of the Four Sages of Huntian Feiti*, which belongs to the same tradition and may serve as a reference.

**Volume 33 of *Dharma Sea’s Lost Pearls*: *The Lesser Four Sages’ Secret Method Before the Northern Emperor***

**Lineage**
The ancestral master is Zhang the Perfected of the Great Cavern of Western Shu.

**Generals**
The dedicated general for ritual protection is the Vast Spirit of Awesome Power, the Faceless Great General and Northern Pole Commander-in-Chief, Chen Sheng.

His face is black, his moon-like eyes gaze upward and are large and round, his teeth remain concealed, his hair is black and stands erect, and he wears a small green headscarf. He is clad in a black robe adorned with circular floral patterns on the shoulders, golden armor on the chest, and holds in his right hand an iron staff and in his left two iron staves. A dragon blade hangs at his side, and he wears a white sash, white trousers, and white gaiters.

This general is a transformation of the Dark Emperor, who manifested in the world during the late Qin and early Han dynasties. Indignant at the cruelty of the age and grieving over the suffering of the times, he resolved to save the people. Leading an army of a million, he commanded all who followed him, and the realm responded like clouds gathering and echoes resounding. His authority was well-regulated, his commands timely, and his purpose was to deliver and aid all living beings. Upon the fulfillment of his merit and deeds, during the reign of Emperor Wu of Han, he revealed his traces and assisted in the celestial battles, earning merit. A temple was established for him, and he was enfeoffed as a general to harmonize and govern the common people.

In various ritual traditions, there is also a Faceless General. However, this general was known by Master Zhang of the Great Cavern, who understood his whereabouts and memorialized the Northern Pole, leading the troops to return to the altar. All who receive this method must revere and keep it secret; its efficacy will surely manifest. It must not be recklessly transmitted to unworthy persons.

This general communicates directly with the Northern Pole. For all prayers and petitions, the divine response is swift.

The next general is the Great General of Illuminating the Dao, Shedding Blood at the Head, and Assisting the Numinous, Hao Guang.

His face is red, his eyes round, his large teeth bared, and his red hair stands erect. He wears a small topknot, a half-black robe of a pale black hue, and golden armor on his chest. In his right hand, he wields a long blade, and in his left, he carries a ghost-headed sword. He wears a blood-red sash, a scabbard at his side, white trousers tucked up, and white gaiters.

This general is the spirit of the Mighty Celestial Guard. His nature is fierce and detests evil; he executes gods, kills demons, and metes out the harshest punishments. His divine power is resplendent, and he pursues mountain spirits, bringing them back to the true Dao. He transforms and guides the multitudes, and his merit is vast and profound.

This general also appears in other ritual traditions and is included in the registers of the Three and Five Capital Offices. However, in this altar tradition, he was transmitted by Master Zhang of the Great Cavern of Shu, who understood his essential principles and memorialized for his promotion. All who practice this method can surely subdue ghosts. If one venerates and honors him, how can his manifestations not be evident?

The Valiant and Mighty General in Golden Armor, Geng Rong, styled Shu Jie, has a face of ruddy jade complexion. His eyes gaze upward, his hands are clenched in fists crossed before him, and his entire body is clad in fine golden armor. He wears a helmet, a blade hangs at his waist, and a small golden sash binds his waist. His feet are bare. This general hails from the land of Chu. King Xian of Wei enfeoffed him as Grand Marshal of the Armies. His nature is upright and stern, detesting evil; he wields both authority and power, commands and subdues, and executes with decisive action. Skilled in leading troops into battle, he has rendered meritorious service time and again. King Xian issued an edict commanding him to lead the army, where he faced the Three-Battle Jiang Jie King of Wuya, dividing his forces to array in formation. Alone, he clapped his hands and charged into battle, yet suddenly, amidst the ranks, he perished in the fray, his qi spent. He vowed to return to the service of the Three Heavens’ Gate, becoming the Golden-Armored Valiant General. Later, Master Zhang of the Great Cavern memorialized his extraordinary valor, and he was appointed to lead troops under the altar’s banner.

The Manifestly Responsive, Demon-Subduing, Tiger-Headed Primordial Spirit Great General, Geng Wen, styled Zi Ze, wears a tiger crown. His face is half-red, his eyes white. He dons a black robe, holds a blade in his right hand, and lets a white gaiter hang down. His feet are bare, though sometimes he wears hempen sandals. This general is a man of the Tang dynasty. At the Purple Tenuity Grotto and Cloud Palace, he served as the Tiger-Attendant Spirit, originating from the northern lands, where he fed exclusively on termites. His nature is steadfast and gentle, yet when he presented a precious memorial, he was intercepted by a hundred demons. Stirring his courage, he raised his voice to summon the demon-subduing hosts. Thereupon, the Perfected Lord of Demon-Dispelling Celebration descended, leading a myriad of demon-subduing soldiers to serve under him. The demons were thus compelled to submit, and he achieved a minor merit. Unaware of his own resolve, within the Black Yin Zisi Temple, he brandished his blade and split several great beams, chewing through the termites within the wood without number. The temple’s monks entreated him to stay. Wherever the sound of the general’s voice reached within the temple’s halls, termites would take flight and fall dead to the ground. Later, Master Zhang of the Great Cavern memorialized his归附 to the Northern Culmen.

The talisman of Marshal Chen...

**Summoning Incantation**
Reverently invoke the Great Venerable Deity of the North, styled the Faceless Great General. In his hand he wields an iron staff, interrogating ghosts to reveal their names. Oṃ. Duna jicha xuyi su svāhā.

Swift and faceless Great General Chén Shèng,

seal with the command character,
then invoke the summoning incantation to empower the body.
Next, visualize the general with fierce kidney qi surging into the talisman.

Curl the left middle finger into the palm,
press the thumb’s joint to secure it,
then bend the remaining fingers over the thumb,
keeping the little and index fingers straight.

Golden Spirit, Golden Spirit,
true numen of the Heavenly Cavern.

hasten to arrive!

Orthodox Unity’s descending true spirit,
the faceless venerable deity.
Urgent! Attach to the living,

Hasten, hasten!

Oṃ. Tāya hūṃ hūṃ tāya swiftly attach and come svāhā.

Ṭa mā lü to the edict’s summons—seize and gather.

Reverently invoke the Faceless One of the Northern Culmen,
iron staff in hand, subduing hordes of demons,
black hair wild, visage fierce,

Svāhā.

After reciting the above incantation, chant the Heavenly Vanguard Incantation and the Jade Emperor’s Precious Laud to augment divine might and act with fierce resolve.

**Hand Seals for Practice**
Upon completing the ritual reception of the edict, formally memorialize the Northern Emperor and request the command of the marshal, specifying the time and place for embodiment and practice. Prepare the summons talisman and official writ, and only proceed after the marshal has been duly petitioned.

Select several pure and upright youths to stand before the altar. Remove all miscellaneous objects from the altar space, lest the marshal’s ferocity damage them—items such as blades and axes must be stored away. Prepare only three peachwood staves, blazing incense, talisman paper and brushes, cinnabar, ink, spirit money, and paper horses to meet the marshal’s needs. At the appointed time, purify the space, transform the spirit, summon the generals, and state your intent as usual.

**Sealing Incantation for Embodiment**
When the ritual master acts, first trace a well-character (井) in the air above the ground, then visualize the character *jīn* (聻) within it. Next, have the youth stand atop the well, imagining it to be ten thousand fathoms deep, with black *qi* billowing forth, engulfing the youth within.

Then, using the sword mudra above the youth’s crown, trace the nine characters of the *guāng yáng chí diān guàn fàn lǎn fú shè* in the air, still visualizing the *jīn* character within the well. Recite the incantation:

The nine characters shake heaven and earth,
shaking heaven, the celestial gates turn,
shaking earth, the terrestrial portals split.
Reverently invoke the Great Star of Fusang, the Seven Ladies of the Eastern Dipper,
seal the youth, the thousand-mile numinous child,
the wondrous sagely divine maidens and warriors—
hasten the living soul from the body,
the divine *qi* to attach to the form.
Urgent, urgent, as the law commands!

With this method, visualize the youth’s cinnabar field *qi* rising to the crown, then draw it into your own life palace. Thereafter, perform the ritual actions upon the youth’s face and proceed according to the method.

**Incantation**
Heaven and earth, sun and moon,
water and fire in union.

Summon the upper and lower clouded souls,
unyielding as iron.
Urgent, urgent, as the law commands!

With this method, form the *zi-wu-mao-you* mudra over the youth’s face, then apply the incantation and mudra in sequence.

**Incantation**
Fire and heaven, limpid and profound,
the youth’s soul wanders, lost in darkness.
Urgent, urgent, as the law commands!

After reciting this incantation, draw the *qi* of the northern *zi* hour and blow it into the water. Then visualize the water filling with dreadful black *qi*, spray it upon the youth, and imagine the black *qi* shrouding the youth from sight. Next, recite each incantation to hasten the process.

**Swift Elbow Method**
Whenever a youth’s soul proves difficult to attach, employ this supplementary *elbow talisman method*.

**Talon Talisman (also called the General’s Thunderbolt Talisman)**
**Incantation**
Black *Mo* utters the decree,
roaring, summoning the Four Upright Ones.
Command the Northern Pole General:
wind and fire descend upon mortal form.
Unite *qi* to seal the mysterious truth,
nine talismans in emptiness, one in substance.
Fierce and mighty, manifesting awe-inspiring might,
vanquish demons, sever black lightning.
Transmitted by the Great Teaching’s decree,
disobedience invites thunderbolt retribution.
Urgent, urgent, as the law commands!

Oṃ.
*Fen fen le le jí jí.*

Inscribe this talisman upon a fire dragon, visualize thunder and lightning erupting violently on all sides, and burn a gold coin before the possessed youth. Then, with the sword mudra, trace the talisman in the air while reciting the incantation over the youth’s face to swiftly secure attachment.

**Restraint Method (also called the Hidden *Gang* Method)**
After completing the *gang* steps, form the *zi-wu* mudra, draw the *qi* of the Heavenly Gate, and blow it upon the afflicted person. With the mudra, strike them repeatedly until they collapse. For severe possession, demonic frenzy, or when the youth’s attachment turns unruly and defies control, employ this *hidden gang restraint method*.

**Internal Cultivation Formula**
Abide in great stillness and silence. Draw a breath of *qi* from the northeast and swallow it into the spleen palace. Next, visualize the black *qi* within the kidneys ascending to the spleen palace, where the two *qi* merge to form a single black orb. Direct it downward into the *Xuanming*, guide it through the *Weilü* point, and ascend straight to the *Niwan* palace. From the Earthly Portal below, exhale a black orb to meet your own, fusing them into one. Swiftly wield the sword mudra or the Dipper mudra to cleave it open, revealing Marshal Chen standing at your side. Then recite the summoning incantation, the secret incantation, and the esoteric incantation. Visualize above the *Xuantian*: Marshal Chen descending from the Northern Pole’s imperial presence, riding golden-black *qi*. Combine the ten-character secret incantation with the mudra to merge them into a single, awe-inspiring force, ready for command and deployment.

**Primordial Supreme Unity’s Divine Thunderbolt Method**

**Sacred Rank**
The Most High of Jade Clarity’s Sacred Realm, the Void and Spontaneous Origin, Ancestor of the Myriad Dao, Foremost of All Sages—*Yuanshi Tianzun*.
The August Supreme Who Opens Heaven, Wields the Talisman, and Governs the Calendar—*Haotian Yuhuang Shangdi*.
The Great Sage of Supreme Unity, the Celestial Mother of the Jade *Qi* Heaven, the Banner Deity and August Star Lord—*Taiyi Dasheng Fanqi Yaotian Yuanhuang Tianmu Daoshenzun Dijun*.

Chief Marshal Zhu, whose taboo name is *Yu*...

A golden pellet pierces the Purple Tenuity,

From their stations, fortune and misfortune flow—
Through fasting and cultivation, the unseen stirs.

**Secret Mantra:**
□ gaze □ the Great Constancy, urgent.

**Golden Crucible Fire-Agitating Formula**
With the right method, draw a well-shaped character (井). Then inhale *qi* through the nose in one breath and swallow it, visualizing lung *qi* entering the kidneys—metal generating water—transforming into the moon. Liver *qi* enters the heart—wood generating fire—transforming into the sun. Visualize the sun descending and the moon ascending, the two poles intertwining and churning, returning to the central earth, merging into a single golden pellet. After a long while, let it ascend straight to the crown of the head, where golden light bursts forth, swirling across the heavens. The adept uses their gaze to gather the sky and earth into one mass, coalescing into a radiant golden-red glow, distinctly above the adept’s head.

**Jade Cauldron Simmering Formula**
With the right method, use the moon, always positioned where the *Xu* Dipper points. Visualize *Pojun* as large as the Dipper, its red light like the sun. Use the cauldron to swiftly draw it in and swallow it into the heart, then close and hold. Swallow a mouthful of saliva, sending it to the central palace. Visualize the fire blazing like boiling water, within which the five characters transform, emerging in sequence from behind the adept’s crown into the void to perform their work.

**Three-Character Method**
For praying clear skies, brush upward; for praying rain, brush downward.
For rain, use the *Zi-Wu* Dipper; for clear skies, use the *Yin-Wu* Dipper.

**Two-Character Living Method**
This is the phase of heaven and earth merging—emerging, descending, striking the *Ji* and *Bi* constellations.
This is the phase of heaven and earth’s purity and tranquility.
The brush’s touch traces the path of the *po*—the symbol of separation between humans and ghosts.

**Tide-Rising Water-Gathering Green Dragon Rolling Formula**
Visualize liver *qi* entering the heart, merging to form a blue-green dragon. Swallow it into the deep sea, drawing water that surges like a tide, rolling upward into the void, spreading rain everywhere.

*Bei Ming hei shui xu □ xia jiang she.*

*Hūm zhà hūm zhà, jīn huǒ tiān dīng zhāng xìn she.*
*Jīn huǒ tiān dīng zhāng xìn, sù shāo kāi hēi yún jí.*

**Supreme Unity Vice-Marshal’s Thunder Command Secret Method**
**Position:**

He wears a crumpled golden gauze hat, a red headband, a jade-like face with three eyes, red hair, a red robe, a jade belt, and green boots. **Talisman of the Self:**
*Xū! Fire, by your decree, open the Gate of Heaven.*

*Iron-armored flying lightning blocks the Gate of Ghosts.*

*Hóng Qí Jù Zhī Dì Dèng Xiè.*
*Dá Nǎ Zhà Mó Yē Xīn Zhì.*
*Fēi Qī Jīn Zhà Luó Zhāng Jué.*

**Talisman Activation Incantation:**

**Thunder Activation with Incantation:**
*In the East, ten thousand fathoms of blue—*
*The Eastern thunderbolt shakes heaven and earth.*
*In the South, ten thousand fathoms of red—*

*In the West, ten thousand fathoms of white—*

*At the Center, ten thousand fathoms of yellow—*
*The Central thunderbolt shakes heaven and earth.*

After reciting the right incantation, vigorously summon the thunder’s power, dispatch the thunderclap into the talisman, then inscribe another "雷" (thunder) character.

**Incantation:**
*Heavenly thunderbolt shakes heaven and earth,*
*Earthly thunderbolt shakes heaven and earth,*
*Dragon thunderbolt shakes heaven and earth,*
*Spirit thunderbolt shakes heaven and earth,*
*Earth God thunderbolt shakes heaven and earth.*
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed!*

**Method of Practice.**

In profound stillness and great concentration, the practitioner directs the blue and red qi of liver and heart to intertwine and merge at the crown of the head. This qi transforms into clouds, exhaled toward the Xun direction. Then, behold the Gen direction where dark clouds gather thickly—suddenly, a great fiery calamity from the Xun direction plummets into Gen. The Marshal swiftly turns toward Xun, where all the thunder spirits assemble, bowing in attendance. The Marshal leads the host of generals to descend, and the practitioner inhales and exhales before the altar.

This method commands all thunder spirits; it may be employed for great matters but not for trivial ones.

**Incantation for Flying Sword to Sever the Rainbow:**
*Heavenly hūm □ spirit, xī chēn sāi □.*
*Lī niè wèi liè, gū hù náo nù □ yīn □ còu □ jìng dàn □, yàn zàn cí □ zhàng □ měng □.*
*Flying spirits strike and smite, severing the rainbow’s arc.*
*Divine might pervades the Three Realms—*
*Hasten, hasten, by decree of the Jade Emperor’s primordial law!*

**Method:**
With the left hand forming the jade script mudra and the right hand holding the sword mudra, silently recite the preceding incantation. Visualize the thunder spirit under command, draw the northern qi, and blow it onto the sword. Before ascending, wield the sword to strike, then summon the primordial qi in a single surge, shouting: *"Heavenly General, sever the rainbow!"* And it shall be severed as commanded.

**Purple Tenuity’s Jade Tone: The Great Summoning of Thunder, Method #1**
**Presiding Adept**
Patriarch Sovereign of the Western River, Wondrous Dao of Salvation, Primordial Supreme Perfected Lord Sa.

**Thunder Marshals Invoked:**
Marshal Deng, Celestial Lord of Thunder’s Swift-Fire Decree—styled Xie.
Marshal Xin, Celestial Lord of Thunder’s Fierce Officers and Commanding Supervisor—styled Zhi.
Vice-Marshal Song, Fire-Bell Great General of the Southern Quarter—styled Wuji.
Vice-Marshal Dou, Vast-Wilds Great Deity of the Northern Emperor—styled Sheng.

**Method of Practice:**
In the golden crucible, the sun and moon are refined; through iron apertures, thunder is bound.

**Right Method:**
The body blazes like scorching fire. Visualize the qi emerging from behind the crown, then inscribe the talismanic command.

**Incantation for Summoning Water and Fire Qi:**
Reverently invoke:
Great General Song Wuji of the Southern Quarter, who drives thunder and dispatches lightning, wielding the scales of flowing metal and fire;
Great Deity Wang of the Northern Emperor’s Vast Wilds;
Fire Marshal Dou Sheng, who scatters fat and gathers demons.

Hasten, descend with true qi into my water.
*Hasten, hasten, by decree of the law!*

**Right Method:**
Inhale a mountain of southern qi into the heart, then draw a mouthful of northern qi into the kidneys. Seal and stabilize. Circulate one’s own water and fire until they intermingle and surge forth. Blow into the water vessel, then trace the Zi-Wu Dipper within.

The adept traces from *si* (巳) to *wu* (午), releasing fire. Visualize a Dipper-sized blaze upon the earth. The adept treads upon the flame, incinerating the body, transmuting into the Primordial Heavenly Worthy.

Next, from the crown’s gate, a divine infant bursts forth. From the space between the infant’s brows, a flame erupts. The adept swiftly draws it into the nostrils, then exhales through the mouth onto the brush. Recite the incantation to summon the two marshals before the altar. Visualize and unite with the two generals of the Xun Palace, descending to stand upon the incense.

**Jade Tone Summoning Incantation:**
*Om.*

Ah-lu-le-ti-ga-li □-ti-□□-da-zha-ti-he-tan-ti-tan-□-po-ti-tan-□□-sha-yin-□□-po-da-□-ti-□-ti.

**Summoning Edict:**
By decree, summon the mighty spirit Deng Xie, the Great God of Transverse Heaven’s Blazing Fire, to arrive swiftly. Hasten! As the Jade Emperor’s command compels.

**Marshal’s Talisman:**
The right talisman is inscribed in cinnabar on azure paper. Write the marshal’s name within, then inscribe *By the Jade Emperor’s command to compel and seize*. Employ the cyclical signs of the day and hour to dispatch it. Draw five talismanic strokes, align them with the five directions, then burn or cast them into five water vats. Thereafter, proceed according to the Jade Tone’s instructions.

**Jade Tone Incantation:**
Chi-□□-zha-wu-du *Om* Great Fire Mingyi □-ga-□ *Om* mei-ti-she.

**Summoning Edict:**
By decree, summon the fierce marshal Xin Zhi, the Great God of Silver Fangs and Wind-Fire, to arrive swiftly. Hasten! As the Jade Emperor’s command compels.

**Marshal’s Talisman:**
The right talisman is inscribed in cinnabar on yellow paper. Write *Xin Zhi* within, visualize and seal it, then inscribe *Lei-ga-ji* and the Jade Emperor’s command upon it before submerging it in water. Employ the cyclical signs of the day and hour to draw twenty-five talismanic strokes, each accompanied by one gold coin—or crimson paper money—then burn them. Await the rising clouds. Use only this talisman to hasten the process. This talisman may also be inscribed with *Fire Dragon Armored Steed* and a spirit-script stroke, then burned for greater efficacy.

**Commanding Thunder Incantation:**
Ah-tan-ti-tan-□-po-ti-tan-□□-sha-li-xiu-li-xiu-ah-po-da-li-lei-ga-po-lü-□-po.

Swiftly summon the Great Thunder, the Second Thunder, the Third Thunder, the Fourth Thunder, the Fifth Thunder to arrive at once. O Six Maidens of the Dark Master, *Po-fan-hei-qi-li-di-yin-di-du-da-di-sva-ha*.

**Secret Incantation for the Three Marshals to Raise Thunder:**
Zha-chi! Demonic thunder, hasten! Swiftly depart with lightning, command my Rain Master, summon my Wind Earl, set my thunder chariot in motion, wield my thunder axe. At the first peal, men tremble; at the second, the earth splits; at the third, the myriad spirits cover their ears. Hasten! As the Jade Emperor’s command compels.

**Further Hastening Incantation:**
Thunder that shakes heaven, thunder that shakes earth; a soft sound *de-de*, a great sound □□, a joyful sound *ji-ji*, an angry sound *le-le*, a coming sound *ji-ji*, a driving sound *bi-bi*, a gathering sound *hei-hei*, a dispersing sound *suo-suo*. By the power of my vow and might, may divine force descend. Soaring across the eight directions, come and heed this single clap. Hasten! As the Jade Emperor’s command and the Purple Void Primordial Sovereign’s decree.

**Edict for Issuing Commands:**
Solemnly, the first thunder shakes heaven, thunder roars and lightning cracks. Swift as lightning through mist, devour demons on sight. You act by the Three Clarities’ mandate; I act by the Jade Emperor’s command to compel and seize. Issue the order, rebuke and dispatch all marshals to action. Blow wind toward the *Xun* direction. Exhale thunder toward the *Zhen* direction.

Inhale lightning from the *Li* direction, lashes of the eyes. Exhale rain toward the *Kan* direction. Draw *qi* from the divine direction:
*Jia-Yi* at *Chen*, *Bing-Ding* at *Mao*, *Wu-Ji* at *Zi*, *Geng-Xin* at *Shen*, *Ren-Gui* at *Wu*.

The two preceding secret talismans: whenever performing rituals, first inscribe these two talismans onto the memorial document and burn them. Then write two more talismans and burn them at the appointed time to hasten the dispatch of the documents. Place the two great spirit talismans beneath the altar. Invoke the talisman of Marshal Xin, immerse it in the water vessel, spray and sprinkle, and infuse the *qi* of the Celestial Stem into the water.

**Inner Secret of the Heart-Method:**
When performing the Jade Tone Thunder Summoning, employ the preceding method: circulate the fiery *qi* of wrath throughout the body, emanating from the crown to summon two generals. Combine with two generals from the *Xun* direction. Write talismans and recite incantations in a single breath, swiftly and with the force of thunder. Clap the command, shout the rebuke, and act upon the water in the vessel.

First, invite the *qi* of fire and water into the vessel—fire first, then water—circulating the fire *qi* to transform it into water *qi*, merging water and fire. Next, infuse the *qi* of the Celestial Stem into the water, stirring it to absorb the water. Spray and sprinkle toward the direction where the thunder deities reside. Clap the command to summon, rebuke, and dispatch them to act. Inscribe talismans according to the day and direction, drawing *qi* to infuse them.

In this method, first let the fiery light burst forth from your own eyes, transforming into a sudden flame, then into Marshal Xin of Heaven in the void. Next, visualize yourself as Envoy Zhang, transmitting the Jade Emperor’s edict to issue commands. With your right hand, write the character *xu* (虚); with your left, write *zhang* (张). Visualize your wrath as fiery heat, cover your ears with both hands, uniting inner and outer forces so that water stirs and fire ignites.

First, take two small sheets of blue paper, write *xu* and *zhang* on each, roll them into pellets, and insert the *xu* pellet into your left ear. The master says: When the mind stirs, clouds and rain readily gather. One must practice restraint to preserve the spirit-*qi* in its entirety before proceeding. No memorial need be submitted; with a settled mind, the celestial *qi* clears, and clouds cannot coalesce.

**Inner Work of the Mysterious Capital Thunder Hub:**
Each night at the *Zi* hour, don robe and sit in stillness, banishing all thoughts. Click the teeth, close the eyes, concentrate the spirit, and inwardly visualize the five viscera as chambers of gold and jade. Click the teeth to gather saliva, fill the mouth, and swallow it into the cinnabar field. Swiftly lift the perineum. Repeat this three times nine, until the ninth repetition. Tightly contract the perineum without releasing, sensing the *qi* surge from the earth throughout the body, ascending to the muddy pellet. Visualize yourself as the Cinnabar Prime Lord, riding purple clouds to appear before the Emperor and present your petition. Upon receiving the decree, summon the cloud hosts to descend to the deep sea and draw water. Lift the perineum again, ascending along the spine to Kunlun, then slightly release the perineum. Once the response is received, proceed with the memorial and ritual.

The heart startles, the ears ring with thunderclaps, a faint sound lingers above the crown—thunder resounds. *Qi* surges with panting—thunder crashes.

Body and mind feel cool and clear—clear skies. Heat and dryness—clear weather. Movement above the crown—clear skies.

**Wind Response:**
The crown and forehead feel light, cool, and breezy—wind arises.

**Jujube Charm for Curing Myriad Illnesses**
For all healing methods, first take a fine, unbroken jujube. With the left hand, form the Dipper mudra: on *Jia-Zi* days, point the jujube’s tip toward the Dipper’s mouth; on *Yi-Chou* days, point the stem toward the Dipper’s mouth. Reverse the hand to press against the back, while the right hand forms the Sword mudra and presses the chest. Tilt the head to the left, then recite the secret incantation:
Oṃ. *Hūm Hūm Bì Bì Chéng Chéng*—seize!

With one breath, circulate seven times. Once the right-hand incantation is complete, envision three streams of celestial *qi* from the True Dipper entering the jujube. Draw the fiery *qi* of the sword’s edge into the jujube, then point with the Sword mudra and recite the secret incantation:
You are the essence of the tree,
I am the spirit of Heaven.
Borrowing your essence of the tree,
assist my spirit of Heaven.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and command!*

With one breath, circulate seven times. Once the right-hand incantation is complete, release the Sword mudra. Then, [missing text] the Dipper, from *Wu* to *Zi*, forming a thunder array. Strike it into the jujube, envisioning it as the color of red agate. Silently recite the incantation:
*Swiftly, swiftly, by the Emperor’s decree!*

Crimson-bodied, blue-faced, green-skinned, with scorched yellow hair standing erect, atop his head a single skull, and eight skulls strung about his neck. He wears a leopard-skin loincloth. From his two eyes extend two hands: the right holds a golden bell, the left a seal. His middle pair of hands hold a yellow banner on the left and a leopard tail on the right. His lower pair of hands wield a halberd on the left and a fire-sword on the right. From the center of his brow streams a beam of golden light that pierces the beholder. Barefoot, his feet and entire body are wreathed in flying flames.

**Refining and Summoning the Marshal**
When refining the Marshal, first compose the spirit and settle the will. Visualize the Yellow Court—the Central Palace—where a distinct clod of yellow earth appears. Tilt the head back, draw the yellow qi of the Central Heaven into the heart through the nose. The heart’s fire ascends to meet it, then is pressed downward by the external yellow qi into the Central Palace. The internal yellow qi rises to meet the fire, generating it. The three qi merge, all becoming yellow qi. Gather and exhale it upward through the mouth, sending it to the Central Heaven, where it coalesces and descends. Inhale it through the nose into the Central Palace.

Again, mobilize this mass of golden-yellow qi, exhale it forcefully to the earth, dispersing it to fill the cosmos. All persons, self, and things vanish, leaving only thick, abundant yellow qi. With the right hand form the Sword Mudra at the waist, and with the left hand circulate the Thunder Mechanism through the kidneys. Thunder surges from the spine to the ears, cleaving the yellow qi. Flying fire bursts forth, revealing the Marshal within. The adept turns slightly, inhales, and draws the beam of light from the Marshal’s brow into the Cinnabar Field, passing through the coccyx. It merges with the golden light between the two kidneys, then surges up the spine to the Mud Pill, where it transforms into golden light. The adept inhales this golden light through the nose and exhales it to envelop the Marshal.

When deploying the Marshal to execute intentions or inscribe talismans, if the refinement is habitual, condense the golden light into a pellet, gradually shrinking it to the size of a star. Inhale it through the nose into the Central Palace. When needed, extract and employ it.

**Summoning Incantation**
Reverently summon the Fierce Marshal of the Year Lord: at the call, hasten to arrive—swift as shooting stars, rapid as wind and thunder. Dispelling clouds, seizing lightning, hurling fire and meteors, the yellow banner leads, the leopard tail follows. The seventy-two seasonal nodes, the twenty-four qi, the twelve prohibitions—malevolent sha take the fore. Encountering demons, sever them by the inch; meeting ghosts, obliterate their forms. Ahead, dispel the Nine Uglies; behind, annihilate mountain sprites. Flying dragons, earthly anomalies—subdue and pacify the Star of Literary Brilliance. I now summon and invoke you: descend with utmost urgency. Defy the Emperor’s command, and be extinguished by wind and fire.

Reverently summon the Fierce Official of the Earth Bureau, Yin Jiao: hasten to arrive, by the August Emperor’s statutes and decrees.

Clasp the Jade Mudra and silently recite:
*By the Heavenly Talisman, the Star Maid’s Decree of Slaying and Seizing.*

After the incantation, visualize the Marshal’s arrival. Proceed according to the matter at hand, then inscribe the talisman.

**Dipper Mouth, Demon-Queller Divine Official Secret Method #2**

**Incantation**
The vermilion-robed messenger attends the Golden Portal,
The green-faced gentleman descends to Purple Tenuity.
My own livelihood has few disciples,
Yet a single Primordial Lord rises and follows.

**Secret Essentials**
In silent stillness, qi flows ceaselessly.
Visualize the red qi, visualize the Cinnabar Prime.
Penetrate the Mud Pill Palace, ascend to the heavens.
Spread the golden bridge, manifest the Seven Primes.
The Demon-Queller descends, red qi swirls,
Merging into one.
The secret name is suspended.
In the midst of indistinctness, one’s own qi coils.
Swiftly inhale, gently swallow.
Receive it in the Primordial Palace, refined by true fire.
Again, raise it before the glabella.
Golden light appears, illuminating boundlessly.
Execute the Flying Sword Mudra without delay.
The golden light splits—all officers are complete.
In practice, focus is paramount.

**Right Mudra Method**
In profound spirit stabilization, first project the Zi-Wu Dipper in the void of emptiness. Visualize within your Cinnabar Prime Palace a mass of golden-red light, transforming into the form of a solar wheel. Ascend the layered towers, spread the golden bridge, and rise from the Mud Pill Palace to the Dipper’s mouth. The Demon-Queller Star looms vast, descending to merge with the solar wheel. At their center appears the syllable *hūm*. Suddenly, a streak of silvery-white light from the west pierces the golden-red radiance. Swiftly inhale it into the Heart Palace, hold it briefly, then exhale through the Mystic Gate. The light remains golden-red, filling the cosmos. With your right hand, part it with the sword mudra to reveal Marshal Ma standing upon a wheel of fire, his face green with three eyes.

When attending the Dipper, he wears the Golden Heavenly Ding Crown, his hair crimson, clad in a scarlet robe with wide sleeves, sleeves tied with a green immortal sash, and vermilion shoes. When subduing malevolent spirits, he dons an iron helmet, a red headband, a red surcoat, golden armor, a green immortal sash, and green boots. His left hand forms the Dipper Mudra, his right wields a fire sword. A white serpent spits fire from its mouth, fleshy horns grow from his head, and divine officials surround him. The marshal stands within golden flames, his body a thousand *zhang* tall.

When refining officers, inhale into the Cinnabar Field and stop. For regular use, raise and merge the Heavenly Marshal of the Upper Prime into the talisman.

**Talisman for One’s Own Body**
Recite the summoning incantation, inserting the officer’s name:
*Yang* □□□□□□□ *yin* □□□□□□□, all within the Zi-Wu Dipper.

With a single shout to the south, gallbladders shatter and hearts topple.
Divine officials and inspectors, heed and seek the sound.
The Nine Provinces’ Earth Deities, each called by name, execute and behead the wicked.
Those guilty are not lightly punished; the wicked die, the kind live.
Sever heads, cut off feet, pound their forms to dust.

Hasten, hasten, as in the statutes and commands!

Visualize Marshal Ma, draw the talisman with the divine light-infused brush. Once complete, raise the golden light from the glabella, transforming it into a destructive character to enter the talisman. Exhale from the mouth, direct the gaze.

**Incantation**

The brush ascends in blazing yang,
Descends smoothly like falling rain.
There is further yin-yang subtlety—
In practice, all must be known.

The master forms the Dipper configuration with both hands, transforms the spirit, and summons Marshal Ma. Next, with both hands in the Dipper mudra, thumbs at the waist, step the *dang* pace. **Seventeen-Character Divine Official Secret Method #1**

**Internal Refinement**
For all internal refinement, first rub the palms, knock the teeth, and swallow saliva thirty-six times each to separate the turbid qi downward. Next, open heaven and close earth twenty-one times each. From the eyes above to the Bubbling Springs below, rub with the left and right hands. Then recite the secret incantation:
Fire Emperor, Fire Spirit King,
Ma Sheng enters my heart.
The master visualizes heart fire emerging from the Mud Pill Palace to envelop the body. Next, recite the secret incantation:
Water Emperor, Water Spirit King,
Wang Wen Yuan enters my kidneys.
After the incantation, the master mobilizes kidney water, emerging from the Bubbling Springs to envelop the body. When water and fire meet, inhale both into the Central Palace and disperse them. Only sense a single gleaming red fire pearl within—when needed, exhale it.

**Talisman for One’s Own Body**
**Eight Trigrams Mudra**
Yin, Mao, Si, Shen, Dui, Wu—

Wei, Dui, Zi, Chou, Yin, Mao, Si—

*Ōm suō luó* □.

**Hū hōng hōng □□ suō hē.** With the right hand forming the Wu trigram mudra, absorb southern qi.

*Ōm. Jiā jīn zhà suōpó hē.* With the right hand forming the Xun trigram mudra, absorb Si-hour qi.

**Unite the qi.** Enter profound stillness; visualize crimson qi emerging from the heart, ascending from the Mud Pill Palace to shoot straight through the Heavenly Gate. Within the golden light of the crimson qi descending from the Heavenly Gate, a golden talisman falls, merging with the inscribed talisman’s form. Sense the golden light flashing brilliantly.

For refining the spirit, at the Yin, Wu, and Xu hours, sit cross-legged. Rub the hands together until warm, then press the left palm to the right sole; repeat until warm. Then press the right palm to the left sole, twenty-one times each. Next, rub the hands together until warm and press them to both eyes, also twenty-one times.

Silently recite the secret incantation:
*Southern Crimson Emperor, Fire Spirit King Ma Sheng, swiftly descend true qi into my heart. Hasten, hasten, as the law commands!*

After the incantation, the master visualizes crimson qi descending from the crown into the heart.

Next, recite the secret incantation:
*Northern Black Emperor, Water Spirit King Wang Wen Yuan, swiftly descend true qi into my kidneys. Hasten, hasten, as the law commands!*

After the incantation, the master visualizes black qi entering through the mouth and descending into the kidneys, distinctly.

Then visualize heart fire emerging from the crown, descending from the left. Next, visualize black qi rising from the Bubbling Springs on the right, until water and fire meet. In a trance-like state, they merge into a single mass; the adept draws it in and swallows it into the Primordial Palace, sensing a single gleaming red light within.

**Talisman Command Incantation**

Ravenous Wolf grasps evil, devours ghosts and consumes essence.

Spiritual officers patrol and inspect, listening for sounds to trace.
The Earth Gods of the Nine Provinces, each summoned by name.

**Execution of the Malevolent**

Slay and behead the wicked—no light offense.
The malevolent shall perish; the merciful shall live.
Sever heads, hack feet, pound their forms to dust.
Ghosts and demons annihilated, the human realm rests in peace.
Expel evil, cure illness—upon the talisman’s arrival, act without delay.
*Haste, haste, in accordance with the law’s command!*

**#1 *The Martial Spring Thunder Rite of the Great Year*:**
Transmitted by the Northern Emperor Zhen of the Tang and Song dynasties. The *Daoist Aid Compendium*, fascicles 246 and 247, includes the *Celestial Heart Earth Bureau Great Rites* and the *Northern Emperor Earth Bureau Marshal Yin’s Secret Transmission*, which share the same lineage. According to the preface by Peng Yuantai, written during the *Shouxian Chunyou Jiaxu* era in the *Celestial Heart Earth Bureau Great Rites*, this method’s founding patriarch, Liao Shouzhen, practiced the Great Cavern Rites and received a divine decree from the Northern Emperor, dispatching Marshal Yin Jiao to descend and protect his alchemical cultivation and Daoist propagation. With divine might resounding, the method was transmitted to the world, “none failing to prove efficacious.”

**#2 *The Dipper’s Mouth Mighty Divine Official Secret Rites***
**#3 *The Seventeen-Character Mighty Divine Official Secret Rites*:**
Transmitted by the Divine Empyrean lineage. The *Daoist Rites Compendium*, fascicles 222 to 226, includes the *Orthodox Unity Hūm Divine Official Fire Rhinoceros Great Immortal Summoning Secret Rites*, the *Highest Clarity Capital Marshal Ma’s Exorcism Secret Rites*, the *Golden-Armed Orb Light Fire Rhinoceros Great Immortal Orthodox Unity Divine Official Marshal Ma’s Exorcism Secret Rites*, the *Golden-Armed Orb Light Fire Rhinoceros Great Immortal Orthodox Unity Divine Official Marshal Ma’s Secret Rites*, the *Fire Rhinoceros Great Immortal Marshal Ma’s Divine Official Great Rites*, and the *Orthodox Unity Divine Official Marshal Ma’s Secret Rites*—all of which share the same lineage and may serve as references.

Fifth revolution: seize all improper demons, ghosts, and malevolent spirits—
those who hear my *qi* shall be slain,
those who hear my *qi* shall be destroyed.
Clasp the slaying mudra.

**Dispatching Incantation**:
Thunder-Commanding Great Spirit, Thunder-Envoys and Perfected,
City Gods and Earth Rectors, White Prime Lord,
Jade Bureau Immortals, Zhou Youzhen, and all spirits—
hasten like the radiance of sun and moon!
The lesser ghosts of the Six Heavens flee in terror.
Should any passage remain obstructed,
seize them and consign them to the Capital Thunder’s flames below.
Fire wheels and fire chariots blaze ceaselessly,
poisonous dragons and iron tigers patrol without end.
Swiftly, swiftly, obey the statutes of the Highest Divine Radiance True Sovereign.

**Secret Method of Thunder and Lightning, Earth’s Only #3**
**Commander-in-Chief**: Thunder and Lightning Earth Deity, Commander Wen Qiong.
Green-faced, with green beard and hair, golden headband,
long green kerchief, golden rings, green-and-white striped robe,
iron hat slung behind, iron armor, white silk trousers,
hemp-woven sandals, wielding an iron whip or bone mallet,
amidst thunder, fire, and lightning.
Above him, a thunder drum; a yellow-kerchiefed strongman,
half his body in the clouds, holds a yellow banner,
above which is the Thunder and Lightning Earth Deity Bureau.

**Summoning Incantation**:
*Om.*

"Hūmā hūní hōnglīdáluó, fly talisman, swiftly seize.
Eastern Yín: Mount Yue’s Jade Action, Lí’s command;

Sì’s decree, Chén’s summons: Kūn’s Wēn, Duì’s Qióng;
Mǎo: swiftly manifest the Highest True Sovereign’s form.
Wǔ: emerge! Swiftly, swiftly, as the statutes command.

This is called the Interlocking Dipper. It may be used in water, on talismans, or by a youth—grasp the Mǎo seal.

**Talisman of the Self’s Body:**
Right eye quakes the moon, left eye shakes the sun.
Wēn Qióng, obeying the Supreme Emperor’s decree,
mouth spews jade fangs towering ten thousand *zhàng*,
body clad in golden armor, luminous and spirit-seizing,
right hand wields a bronze mallet like thunder’s roar,
left hand grasps the world’s unrighteousness and casts down evil.
Right foot treads thunder and lightning, left foot treads Mount Tai.
Left and right, lightning flashes—ghosts have no escape.
The Five Sacred Emperors of the Marchmounts, as commanded, act.

Recite the talisman incantation:
*When the Northern Emperor holds power,
might and spirit are fierce.
Black horses gallop forth,
shaking heaven and earth into stillness.
Thunder Lords and thunderclaps,
lightning flashes bright.
Left and right, officers and soldiers,
swords and polearms like clouds.
Seize and bind ghosts and spirits—
those who defy me perish!
Swiftly, swiftly, obey the Supreme Emperor’s statutes and decrees!*

**For summoning the general:**
In searing flames, burn incense. With the sword mudra, trace the characters for "thunder" and "lightning" in the air above the incense smoke. Visualize within the smoke thunder rumbling and lightning flashing, a golden beam ascending—there appears Marshal Wēn, rising from the lightning, above the incense smoke. The adept gazes with both eyes, recites the *Northern Emperor Holds Power* incantation once, then issues the command. Visualize a great thunderclap shaking the void, Marshal Wēn descending from the incense smoke before the altar, his body ten *zhàng* tall, surrounded by dense azure clouds. With focused intent, write the talisman, dispatching and deploying him. With both hands, form the Thunder Bureau at the kidneys, channeling thunder to burst from the ears. Spray a mouthful of water, imagining the thunder’s roar driving him forth as the marshal departs through the air.

**Binding Incantation:**
*Wūchuò wūchuò.*"

**"Binding Spell of Wūdōng Soft Malevolence"**
*Wūdōng ruǎn shà chuò fùshù.*
*Chì Wēnqióng sù fù fèngxíng.*
*Jíjí rú lǜlìng.*

**Earth-Axis Stem Incantation and Mudra**
*Dìzhóu gāng, dìzhóu gāng.*
*Wind-Fire Mighty Spirit, swiftly turn your hand—press down with stone. Hasten!*
Clasp the Malevolence Talisman, draw the Northern *qi*.
*Chìlìng kuí gāng wēilíng sù shè.*
*One breath, twice repeated:*
*Míngméng míngméng hūn dùn yǐn tóng shè.*

*Yínwǔ dǒu.*
*First shake the primordial spirit, second seize the hawk spirit, third capture the hidden essence, fourth bind the radiant soul, fifth shake the Five Peaks.*
*Jíjí rú lǜlìng.*

**Sitting Meditation**
Ten thousand miles without a wisp of cloud,
the autumn sky holds a single moon.
Its reflection bathes the jade-green pool in cold—
above and below, both limpid and clear.
A spring surges from the Jade Dragon’s palace,
fire blazes in the Cinnabar Phoenix’s cave.
The Five *qi* merge in spontaneity,
a single pearl coalesces from this.
Auspicious light shines through to the depths,
a golden rainbow severs the center.
Push the carriage of Āxiāng—
faintly, thunder rumbles forth.
Bear me to Kunlun’s heights,
where the mid-heaven’s light gleams bright.
One who knows the heart-seal’s truth—
why need flying talismans or mudras?

**Internal Refinement Formula**
For internal refinement, first enter profound stillness, visualizing one’s body—inside and out—utterly unstained by a single speck of dust.
Next, visualize the two eyes: the right as the moon, the left as the sun, their light radiant and pure. Direct the twin luminaries to shine upon each other, converging at the kidneys, both equally limpid. Raise the murky, black *qi*-water of the kidneys upward, lower the blazing fire of the heart downward. When water and fire meet, circulate the Five Viscera’s five-colored *qi* to intermingle in the Primordial Cavity—the navel—fusing into a single pearl, amber-hued, resplendent in shifting hues. Press it down into the Cinnabar Field and guard it.

**Summoning and Attachment Formula**
For operational use, first form the Thunder Bureau with both hands, rub the Kidney Hall, and mobilize thunder to stir the *qi*, rising from either side of the navel like thunder’s roar.
The inner pearl of the Cinnabar Field ascends above the navel, revolving like a golden thread piercing the Posterior Heaven. The aperture within the kidneys—this pearl transforms into a golden light, a threefold entity within, leaping and glowing as if about to take flight. From the *Jiāchūn* point, it enters and ascends straight to the Wind Palace, then bursts forth from both eyes as golden light into the incense smoke, resembling a butterfly’s dance.
The adept’s gaze, left-turning and right-shifting, fixes clearly upon it.
Next, take a copper coin, fan, or paper money, clasp it in hand, and envelop it with this *qi*. Transfer it to the spirit-medium’s hands, seeing the threefold entity enter through the medium’s ears, eyes, mouth, and nose.
Recite the preceding incantations, then use the Thunder Bureau to trace the medium’s face. Blow a mouthful of Northern *qi* upon them. When the medium’s hands grow numb and paralyzed, seize the object from their grasp. Pass it once over the medium’s palm, then recite the Black Wind Incantation, visualizing it entering water.
With the left hand forming the Malevolence Talisman and the right the Sword Mudra, inscribe the Nine Characters in the air, swiftly reversing their order. Urgently recite the Roaring Incantation and the Iterative Character Incantation, drawing Northern *qi* to blow into the water. Dip the brush and write, visualizing black water churning, black *qi* billowing.
Next, lift the medium’s hands, baring their chest. The adept draws Northern *qi* and blows it beneath the medium’s feet, visualizing black *qi* rising in dense swirls to the waist. With the right hand’s Sword Mudra, part the medium’s face. Spray a mouthful of water, issue a command, and shout to the attending officers: bind them in black mist—a small infant appears at the top of the Cinnabar Field within.
Reunite them, visualizing the medium transformed into a ghostly form. If the spirit attaches, command the officers to administer ten lashes, then bind them with crossed restraints. Shout and roar distinctly, interrogating at will.
To awaken the soul, recite the *Yóu dǒu* incantation for soul-entry, the Sevenfold Veiling, and spray a mouthful of water. Visualize the ghostly form reverting to the medium’s original appearance. The adept’s left hand forms the Thunder Bureau, circling the medium’s Cinnabar Field seven times, while the right hand’s Sword Mudra rends upward from the Cinnabar Field. Visualize a thunderous roar in the medium’s heart, driving forth a golden orb. The adept inhales from the Cinnabar Field, and the medium’s crown awakens at once.

**The Thirty-Sixth Scroll of *Dharma Pearls from the Ocean of Methods* Concludes**
*Divine Empyrean Capital Commissioner, Golden Wheel Enforcer Marshal Zhào’s Talismanic Methods: Transmitted by the Orthodox Unity Tradition.*

From *The Compendium of Daoist Methods*, Scroll 232, *Secret Methods of the Orthodox Unity Mysterious Altar Marshal Zhào*:

Marshal Zhào’s personal name is Lǎng, styled Gōngmíng. A native of Mount Zhōngnán, he withdrew into the mountains during the Qín era to cultivate the supreme Dao. Upon perfecting his merit and conduct, he was summoned by the Jade Emperor’s decree to serve as Vice Marshal of the Divine Empyrean, assuming the offices of Direct Palace General, North Polar Attending Censor, and Supreme Commissioner of Imperial Mandates. Empowered to command the Three Realms, patrol the Five Directions, and oversee the Nine Provinces, he later received another edict to guard the Orthodox Unity Mysterious Altar during the Han Ancestral Celestial Master’s refinement of the Great Elixir.

His powers encompass driving thunder and dispatching lightning, summoning rain and calling winds, eradicating pestilence and severing malevolence, healing illness and averting calamity—none greater than the Marshal’s efficacy.

The following texts, collected in Scrolls 133, 240, and others of the same compendium—*Secret Methods of Mysterious Altar Marshal Zhào*, *Orthodox Unity Dragon-Tiger Mysterious Altar Golden Wheel Enforcer As-You-Will Secret Methods*, *Orthodox Unity Flying Tiger Supervisor Marshal Zhào’s Secret Methods*, *Orthodox Unity Dragon-Tiger Mysterious Altar Great Method*, *Mysterious Altar As-You-Will Great Method*, *Highest Clarity Harmonious Wonder Dao Illuminating Primordial Five-Thunder Mysterious Altar Great Method*, and *Orthodox Unity Mysterious Altar Marshal’s Six Yin Wild-Sleeve Dance Thunder Method*—all belong to the same lineage and may serve as corroborative references.

**The Heavenly Three Wind-Fire Lone Thunder Great Method**: Transmitted by the Orthodox Unity Tradition, this also derives from the lineage of Marshal Zhào Gōngmíng.

**Secret Methods of Thunder, Lightning, and Earth Deities**: Transmitted by the Orthodox Unity Tradition. According to *The Compendium of Daoist Methods*, Scroll 253, *Supplementary Discourse on Earth Deities*:

> The methods of the Earth Deity Bureau originated with the Vacuously Tranquil Celestial Master, then manifested through the transformations of Cave Master Wáng Zōngjìng of Tiānbǎo Cave, Perfected Officer Hào Dàoxiǎn of Qīngchéng, Immortal Liǔ Bóqí of Qīngzhōu, and Perfected Person Zhōng Míng of Guǒzhōu, who successively served as its custodial masters. Later, lineages such as Sū Dàojì’s branch, the Wēnzhōu Orthodox Lineage, Lǐ Péngtóu’s transmission, Guò Yàoqīng’s transmission, and the Xuánlíng Continuation flourished across Jiāng, Zhè, Mǐn, Shǔ, and the Hú-Guǎng regions—so numerous that their names cannot all be recorded. A thousand paths and ten thousand byways branched from a single source.

These methods thrived during the Sòng and Yuán periods. The texts *Secret Methods for Summoning Wēn Tàibǎo of Mount Dōngyuè* and *Great Method of Earth Deity Marshal Wēn*, collected in Scrolls 254–256 of the same compendium, likewise belong to this lineage and may serve as corroborative references.

**The Thirty-Seventh Scroll of *Dharma Pearls from the Ocean of Methods* Concludes**
*Purple Empyrean Protector Five-Thunder Black Tiger Marshal Liú’s Methods*

**Commander-in-Chief:** Purple Empyrean Protector, Five-Thunder Black Tiger Marshal Liú, styled Wénxiǎn. His visage is deep date-red, with large phoenix eyes and sparse whiskers. He wears an iron fish-tail crown, a black headscarf, and black wide-sleeved robes, with yellow cuff guards tied at the sleeves and a yellow sash cinching his waist. His white silk trousers are bound at the ankles, and he wears black shoes, gripping his wrists while carrying a short-handled iron mallet. A black tiger attends his side, and reverse flames coil downward from his waist, encircling his body as he rides upon golden flames and fiery clouds. Under his command are the Six Dīng and Six Jiǎ, the Five Thunders, the Eight Malevolents, and legions of celestial soldiers.

**Internal Alchemy:** When the ritual master performs the rites, they must first purify with wine and burn incense to invoke the divine presence. Assuming the *shàngzhí* stance, they form the *shà* mudra with the left hand and the sword mudra with the right, standing in the *dīng* position. They first recite the *Tàiyīn Huàshēng Zhòu* or the *Běifāng Xuántiān Zhòu*. They visualize within their *níwán* palace a radiant golden character *nì*, shining with luminous clarity. Next, they press the Thunder Formation firmly upon their heart, imagining the heart’s fire descending in reverse to the space between the two kidneys, stirring the primordial *qi* to surge upward. They then visualize within the heart an Upper Perfected One. Following this, they transform the primordial *qi* into crimson fiery *qi*, which ascends to the *níwán* palace, merging with the golden character to burst forth and ascend directly to the northern heavens. There, they behold the Marshal descending upon this fiery light into the void. The ritual master then briefly directs their gaze toward the *gèn* direction behind their elbow, where the earth splits open, and a black tiger emerges from the black mist. The master immediately forms the *yín* mudra and shouts the syllable *duō!*—whereupon the tiger prostrates itself before the right side of the altar. Seeing the tiger submit, the Great Marshal descends from the void and, accompanied by the tiger, awaits commands.

**Summoning Incantation:**
*"Black Tiger Great Spirit of Mount Wǔdāng,
Thunder roars to seize demonic spirits.
Leading three hundred thousand celestial soldiers,
The Dark Mist of the Mysterious Heavenly Emperor surges forth,
Mighty and fierce, manifesting divine power.
Six Dīng, Six Jiǎ, Eight Malevolent Generals—
Liú Wénxiǎn, hasten swiftly to the altar!
Great Spirit, Great Spirit, come with speed!
By the decree of the Teaching King, the Mysterious Heavenly Emperor!"*

For writing, anointing, consecrating, or dispatching talismans, use the preceding incantation. Visualize the three characters *wén duì shà*, then draw the *qi* of the Celestial Gate to proceed.

**Personal Talisman:** Inscribe *"Rescue Black Tiger Liú Wénxiǎn, Primordial Auspiciousness"* and anoint with the *Tiānsuì Zhòu*.

Inscribe the right-side talisman with the preceding incantations in a single stroke. Layer the three characters *yuán hài jí duì xǐ shà* above the *xuán* character. Recite with the mouth, trace with the hand, and visualize three golden characters. Next, inscribe the petitioner’s name, imbuing the talisman with intent. Then visualize the character *niè* descending from the void into the *xuán* space, drawing it into the talisman. Recite the twelve-character Thunder Sound Incantation to envelop it. When spirits hear this, they tremble as though struck by thunder. Chant in a low, guttural voice, then seal the talisman with the *chì* character. Apply the Eight Trigrams with a tooth-mark, and the master silently intones *one*, envisioning the talisman radiant with golden light.

**Attaching to the Medium**
First, inscribe three talismans.
Use one to summon and dispatch the marshaling generals,
Expressing the matter at will.
Prepare a basin of pure wood, recite the incantation while tracing the pattern,
Visualize the operation entering the water.
Have the child stand before the incense burner,
Sprinkle and purify.
Take one talisman, roll it into a ball,
And bury it within the incense burner.
Next, have the child close their eyes,
Fumigate their right hand over the incense.
The master swiftly recites the incantation while tracing the pattern,
Sprinkles the pure water onto the child’s hand,
Then presses another talisman into the burner.
After three to five repetitions,
The spirit naturally ascends—
Once the child’s fingers begin to stir,
Command the attending officer to turn their hand,
Grasp the brush, and report in writing.
The child must be literate.
If the possession is shallow, the spirit attaches to one arm only;
If deep, it fully ascends and writes.
Once the report is complete,
The child revives of their own accord,
No need to recite the awakening incantation.
If the spirit still does not attach,
Visualize a lady-in-waiting holding these golden characters,
Weeping over the incense smoke—
It will immediately come forth.

**Another School**
Commanding Marshal.

The Earth Deity of Mount Tai, the Illustrious Numinous and Radiant Martial Envoy, the Right-Assisting Marquis, Marshal Wen—named Qiong.
He wears a purple headscarf, has a green face, dons an official’s green wild-goose robe, black boots, and wields an iron whip.

**Internal Alchemy**
The master closes their eyes and visualizes a mountain on their right shoulder, enveloped in blue qi—this is the Court of Mount Tai. Next, with the left hand, they trace the Dipper of Chén and Xū, □□□□□□□, suspended in the void. They see the two stars Kuí and Chī transform into the celestial characters for "imperial decree," descending. The adept draws forth liver qi, exhales it over the incense, and it becomes a blue-robed youth holding a jade tablet. The youth receives the two golden characters onto the tablet, passes through Mount Tai, and with the golden light from the tablet, opens the gates of the mountain. Marshal Wen follows the blue-robed youth, riding the golden light as they arrive. The adept inhales through the nose, drawing them both into the liver palace. After a long while, the adept exhales over the incense smoke, and Marshal Wen manifests in full form. The adept then focuses their intent, draws the divine radiance from Marshal Wen’s body, and begins to inscribe the talisman.

The master next employs the Dipper mudra and the Sword mudra, recites the Northern Dark Heaven incantation and the Great Yin Transformation incantation, and visualizes the transformation into a perfected transcendent. Then they recite the summoning incantation:

*"By the Fire Mandate of Qian, united with luminous majesty,

*"Dīng, Rén, Guǐ, Xùn—gather essence like an arrow,

Each incantation is recited seven times in a single breath. The master traces the Mǎo trigram, draws forth eastern qi, and upon completion, silently visualizes the transformation into a perfected transcendent, secretly directing the proceedings.

**Commander-in-Chief:**

**Oath:**
Fierce thunderbolt spirits,
Whose might shakes the Nine Celestial Courts.
Moving within the Three Realms,
Loyally serving the Imperial Lord,
Your form surges a thousand *zhang* high.
Titled the honored one of the Thunder Division,
You command all thunder departments.
Wind Earls and Rain Masters,
Thunderclap and Lightning Mothers,
Mighty Yaksha spirits,
Who uphold Heaven’s mandate at left and right,
Assisting the Five Thunder Lords.
I act by the Jade Emperor’s decree,
Able to save the people of the world.
When I dispatch you to the heavenly realms,
You present petitions to the Imperial Lord.
When I dispatch you to the earthly prisons,
You proceed straight to the Dark Palace.
When I dispatch you to the watery palaces,
You proceed straight to the Fusang Palace.
When I dispatch you to seize demons,
You shatter all ghostly encampments.
When I dispatch you to relieve great drought,
You send down ceaseless rains.
When I dispatch you to halt wind and rain,
Wind and rain instantly cease.
When I dispatch you to heal the sick,
The sick find peace.
When I dispatch you to aid difficult births,
Mother and child safely part.
When I dispatch you to attack afflicted bodies,
In an instant, the wind-wheel is swept away.
If you remain with me to the end,
You shall become a minister of the Jade Emperor.
Should you violate Heaven’s laws,
Nine generations will suffer poisonous punishment.
If I betray you,
In Heaven, sun and moon will darken;
On Earth, springs will dry;
Grass and trees will cease to grow.
Forever a ghost of the netherworld,
Unable to ascend to the Supreme Clarity.

On *Ren-Gui* days, when I descend,
You must diligently uphold this.
Offer pure tea and jujube broth,
Burn peachwood incense.
I manifest at your left and right,
Set your heart at ease—do not fear.
Together we vow a great oath,
To save all living beings.
If you uphold this without negligence,
Together we shall ascend on purple clouds.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed!*

**The Peerless Severing Character: A Numinous Script**
The Perfected Master declares:
When the Three Powers were divided, the myriad things took form.
When the Three Powers transform, the myriad things are stored.
Thus, *yi* becomes *xin*, and *xin* becomes *yi*.
*Yi* in *you* is *yi-you*;
*xin* in *mao* is *xin-mao*.
Wood’s life begins in *hai* and flourishes in *yin*.
Fire’s life begins in *yin* and flourishes in *si*.
Metal’s life begins in *si* and flourishes in *shen*.
Water’s life begins in *shen* and flourishes in *zi*.
*Ren* resides in *hai*, *gui* in *zi*—
thus both can engender in *zi*.
Since Heaven’s One engenders Water,
and Earth’s Two engenders Fire,
fire flourishes in *si*,
and *qian* reaches *xun* to complete its six strokes.
From One to Nine is Heaven, yang, the sovereign.
From Two to Ten is Earth, yin, the minister.
*Yi* becomes *xin*—
thus the character’s stroke from One to *si*
is where the myriad things are divided and completed.
Within *si* lies *xin*—hence the surname *Xin*.
Two is the minister—thus called Heaven’s Minister.
*Han* is the pivot; *chen* is the mechanism.
What cannot be fathomed is the pivot-mechanism.
