By decree of the Jade Emperor of the Highest Heavens—*as the law commands!*

**Right Talisman:** Once inscribed, re-enter the characters *Ān* (安), *Qǐ* (起), *Zhì* (治), and *Shōu dú* (收毒). Infuse the five *qi* into the talisman, then apply them with upward motion.

For **settling the earth**, recite: *"Each guards its forbidden boundary, firmly securing the directions."*
For **excavating the earth**, recite: *"At the talisman’s arrival, all swiftly retreat; upon completion of the day’s work, return to guard the forbidden directions."*
For **the afflicted**, recite: *"Withdraw the earth’s poison and *qi* from the sufferer’s body, restore life, transform misfortune into fortune, and turn calamity into blessing."*

The master visualizes the Supreme Emperor descending golden light into the talisman.

**Decree the talisman with this incantation:**
*Issuing from the Central Ancestor,
The stems Wù and Jǐ belong to earth.
A hundred evils dare not approach,
Ten thousand things all scatter.
The Nine Luminaries conceal my body,
The Yellow River flows backward.
In the three winters, leaves wither yellow,
All spirits return in submission.
Earth Mansion’s deities guard me,
I ride the Dipper and Ox’s mouth,
Demonic essences flee the eight directions.
Lesser ghosts, knowing me,
Dare not provoke my wrath.
When I open my eyes and gaze,
Ten thousand malevolent forces retreat.
I decree from the Central Palace:
All things must hide.
The divine seal shines once,
And what lies beneath turns to blood.
Oṃ! Rā! Great Fire Light Dhāraṇī—seize and command!
Swiftly, swiftly, as the law decrees!*

**Dispatch the talisman with this incantation:**
*Heaven is round, earth is square,
Six pitch-pipes, nine chapters.
Heaven has nine stars,
Earth has nine virtues.
The talisman subdues earth,
Earth’s malevolent forces perish.
Six Jiǎ and six Yǐ—command earth to withdraw.
Settle and raise six Bǐng and six Dīng—command earth to halt.
Dispatch and settle six Wù and six Jǐ—command earth to cease.
Settle and raise six Gēng and six Xīn—earth’s *qi* yields no contest.
Six Rén and six Guǐ—earth’s *qi* purifies itself.
Settle and raise Earth Lord, Earth Mother,
Earth’s goblins and spirits—I know your names.
At the talisman’s arrival, if treating illness, recite: *"Withdraw all inauspicious spirits and malevolent forces, swiftly depart the sufferer’s body."*
For **settling the earth**, recite: *"Each guards its post, refraining from recklessly causing disaster or harming the living."*
For **excavating the earth**, recite: *"Swiftly retreat for a time; upon completion of the work, return to your stations. Do not cause disturbance or offense. Urgently follow the talisman’s command without delay. To defy this decree is to rebel against the Highest Clarity."*
*Swiftly, swiftly, as the Jade Emperor’s law decrees!*

**Method for treating illness:** Use large green paper, inscribe in cinnabar, and present in a square box. Perform the earth-settling rites as prescribed to withdraw the earth’s *qi* from the patient’s body. Alternatively, use peach or catalpa wood, strip one side of bark, inscribe the talisman, and nail it before the patient’s bed.

**For excavating earth:** Inscribe the talisman on large yellow paper. If the offense is grave, perform the requisite sacrificial rites to commence.

**For settling the earth:** Inscribe the talisman on large paper and perform the sacrificial rites to settle it.

Alternatively, create talismans for the five directions and recite: *"The Great Dao is fundamentally empty; where do spirits and malevolent forces exist? Move east to act as west, move south to act as north, move above to act as below, move below to act as above. Heaven overturns, earth upends—all spirits and malevolent forces must swiftly flee!"*
*Swiftly, swiftly, as the law decrees!*

*#1 Secret Methods of the Fengdu Western Terrace’s Radiant Spirit, Slayer of Demons, Pass Marshal of the Primordial*

**Commander-in-Chief:** The Fengdu Grand Virtue-Power, Heaven-Uniting, Earth-Governing, Radiant Spirit, Ghost-Slaying, Demon-Subduing Great General, Pass Marshal of the Primordial—personal name *Yu*, style *Yunchang*. He wears a green silk headwrap with long ties, his face the hue of deep jujubes, phoenix eyes, a flowing beard; clad in an official robe of green with wild-goose embroidery, his armor exposed at the chest, green-hung boots, riding a red horse, wielding a great blade.

**Internal Alchemy:**
For spirit refinement, first close the *qi* and draw in the *qi* of the northeast, then blow it forth. Next, visualize the northeast direction behind the elbow transforming into Fengdu Mountain, where a cavern appears, black *qi* surging within. Silently recite the mantra while forming the *Thirteen Golden Mudras*, then approach Marshal Guan. He emerges with blade in hand, leading his host; inhale and refine the *qi* into the heart, directing it downward to the inner kidneys. Close the *qi* and refine it, transmuting it into a golden character □. The practitioner tightly contracts the perineum, presses the knees together, and lifts this golden character upward with a breath, offering incense. When the Marshal fully manifests, the practitioner presses the left thumb upon the *sì* trigram, inscribing the Twenty-Eight Constellations to form the *Golden Numinous Character*, then flicks it forth to command and deploy at will.

Next, recite the secret mantra:
*Oṃ.*

"Slay the heavens at *chǒu*, hasten the *zǐ* of earth at *duì*, swiftly seize at *lí*. At *wǔ*, emerge—*Oṃ.* At *zǐ*, *hōng*; at *chǒu*, *hōng*. Within the central □, *duì* roars, *kūn* hastens, swiftly seize at *lí*. At *wǔ*, emerge.

The talisman of one’s own body—
The wrathful, thunderous might of Water’s essence-soul,
The radiant, numinous majesty of Fire’s true essence,
Marshal Guan of the Northern Capital,
Heroic and fierce,
With fifty million troops,
Banners arrayed in ranks—
Swiftly descend in divine might to annihilate demonic thieves!
Pursue them to the Eight Extremes, through the fourfold gloom of twilight,
With frost-edged swords and keen blades, sever ghosts and erase their traces.
Where evil exists, eradicate it; where ghosts lurk, strike them down!
By the Northern Emperor’s decree and the Eastern Peak’s command,
Heaven-shaking, earth-encompassing, retribution is clear and manifest.
Radiant Numinous General, swiftly descend to Fengdu’s camp,
Brandishing your blade, astride your steed, to slay ghosts!
Come forth in submission—ghosts who obey shall not be slain;
ghosts who resist shall be obliterated in form.
The slightest defiance or delay is rebellion against the Highest Clarity.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as the statutes and decrees command!*

Four Slaying Talismans: □□□□□□□ *zǐ-wǔ* Dipper □ (□□□□□ *yín-wǔ* Ox,
Horn, Neck, Root, Chamber, Heart, Tail, Winnowing Basket, Dipper, Ox, Maiden, Void, Danger, House, Wall, Straddler, Harvester, Stomach, Pleiades, Net, Turtle Beak, Triaster, Well, Ghost, Willow, Star, Spread, Wings, Axletree.
Heavenly thunder rumbles low, dragon and tiger converge in charge,
Heaven-shaking, earth-dragging, resounding with crystalline clarity.
Year-slaying, month-slaying, day-slaying, hour-slaying—
all ghosts and spirits self-slay, slay!

White Emperor *na-gōu*, Emperor *na-xī*, *xī-na-lóu-lóu*, *tǎn-na-dī* (□ *na-bá-tóu*, *na-bá-na-shè*—
*Oṃ hōng hōng* □ *zhī-dì tú-sū-cha*, *hē ruò-mì-cha*, *wū-dū-cha*, *jù-qí-cha*, *bō-nài-dì-cha*, *yē-wēi-ruò-cha*, *jù-luó-dì-cha*, *qí-mó-cha*, *svāhā*!
Decree to slay and seize! The incantation before the talisman is called *Qī-nà-bā-cha*, also known as the *Northern Emperor’s Heart Mantra*.

Recite the preceding *Thirteen Golden Character Mantra*, visualizing the general’s entry.
The Dipper turns, the *Big Dipper’s Handle* thunders, slaying and seizing—
proceed in accord with heaven, thunderously slaying earth,
seizing with the might of lightning!

Next, recite the *Celestial Encounter Mantra* and apply the decree to the talisman.
Once the talisman is complete, draw in the northern *qi* and blow upon it.

*Mantra for Inscribing the Talisman:*
Black smoke, black poison, mobilize yin essence.
*Thrust at wǔ, zǐ, Dipper*—black smoke, black.
*Thrust at zǐ, wǔ, Dipper*—slaying talisman."

The talisman on the right is sealed with *qi*, inscribed in a single stroke. Next, draw forth the *qi* of one’s own killing force. Then gather the *qi* from behind the elbow, visualizing the space behind the elbow as Mount Fengdu, towering and grim, shrouded in dense black *qi*. The marshal lies concealed within—inhale and blow upon the talisman.

*Mantra for Inscribing the Talisman:*
One *qi* transforms into virtue, water and fire seize essence.
Yang moves, yin responds—myriad spirits take form.
Crimson *qi* lingers, black smoke coils thick.
Grant me penetrating vision, piercing spirit to essence.
Summoned, they arrive at once, heeding the command to welcome.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by law and ordinance!

Once the talisman is inscribed with the above mantra, visualize it glowing golden and proceed to the *Gen* direction to summon the marshal. Within the adept, the water of the kidneys and the fire of the heart clash fiercely, forming crimson and black *qi*, which gathers in the gallbladder, exits through both eyes, and is directed into the talisman.

Next, recite the *Decree Mantra*:
Great Unity divine talisman, wondrous and spiritually potent.
Heavenly soldiers, heavenly soldiers—decree to restrain ghosts and bandits!
Protect all beings, subdue mountain demons and evil rebels.
Rain torrents, lightning bolts—malevolent spirits and corpse-possessors cower.
Rouse the divine encampment, execute and slay demonic evil.
Above stand the Seven Stars, governing demons and meting out punishment.
As is, in accordance with the Great Clarity.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by law and ordinance!

*Urgent Summoning Mantra:*

Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Northern Dipper’s law and ordinance!

*Personal Mantra:*
*Fēi-fēi-lī-lī*, Lord Guan, fierce and mighty, wields his keen blade,
startling demons at dawn.
At my call, descend swiftly to the altar.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Jade Emperor’s law and ordinance!

Once the above mantras are complete, employ this method to possess the medium silently and without disturbance—capture and attachment occur at once. The master visualizes heaven and earth plunged into darkness, sun and moon eclipsed, imagining the black *qi* of the north surging forth. The marshal arrives at the altar, standing above the incense. Inhale deeply, drawing the *qi* into the cinnabar field, then blow it onto the medium’s face, eyes, and ears.

**Swift Talisman of the Galloping Steed for Divination by Direction**
*East:* The affliction will immediately heal.
*West:* The condition is incurable.
*South:* Malevolent spirits are present.
*North:* The Earth God has been offended.
*Northeast:* Urgent harm from evil spirits.
*Southeast:* The wicked shall perish.
*Southwest:* No trouble.
*Northwest:* A vow is held in the Celestial Bureaus; upon fulfillment and thanksgiving, all will be well.
*Sudden rise and fall:* Violent affliction beyond remedy.
*Passing through the beam:* A vow may be required before the Mountain Spirit.
*Adhering to the roof ridge:* The Dragon Spirit stirs without a vow.
*Talisman turns with paper money:* The Mountain Goblin Spirit stirs with a vow.
*Talisman ignites with a roar:* The gods are enraged.
*Talisman fails to rise:* The Six Spirits are unsettled, or the general does not move.

**Method for Invocation:**
Upon arrival of the general, take one *jia-ma* (talismanic steed), inscribe the talisman, and arrange it in the four directions. Pile spirit money before the altar, placing it upon paper. Summon the general. When the intention is complete, invoke the general thus:

*"For the afflicted, whether by malevolent spirits or illness, life or death—let the flying talisman reveal!"*

Then ignite the talisman with fire and command the general’s scribe to report the response clearly.

Marshal Meng, Yuan Shuai, named E—human in form, with a fierce ghostly visage and a beard, a yellow headwrap, a black robe, iron armor, white-knotted trousers, and yellow leather shoes. He holds a short-handled golden hammer, and flames erupt from his body.

Marshal Che, Yuan Shuai, named Zeng—with the head of a black water buffalo, iron breastplate armor, a red divine robe, divine leopard-skin trousers, and yellow leather shoes. He grips an iron trident, and flames erupt from his body.

Marshal Xia, Yuan Shuai, named Xin—with the head of a red horse, iron breastplate armor, a black divine robe, divine tiger-skin trousers, and yellow leather shoes. He wields a hemp-bound saw-bladed knife, and flames erupt from his body.

Marshal Lie, Yuan Shuai, named Kai—human in form, with a fierce ghostly visage, a yellow headwrap, a black robe, iron armor, white-knotted trousers, and yellow leather shoes. In his left hand, he holds an iron cangue; in his right, an iron hammer. Flames erupt from his body.

Marshal Sang, Yuan Shuai, named Tong—human in form, with a fierce ghostly visage, a yellow headwrap, a black robe, iron armor, white-knotted trousers, and yellow leather shoes. He carries an iron chain, and flames erupt from his body.

The Jade Maiden of Nocturnal Radiance—with twin coiled buns, dressed as a blue-robed jade maiden—holds a luminous pearl, and flames erupt from her body.

The Five Great Demon Emperors—appearing as Dragon-Tiger Lords, armored generals in golden mail—grasp five-colored divine banners. Above, fire-spewing hawks take flight; below, bronze serpents and iron hounds exhale flames, all shrouded in black clouds and mist.

**Summoning Incantation and Death Warrant of the Northern Qi:**
*"Xi, Gong, Jian, E—Numinous Lords of the Jade Emperor. Together with the Four Generals, bind and interrogate gods and ghosts. At my call, descend with haste!"*
*Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the Fengdu Interrogation Decree!*

**Poetic Formula for Mixed Application:**
*"Two Dipper stars divide the execution decree’s song,
Two forms emerge to enter and rebuke.
When the heart-moon shines bright, the waist is the master—
The master ascends directly past the Mud Pill Palace.
Face front and fix the root position,
The Eight Generals encircle the altar in unbroken ranks.
Add Jiao and Zeng at the ear’s base,
Inspect the law, execute the sentence, and command with the mouth’s decree."*

**Method of Application:**
Press the tongue against the upper palate and gaze upward toward the crown.

Recite the Lesser Summoning Incantation, cross hands and press downward, gaze upward with both eyes, and visualize a skull. Draw pure qi through the nose and lift the "Golden Well." Inhale one breath of pure qi into the Cinnabar Field, envisioning oneself as the Master—crimson-haired, indigo-bodied, clad in black robes, or bare, seated in the Nine Uglies posture, a skull crowning the head, enveloped in a shroud of black mist.

Next, visualize the red and black qi of the two kidneys intertwining to form a golden talisman at the center, flanked by two generals on the left and right, with the Great General before and behind. Gently sway the paired passes of the spine, circulating the qi upward to the Mud Pill Palace. The Mystic Pearl emerges from the Kunlun summit. Envision the talisman ascending from the crown, the two generals emerging from the left and right eyes, while the remaining six generals issue from the other orifices to stand before the altar.

Internally apply the method in Crane Posture: first exhale the turbid qi from the mouth, dispersing it to the northeast, where it transforms into Mount Fengdu, beneath which lie six caverns encircled by seawater. Then cross hands at the flanks in the Execution Mudra, visualizing nine coiled serpents writhing before the adept. Envision the adept seated upon the serpents, eyes closed, perceiving a bright moon within the heart illuminating the kidneys below. As the kidney water and heart moon merge in radiance, the inner landscape unfolds—within the Fengdu Palace, azure and white qi intermingle, predominantly azure with traces of black. The Mystic Qi ascends from the spine to the crown, transmuting into the Eight Generals, who emerge from the adept’s eyes, ears, mouth, and nose to stand above.

Next, cross hands and press the legs, visualizing the qi of the Bubbling Springs—white on the left, black on the right—issuing from the Shoulder Wells to manifest Jiao and Zeng at the ears, flanking the left and right shoulders. When the adept opens their eyes, their body has transformed into the Perfected Lord Wei, coiled atop the nine serpents. Silently recite the incantation seven times, envisioning the external landscape of Fengdu’s generals converging from the execution qi. The adept swiftly forms the Sword Mudra with both hands, sweeping downward to gather the generals into one, arraying them before the altar. With focused intent, command and dispatch them to their tasks.

**Secret Incantation:**
*"By the decree of the Dark Netherlord, the Numinous Officer, Perfected Lord Wei.
Jiao and Zeng, Water and Fire, emerge from the Yang Ford.
Above, they bear the Emperor’s mandate; below, they succor ghostly souls.
O Black Spirits, Black Saints, malevolent ghosts and wicked sprites—
Aerial curses, earthly rebels—
Dispatch the Ox-Head Officers, summon the Yaksha deities.
Whether distant or near, whether old or new,
Nilu blazes with Fire, Zi-Wu channels Metal with Mo.
Wu-Wei whistles with Wind, Wei-Si hisses with Water.
Si-Zi, the Yin-Yang Generals and Officers—
When Zi passes Xu, the Sword Mudra is formed, sweeping them downward.
Seize and deliver them to the Dark Nether, swiftly as the Yaksha’s heart-seizing writ!"*

Seven repetitions.
**General Talisman Record.**

**Heavenly Decree of the Vast Sky:**
By the mandate of the Celestial Dipper, the Heavenly Officers and Generals, the Earthly Yin Soldiers, and the Water Bureau that governs the myriad spirits—
The Edict of Fengdu’s Great Emperor is issued.
Jiao Zhongqing deploys his left array to bind and seize gods;
Zeng Yuanxi commands his right formation to fetter ghosts.
Fengdu’s soldiers execute them from the front,
while the demon-slaying troops punish them from behind.
Liu Sheng drives forward with golden eyes to bite,
Shi Pin dispatches venomous serpents to burn from the rear.
Zhao Zhengxiang pierces through the hearts of ghosts,
Ma [◯] captures bird-spirits and forces them to reveal their names.
Seize the ghosts—swiftly proceed!
Bind the ghosts—swiftly proceed!
Shackle the ghosts—swiftly proceed!
Torture the ghosts—swiftly proceed!
Zeng Xiao severs ghostly heads,
Ma Zai clamps down on ghostly feet.
Heavenly cords, earthly cords, cords of years, months, days, and hours—
bind them and press them down to the depths of Fengdu.
Wei Xi, Liu Yin, Wang Jian, Meng E, Che Zeng, Xia Xin, Lie Kai, and Sang Tong—
descend from the Gate of Heaven, emerge from the Earthly Portal.

**Edict, Talisman, and Incantation:**
The Northern Yin of Fengdu records all ghosts and spirits.
With legions numbering in the thousands and tens of thousands, the Eight Directions connect to the numinous.
It gathers the living and the dead, examines and summons ghostly souls.
All obey the talismanic command to seize and slay ghosts.
Banish them from the body, attach them to the body, annihilate their forms—
swiftly, swiftly, as the law of the Northern Emperor of the Great Yin decrees!

**General Talisman:**
Xi Yin, Jian E—
the Five Emperor Spirit Lords,
along with the Four Generals—
Wind spirits, hasten to arrive! Earth spirits, hasten to depart!
Peck at Kan, shriek at Kun, □ at Zhen, chirp at Xun, center at Qian, benefit at Dui—
Edict to Gen to seize, Li to expel!
Swiftly pursue, swiftly capture, swiftly bind—
regardless of great or small, close or distant, be they gods, ghosts, malevolent spirits, or essences—
hasten to drive them forth, urgently manifest their forms!
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Fengdu Examination and Summons Decree commands!

**Recite the incantation, anoint and visualize the generals entering:**
The Great Demon of the Yellow Heaven,
Xia Xin and Che Zeng recite the urgent pursuit—
swiftly seize, swiftly bind—
the incantation reaches the Northern Emperor’s *Kuigang* Great Edict to slay and capture!

**Slaying Text of the Northern Qi:**
**Incantation Formula:**
Black *ya* of Wind and Xun, cold Kan of ice,
Zhen’s edict, Li’s capture, Dui’s ghost, Yin’s seizure.
Kun emerges—

**Edict, Talisman, and Incantation.**

*Bālóní shànjiā ní nàjué shèjì ní □ lóu hē chī lóu nǎ □ lāng yǔn jiū jiā pó jié ní.* Swiftly, swiftly, as the Northern Emperor’s *Kuigang* Great Edict commands to slay and capture!

To the right, the Moon’s *Taiyin* spirits; to the left, the Sun’s *Taiyang* gods.
The Twenty-Eight Constellations encircle the heavens, their stellar slayers aligned—
sealed by the Fengdu Great Emperor’s decree.
The Three Primordial Heavenly Lords, the Four Sagely Rotating Slayers enact their will.

proclaim to the Nine Hell Wardens: hasten to descend!
*Oṃ chílín mó dá oṃ mó lín dá lín hūṃ tà suōhē.*

**Edict, Talisman, and Incantation:**
Heavenly Perfected Generals, Earthly Armored Gods,
Fengdu’s fierce marshals, blazing and valiant spirits—

East to Fusang, south to Jambudvīpa, west to Maṇi, north to Uttarakuru—
far across the Four Great Continents, near within the span of a square inch.
Hasten to seize and bind the malevolent ghosts causing calamity!
Greatly display your power, respond according to the law.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Purple Tenuity of the North Pole commands,
as the Fengdu Great Emperor’s statutes decree!

**Seal of Submission (fragmentary):**
□□□□□□□.
To the right, employ the sword mudra, inscribe in water.
□□□.
At the *hài-zǐ* hour.

**Method:**
Use the sword mudra to inscribe in water.
Next, draw the black wind from the *gèn* direction into the water,
visualize golden characters surging within it.
First, sweep the seated generals into the golden paper,
then have a youth hold it upright.
Next, visualize the □ character on the youth’s face,
the □ character at his navel,
the □ character at his feet.
With a sleeve, obscure his face—
only the sun’s light in his left eye,
the moon’s light in his right,
starlight between his brows.
Clasp the *hài* mudra, inhale, and plunge into darkness—
only the preceding characters remain visible.
Next, visualize a small child in yellow robes within his navel,
emerging from his crown.
The adept clasps the *zǐ* mudra and inhales—
only the □ character remains.
Next, visualize between the youth’s kidneys:
white *qi* emerges from his left toe like clouds.
The adept clasps the central mudra, sweeps with his foot—
the *qi* disperses like mist.
The adept inhales it—
only the □ character remains.
Swiftly inhale the slaying *qi*, fiercely blow upon the youth,
issue the command.
Visualize seven black *qi* characters threading from his nose to his navel—
see the youth in darkness, ghostlike.
If he does not submit, add the eight-character talisman.

**Method:**
Visualize the black waters of the Northern Sea surging forth,
inhale them through the teeth, exhale with a hiss—
visualize ten thousand shards of freezing ice.
Inhale the water, spray it into the air—
visualize eight golden talismanic characters arrayed in black mist,
descending to shroud the youth from sight—
only the eight golden characters remain visible above.
Next, recite the edict-incantation:
The Ten Gods of *Taiyi* govern the Ghost Gate.
Fengdu’s *Jiàn’è* and the Five Peaks summon souls.
The black waters of the Northern Abyss—hasten to descend!
Swiftly, swiftly, as the statutes decree.

**Procedure for Practice:**
In all practices, first use one talisman to seal and summon the deluded spirit,
dispatch the generals to completion.
Next, take three paper money offerings, scatter and place them by the incense burner and water vessel.
The adept faces the paper money, sits in proper meditation,
enters deep concentration, and sweeps them into the paper money—
have the youth hold it before the altar and perform the rite.
Next, spray black water once to shroud and fell the youth.
Then command the paper money to be set down,
recite the generals’ summoning incantation,
shout the order for the officials to press the malevolent spirit into the body,
interrogate and compel it to state its purpose.
If delayed, take the *jiǎmǎ* command talisman,
rewrite the general talisman atop it to hasten completion.
Press the malevolent spirit into the bottle-prison,
or prepare a document to dispatch it.
**Incantation to Awaken the Soul:**
Primordial Lord, Primordial Lord—
the three *hún* and radiant *hún*.
The spirit-soul returns to its rightful place,
swiftly re-enter the human body!
Swiftly, swiftly, as the statutes decree.
Visualize the adept absorbing the youth’s three lights—
the yellow *qi* below, the white *qi* within—
into one’s own cinnabar field.
When the matter concludes, visualize golden light,
lift and return it to the youth,
restoring his spirit.
Pat his crown, call his name—
he will immediately awaken.
Next, silently recite:
Heavenly Numinous Splendor, may you preserve long life.
The Supreme Mystery’s One guards the true form.
The Five Viscera’s Spirit-Lords each preserve peace.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the statutes decree.

**Rite of the Summoned Dead’s *Gang***

Having completed the *Gang* to the right, I lead the Three Lights into the Kan Palace, pacing the Eight Trigrams to Xun, then retracing my steps along the Three Terraces. Facing the Gate of Heaven, I memorialize the Supreme Unity, await the decree, and recite the Supreme Unity’s invocation eighty-one times. Stepping four times through the Seven Stars... toward the Earthly Portal, I command the Jade Maiden of Nocturnal Radiance and the Five Thearchs’ Great Demons to bear banners and shatter the prison, visualizing the departed soul’s release from confinement.

**Incantation to Summon the Jade Maiden of Nocturnal Radiance:**
Oṃ. Śikālīṃ dikā diye.

Visualize the azure *qi* within the gallbladder transforming into a green-robed jade maiden, pearl in hand, emerging from the left eye to illuminate and breach the dark prison.

**Incantation to Summon the Five Thearchs’ Great Demons:**
Oṃ. Jvalu panka daye.

Visualize the white *qi* within the lungs transforming into a golden-armored general, grasping a five-colored treasure banner, pointing directly at the prison gate to guide the departed soul out.

Having performed the above method, recite the Golden Light Incantation and weave it into a golden bridge to receive the deceased. Absorb the banner’s essence or attach it to the youth’s body, proceeding as desired.

swiftly conceal my form, assume your shape.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the statutes decree.

Now, as incense is offered, I invoke and summon:

Let each grasp their implements of incarceration, array themselves to left and right, and heed my command.

Follow me wherever I go to seize and bind spirits. By my ritual command, proceed first to hang and bind them, interrogate their circumstances, and subject them to lawful torture and examination. Bind them swiftly and bring them forth.

Hasten to obey!

**Fengdu Interrogation and Summons Ritual Statutes.**

The summons complete, form the *sha* mudra and draw the *qi* of the North.

**Method of Merit:**
*"The Azure Moon illumines the frigid pool."*

*Oṃ kṣi jī fù* [□□□] *she.* (Recite the incantation seven times.)

Draw one breath of Northern *qi*, swallow it into the heart, and transform it into a bright moon. Let it descend to illuminate the kidney-water, a limpid pool where water and moon intermingle. Within the moon appears a palace, inside which is a [□] character. Raise it forth, and from the two eyes it emerges, splitting into two generals who stand to left and right. The adept commands the Nine Ugly Ones to serve them.

*"Black winds blow through the Xun gate."*

*Oṃ zhā zhuó jī* [□] *tuō* [□] *lī* [□] *sha she.* (Recite the incantation seven times.)

Draw Northern *qi* and take several hundred paper coins. Visualize within the golden-black radiance a [□] character emerging from the northeast. Inhale it through the eyes, transforming it into golden light that issues forth to inscribe a talisman on paper. Have a youth hold it before and behind, tracing the characters in the air to bind the target.

*"Golden essence flies behind the elbow."*

*Oṃ jī lú* [□] *luó yín* [□] *chì sha she.* (Recite the incantation seven times.)

Visualize the ground behind the left elbow. Fix the gaze upon it and, with a sword, cleave it open. Behold black winds surging forth bearing the character *shān*. Inhale them into a water vessel, where they transform into a black mist that envelops the youth.

*"Inverted gold hangs above the well."*

*Oṃ* [□] *líng tuō ní tí chì sha she.* (Recite the incantation seven times.)

Draw one breath of Northern *qi* and swallow it into the cinnabar field of the kidney-water. Within it lies the character *shā*. Raise it to the two eyes, where it transforms into all the generals, who emerge before the altar to be dispatched for interrogation and torture.

*"Wind and thunder strike the earthen gate."*

*Oṃ yín shén tā shén sha shén dì she.* (Recite the incantation seven times.)

Draw one breath of Southern *qi* and swallow it into the heart, where it transforms into a sun’s radiance. Raise it to meet the kidney-water, and the body grows cold as ice. From the spine’s twin passes it ascends, employing the thunder wheel. Roll it past the kidneys and through both ears, producing the sound of wind and thunder. A [□] character emerges, cast forth with the thunder wheel to smash open the earthen gate. Summon the marshals and functionaries of Prefect Ai’s department to capture, pursue, and seize, exterminating great malevolences.

**Next, recite the Binding and Attachment Incantation Formula:**

**Method for Activating the Command Tablet and Seal:**
The master first visualizes behind the left elbow, directing the gaze with both eyes. From the nose issue white and black *qi*; turning the head, observe the right elbow, where a stream of black *qi* rises to meet it. Perceive the rushing wind, inhale it, and hold it within.

Blow onto the seal and command tablet forty-nine times.

If employing a youth as medium, combine this *qi* with one breath of Northern *qi* and inhale it to spray onto the youth.

*Precious Pearl from the Sea of Ritual, Scroll Thirty-Nine, Concluded*
*#1 "Secret Methods of Fengdu’s Western Terrace, the Bright Spirit Exterminator Marshal of the Pass of Primordial Qi": Transmitted by the Northern Emperor’s Lineage.*

*The Orthodox Anthology of Daoist Methods, Scroll 259, "Secret Methods of the Earth Spirits’ Exterminator Marshal of the Pass of Primordial Qi"* states: This is the great method by which Zhang Xujing, the thirty-sixth Celestial Master of the Northern Song’s Chongning era, commanded the divine spirit of Guan Yu to slay dragons and subdue demons—henceforth known as the *Ancestral Method of Slaying Dragons and Exterminating Demons*. Thus, Zhang Xujing is revered as the ancestral master. *The same work, Scroll 26*, records *The Secret Methods of Fengdu’s Bright Spirit Marshal of the Pass of Primordial Qi*, which belongs to the same lineage and may serve as corroborating evidence.

*#2 "Secret Methods of the Supreme Clarity Fengdu General Records Bureau": Transmitted by the Northern Emperor’s Lineage.*

*The Orthodox Anthology of Daoist Methods, Scrolls 262 and 263*, which collect *The Great Fengdu Interrogation and Summons Methods*, likewise belong to this tradition and may serve as corroborating evidence.

*Precious Pearl from the Sea of Ritual, Scroll Forty-Six, "Swift-Flight Secret Methods #1"*

**Chief Marshal:**
The Swift-Flight Responsive Messenger Zhang, named Yuanbo. His face bears a ruddy hue; he wears a crossed-scarf headwrap, a yellow headband, golden armor, a close-sleeved short robe, a wind-blown cloak with fluttering sashes tied at the knees, and green boots. He wields an iron axe and rides atop lightning and flame.

**Names of the Six Ding Spirits:**
- Dingmao Swift-Flight Shang Messenger, named De.
- Dingchou Swift-Flight Ma Messenger, named Guang.
- Dinghai Swift-Flight He Messenger, named Yantong.
- Dingyou Swift-Flight Bian Messenger, named Cheng.
- Dingwei Swift-Flight Li Messenger, named Cong’e.
- Dingsi Swift-Flight Zhang Messenger, named Congzheng.

The above six spirits all take demonic forms: snouted like swine, sharp-mouthed, with fleshy wings, purple hair, golden eyes, naked bodies, ruddy limbs, golden bracelets on their wrists, golden bands on their foreheads, fleshy floral horns, white skullcaps, crimson wind-cloaks, and green flying sashes. In their left hands they hold official documents; in their right, black banners inscribed with golden characters summoning the Thunder Gods. The banner-tails stream toward the Xun direction as they descend from the Xun quarter, riding golden lightning and flame in flight.

**Summons Incantation:**
Five Thunder Spirit-Generals, manifesting a thousand truths,
Commanding thunder and lightning, coursing fire and moving clouds.
From the five directions, *qi* descends—swiftly drive the thunder!
I bid you come before this altar court.
Obey my command and act—hasten, hasten!
By the decree of the Jade Clarity True King, swiftly, swiftly as the thunderfire statutes!

Upon reciting the above incantation, to summon the Six-One Spirit: First exhale a breath of primordial *qi*, visualizing heaven and earth merging into a single crimson chaos. Next, inhale a golden breath of lung *qi* to burst it open. Direct your gaze toward the west, where the Great One resides in the southwest Kun position. Employ the transformation to form a golden bridge, which surges from the nose to connect with the Xun gate. Suddenly, the Great One appears above, blending indistinctly with the messenger, descending together via the golden bridge. They stand amidst lightning and flame, awaiting commands.

When inscribing talismans, draw in *qi* to infuse the symbol.
When subduing malevolent spirits, wield the axe.
When summoning thunder, grasp the banner.
Both banner and axe are transformations of the Great One’s sword; the messenger assumes form through the presentation of *qi*, merging with the Great One.

This document is issued to address matters at a designated time. Now that the appointed hour has arrived, a summons must be expedited. The following is the official dispatch:

**Ritual Method**
Perform the rite at dusk, facing the direction of the Dipper’s handle as it points at midnight. Around the first watch (*zi* hour), lay a clean mat upon the ground, arrange the spirit tablet, and complete the offerings. The master dons black robes, wields a sword, lets down his hair, and stands barefoot. He then visualizes his primordial spirit and silently reports to the Supreme Unity Emperor Lord. Afterward, he transforms his spirit and silently recites the *Celestial Peng* incantation seven times, envisioning himself as the Celestial Peng.

Next, he steps the Nine Stars’ *Gang* and stands at the center to proceed. First, he summons Attendant Zhang and entrusts him with the task of summoning the Six-One spirits. After burning Attendant Zhang’s talisman, he then summons the Six *Ding* Messengers according to the method, silently reciting the *Om-Om Han-Han* incantation as he burns each of the six talismans, calling their names one by one. The ritual proceeds in order, following the prescribed offerings.

Upon completion, bury the paper ashes, tea, wine, and offerings in the *Xun* direction, marking the spot with the sword. The next day, dispatch the summoned spirits according to the original method.

On the talisman’s face, inscribe the Six-One Spirit Talisman; on its reverse, write Attendant Zhang’s name. When inscribing the talisman during the rite, use chicken blood mixed with cinnabar powder.

When ascending the altar to perform the rite and inscribe talismans, have a single attendant—pure and refined—stand by. Avoid the presence of the old, young, monks, nuns, women, livestock, or those with malignant illnesses.

*The Pearl Left Behind by the Dharma Sea, Scroll Forty-One*
**Supreme Chaos-One-Qi Celestial Script**

Though thunder manifests in five forms, in truth it is one, and none departs from this body.
Thus, the world’s people store thunder within the heart, kidneys, and five viscera, yet this thunder alone dwells within the Chaos-One-Qi.
For elixir refinement must trace back to the Azure-Golden-Headed Imperial Master, the Primordial Yang Fu Li Ancestral Elder, called the Jade Crucible Fire-Refining Celestial Worthy’s Gallbladder and the Golden Tripod Decoction-Simmering Dao Ancestor’s Heart.
When the heart is at peace, one drives the River Chariot, circulates Heavenly Water, harmonizes with the Dao, and returns the light—able to revive the dead.
Refining it yields a radiant light that pierces the Dipper and Ox, its killing qi sharp as it courses through spirits and ghosts.
Yet the world remains unaware.
This thunder both gives life and kills, rewards and punishes; for praying for rain or sunshine, dispelling pestilence or curing illness, none is swifter.
Those who practice this method all restrain themselves with essence and qi, yet heaven and earth span countless thousands of miles—should guest qi intrude, would it not lead to grave error?
This method was received by Master Nan from the Sage, yet none knew it was personally transmitted by the Great One Savior from Suffering Celestial Worthy.
This method requires no stellar configurations, no qi, no hand seals—only single-minded devotion and steadfast practice, and none shall fail to receive a response.
The talismans are all celestial seal-script: five characters for praying for rain, five for summoning thunder, five for drawing lightning, five for commanding dragons; five for summoning the Nine Rivers’ envoys to govern waters, five for curing illness, five for aiding childbirth, five for subduing violent spirits, five for averting calamity, and one celestial seal-script character for extinguishing fire and dispelling pestilence, along with one talisman for refining wandering souls.
Thus, the Master of Salvation from Suffering states: When the heart is upright, qi is upright; when the heart is unified, qi is unified. With my uprightness, I correct what is not upright; with my unity, I unify what is not unified. Only in uprightness and unity does thunder become the thunder within this body—what fear is there that it will not come when summoned or fail to serve when commanded?
All who share this aspiration, heed these words well.

Respectfully inscribed by the Elder of Mount Qingcheng’s Cavern Mountain, Li Tieming of Western Shu.

The Method of Summoning:
Perform the Threefold Purification in Secret, offer incense, invoke the masters, declare the intent, and summon the generals to act.

The Summoning Incantation:
I am the spirit of the Primordial Yang Golden Palace,
Born of the Primordial Qi of Chaos.
Heaven revolves and earth rotates, the cosmos turns,
The First Ancestor commands me to summon the Star Perfected.
The Iron Master’s golden sword sweeps away demonic vapors,
Driving thunder and dispatching lightning to resound through the Great Clarity.
Dare any arrive late—first their form shall be destroyed!
Swiftly, swiftly, as in the statutes and ordinances!

The Second Incantation:
With hair unbound, pacing the steps to seek the killing qi,
The sword’s tip ignites fire to refine the true script.
Lord Lao bestowed upon me the Chaos Method,
To command the Star Perfected and the Six-Six Thunder.
One qi, seven cycles—heaven and earth grow dark,
At the third watch and third point, summon the Thunder Deities.
Only the pivot of summoning thunder is known to few—
A profound and mysterious secret.
Cook poria in congee to refine the Star Perfected,
Always retain a single point to summon the Thunder Deities.
For one hour and eight quarters, fire follows the body,
The numinous talisman aligns with the orifices of the Heavenly Person.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Most High Dao Ancestor’s Military Statutes and Ordinances!

The Triple Summoning:
By the command of the Primordial Yang Emperor, swift as the Fire Star!

*#1 The Supreme Primordial Chaos Qi Celestial Writ*
(Transmitted by the Song-Yuan Primordial Chaos School)

*The Dharma Ocean’s Lost Pearls, Scroll Forty-Two*

*The Supreme Petition for Exorcism and Secret Memorial: Ritual Procedures*

The *Daoist Methods Compendium*, Scroll 110, *Great Rites of the Mysterious Primordial Chaos Writ*, belongs to the same dharma lineage. Its *"Lineage and Origins of the Dharma School"* traces the transmission from the Iron Treasure Supreme Emperor and Iron Master Supreme Emperor, following the Iron Ascendant Supreme Emperor, to the Patriarchal Dharma-Holder, Propagator of the Teachings, and Founder of the Xuanjiao School, Iron Tablet Jade Creek Southern Perfected, named Wen Biao. The succession continued with Iron Inscription Dongshan Perfected Li Yingxin, Thunder Marshal Supreme Minister of the Unified Qi Perfected Iron Alms-Bowl Thunder Master Yulong Tiemuer, and Thunder Marshal Supreme Minister Iron Mountain Thunder Master Li Mingzheng. It also includes the *"Precepts of the Supreme Primordial Chaos Teachings"*, which elaborates on the principles, laws, and ordinances of the Primordial Chaos School, serving as a valuable reference.

---

**Ritual Procedures for Petition and Memorial**

The method states: First, observe the precepts, bathe, and change into ritual attire. Prepare the memorial by using the middle joint of your middle finger as a one-inch measure, making the document nine inches in height and width. Avoid empty words; ensure utmost sincerity in truthfully recording the matter at heart, with simplicity and solemnity as paramount.

On a quiet night, compose yourself in stillness and contemplation. Do not allow those who consume meat, outsiders, women, individuals in mourning attire, or cats and dogs to witness the ritual. This is called a *"secret memorial from the heart"*, and an auspicious day may be chosen. In urgent cases, no day need be selected—simply focus the mind, offer one stick of incense and a cup of water, and face the pivot of the Dipper with utmost sincerity, performing the rite as prescribed.

---

**Incantation for Changing Attire**
*Qian yuan heng li zhen.*
The Fusang tree emits its essence,
Five-colored clouds envelop the body.
Clothing covers the form,
In all movements and travels,
May the hun and po souls be at peace,
All evil subdued,
Eternally enjoying the blessed court.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as in the statutes and ordinances!*

After reciting this incantation, the master silently intones the *"Purification of the Mouth"* incantation, makes the *zi* mudra, draws northern *qi*, and swallows it. Then, the *"Purification of the Body"* incantation is recited while making the *zi* mudra with both hands, drawing northern *qi* and blowing it to sweep both shoulders.

Next, intone the *"Purification of Heaven and Earth Qi"* and the *"Slaying Mudra"*, drawing northern *qi*.

Make the *wu* mudra and draw southern *qi*.

*Yaṃ cha li.*

*Ha-□-li.*

Upon reciting the above incantation thrice, hold the breath and concentrate the spirit, gazing downward into the heart. Circulate the heart’s crimson *qi*, then raise the eyes and exhale it upward. Visualize the crimson *qi* ascending to the crown of the head, where it meets the azure *qi*, transforming into a rainbow bridge spanning the mid-heavens and entering directly into the Dipper’s mouth.

Then visualize within the *qi* a perfected person, clad in a scarlet immortal’s robe and crowned with the *Jin Xian* coronet, riding the crimson *qi* and bearing the burnt petition in both hands, ascending straight through the rainbow bridge into the Dipper’s mouth.

Proclaim: *"Disciple [Name] now presents a matter of the heart for your attention."*

Next, visualize two figures within the Dipper, resembling jade maidens in form, dressed in official green immortal robes adorned with white fish carriages. One holds a ram’s head in the left hand and a sword in the right—this is the *Striker of the Ram* Messenger. The other supports a golden tray in the left hand, upon which rests a peony, while holding a peony branch in the right—this is the *Dhāraṇī* Messenger.

From the Dipper emerge clouds of five auspicious colors. Present the petition’s contents to them, and one of the messengers will convey it upward to the Dipper star governing the appropriate palace. Should any words be misstated or flawed, humbly beseech correction and proper presentation, lest the celestial officials impose reprimand. Earnestly hope for the petition’s acceptance to fulfill the heart’s intent, and swiftly grant a response.

Upon speaking, visualize the heart’s spirit clearly entrusting the petition to one of the messengers. See the two messengers solemnly present it and enter the Dipper.

Then recite the secret incantation:

The Mysterious Supreme Yin—eight windows open bright.
All petitions presented, the jade maidens convey the numinous.
Every seeking is fulfilled, every wish is accomplished.
A thousand harmonies, ten thousand unions—naturally perfected.
Swiftly, swiftly, as in the statutes and ordinances!

Heart-spirit, heart-spirit, unite with the Dao in truth.
The petition ascends, then returns to its origin.
Swiftly, swiftly, as in the statutes and ordinances!

*Oṃ. □-jik-ra-ti-cha-□-ming-shep.*

One Qi, Three Traversals

Upon completing the incantation, trace from the *zi* character to the *hai* character on the cyclical wheel, entering the middle joint of the middle finger, then gather and stabilize. Visualize green qi ascending from the Mud Pill Palace, then imagine red qi being drawn in through the nose. Next, rotate the head once in a full circle, inhale qi once more, and swallow it. Envision the spirit riding the qi as it enters through the nose, returning to its proper place, then stand ready to await the response.

**Writing the Heart Petition and Conducting the Ritual**

When writing a heart petition, first compose the spirit and settle the thoughts. Then perform the Nine Phoenix Rite, recite the invocation to the Radiant Heavenly Emperor, and follow with the secret incantation to consecrate the paper, brush, and ink. Do not utter a sound while writing the petition.

**Incantation:**

Great Radiance of Heaven and Earth,
Myriad qi intermingle and arise.
I attain the True One,
Within the Jade Court of Inner Vision.
The August Emperor of Emptiness commands,
Bidding me to commune with the perfected.
Upper Prime Red Child,
Three Primes and Six Palaces—
All spirits assemble,
Merging with my body.
Ascending to the Dipper’s palace,
Entering and exiting the Purple Court.
Roaming and feasting in the Eight Darknesses,
The Three Ones ascend to the Upper Radiance.
Grand Unity, Mysterious Perfected,
Convey my intent,
Transmit it to the Dipper’s perfected.
Whatever the heart desires,
Silently present and receive assent.
The received Mysterious Decree
Accords with my heart’s spirit.
All worldly affairs,
Each and every one, are resolved.
The spirit soars to the Jade Altar,
The body divides into one form.
Swiftly, swiftly, as in the statutes and ordinances!

Upon completing the incantation, draw in northern qi and blow it forth. Then visualize the Jade Stars standing in the five directions, with the sun and moon to the left and right.

**Format for the Heart Petition**

[Rank and Name], Your humble servant [Full Name], respectfully states:

I have heard that the Nine Dawns reside above, truly governing the oversight of illumination. The Most High, in compassion, has bestowed the teachings of prayer and expiation. For any matter sought, petition and declaration are permitted.

Your servant now submits this petition for [state intent], humbly presenting this document before the sacred presence of the Northern Dipper.

I reverently beseech the Dao’s compassion to absolve all my transgressions of irreverence and offense, and to grant special mercy, permitting the fulfillment of my petition. I earnestly implore the bestowal of grace and command, that it may accord with my heart’s desire.

For my presumption in troubling your august majesty, your servant’s feelings are overwhelmed with urgency and longing. I prostrate myself in anticipation of the Dao’s decree.

[Year] [Month] [Day]
[Rank and Name], Your humble servant [Full Name], respectfully submits this petition.

Seal the petition with the governance seal; do not use an outer envelope or wrapping.

First, with the left hand, perform the Nine Phoenix Rite, blow while reciting the invocation to the Radiant Heavenly Emperor, and visualize the act of consecration.

Next, with the left hand, press the *xu* and *hai* positions to form the Opening the Heavenly Gate mudra.

Then press the *kun* and *xun* characters, anointing the left and right eyes to form the Preserving the Human Gate.

Next, press the upper joints of the four fingers, visualizing the Golden Lad of Incense Offering and the Jade Maiden of Message Transmission.

Then press the upper, middle, and lower joints of the middle finger to form the Three Heavens mudra, and flick upward to open the Three Heavenly Gates.

**Incense for Petitioning the Dipper**

Cogon grass, fennel seeds, cloud incense, pine seeds, cypress seeds.

These incenses are local products, the tokens of the earth. Though aloeswood, sandalwood, benzoin, and frankincense may be exquisite, they are but the qi of foreign cliffs and crags—ill-suited for addressing the true. The finest is still *jiangzhen* incense.

**Matters Governed by the Dipper’s True Ones**

All methods of petitioning the Dipper depend on the practitioner’s application. Generally, those who fail to receive a response do so because they do not know which governing star presides over their affair. Just as human kings and ministers have officials assigned to specific duties, so too must one not petition indiscriminately. The celestial real ones, after all, have their own bureaus and offices. To draft a memorial, first determine the nature of the matter, then identify which star governs it, and petition accordingly—assurance of a response will follow.

**First Heaven:** The Celestial Commandant, the Star Lord of Greed-Wolf, and his consort, the Inner Consort, oversee the redress of wrongs, the vindication of right, the suppression of others’ evil, the advancement of one’s own virtue, the remission of sins, and the prayer for blessings. They hold office during the *Shi* and *Bi* mansions, and the *Kui* and *Lou* constellations.

**Second Heaven:** The Grand Steward, the Star Lord of Great Gate, and his consort, the Inner Concubine, govern the arts of yin and yang, official advancement, and the pursuit of schemes. They hold office during the *Wei*, *Mao*, *Bi*, and *Zi* mansions.

**Third Heaven:** The Minister of Works, the Star Lord of Prosperity-Keeper, and his consort, the Primordial Mother, oversee the study of the Dao, the quest for immortality, and communion with the true and attainment of the sagely. They hold office during the *Shen*, *Jing*, *Gui*, and *Liu* mansions.

**Fourth Heaven:** The Patrol General, the Star Lord of Literary Brilliance, and his consort, the Inner Consort, govern the subjugation of human and spectral foes and the execution of malevolent forces. They hold office during the *Xing*, *Zhang*, *Yi*, and *Zhen* mansions.

**Fifth Heaven:** The Dipper Lord, the Star Lord of Integrity-Chastity, and his consort, the Eldest Daughter, oversee the augmentation of lifespan, the establishment of merit, and the prayer for blessings. They hold office during the *Jiao*, *Kang*, *Di*, and *Fang* mansions.

**Sixth Heaven:** The Grand Master of Ceremonies, the Star Lord of Martial Brilliance, and his consort, the Middle Daughter, govern the alleviation of calamities, obstructions, illnesses, and misfortunes, and the prayer for relief and exemption. They hold office during the *Xin*, *Wei*, *Ji*, and *Dou* mansions.

**Seventh Heaven:** The Supreme Emperor, the Star Lord of Rupture-Soldier, and his consort, the Youngest Daughter, oversee the resolution of cosmic blockages and the regulation of qi and seasonal cycles. They hold office during the *Niu*, *Nü*, *Xu*, and *Wei* mansions.

**Eighth Heaven:** The Venerable Jade Emperor’s Outer Assistant, the Star Lord, and his consort oversee the exorcism of manifold disasters and the prolongation of life through medicinal practice. They hold office on the day of one’s original destiny and natal hour.

**Ninth Heaven:** The Perfected of the Grand Master of Ceremonies, the Inner Counselor, the Star Lord, and his consort oversee prayers for the people’s blessings and the salvation of all matters. They hold office on the day of one’s original destiny and natal hour.

**The Heavenly Stem Method**

Each month, regularly add *xu*; at every hour, behold the Star Lord of Rupture-Soldier. If the monthly general has not yet passed, then proceed in sequence through the original palace.

For example: at the *hai* hour in the first month, wishing to locate the Celestial Stem, the first month’s Celestial Stem at the *xu* hour resides in *yin*. The celestial Way revolves leftward, and the *hai* hour is precisely at the *xu* position.

It is also said: the general of the first month is at *hai*; the celestial Way revolves leftward, and the general of the second month is at *xu*.

For example: at the *zi* hour in the first month, wishing to know the location of the Celestial Stem’s palace, take the first month’s general at the *hai* hour and superimpose it upon *zi*, then proceed rightward to encounter *chen*—this is the palace of the Celestial Stem.

At the *zi* hour in the first month, *hai* is added to *zi* and counted off; *chen* falls upon *si*, so at that hour the Celestial Stem is precisely at *si*.

In the rightward method, visualize a firelight as fine as a thread descending obliquely; inhale through the nostrils to gather the center, then look upward—this is the *qi* of the Celestial Stem.

**Auspicious Days for Petitioning the Northern Dipper’s Procession**
For petitions to the Dipper, observe the third and seventh auspicious days of each month, *gengshen* and *jiazi*, the Three Origins and Five La days, followed by the days governed by the lunar mansions, and further by the establishment days of each month.

**First Month:** The twenty-fifth and twenty-sixth days; *yin*, *mao*, *chen*, *wei*, *shen*, *you*, *hai*, and *zi* days are auspicious.
**Second Month:** The third, seventh, twenty-third, and twenty-sixth days; *chou*, *yin*, *mao*, *shen*, *you*, *xu*, *si*, *wu*, and *wei* days are auspicious.
**Third Month:** The twenty-sixth day; *mao*, *chen*, *si*, *shen*, *you*, and *xu* days are auspicious.
**Fourth Month:** The seventeenth and twenty-seventh days; *yin*, *mao*, *chen*, *you*, *xu*, *hai*, *wu*, *wei*, and *shen* days are auspicious.
**Fifth Month:** The third, thirteenth, and twentieth days; *chen*, *si*, *wu*, *you*, *xu*, *hai*, *chou*, *yin*, and *mao* days are auspicious.
**Sixth Month:** The fourth and eighth days; *mao*, *chen*, *si*, *xu*, *hai*, *zi*, *wei*, *shen*, and *you* days are auspicious.
**Seventh Month:** The fourth and twenty-fourth days; *si*, *wu*, *wei*, *xu*, *hai*, *zi*, *yin*, *mao*, and *chen* days are auspicious.
**Eighth Month:** The third, nineteenth, eleventh, and twenty-seventh days; *hai*, *zi*, *chou*, *chen*, *si*, *wu*, *shen*, *you*, and *xu* days are auspicious.
**Ninth Month:** The third and eighteenth days; *wu*, *wei*, *shen*, *hai*, *zi*, *chou*, *mao*, *chen*, and *si* days are auspicious.
**Tenth Month:** The tenth and twenty-sixth days; *zi*, *chou*, *yin*, *si*, *wu*, *wei*, *you*, *xu*, and *hai* days are auspicious.
**Eleventh Month:** The first, ninth, seventeenth, and fifteenth days; *zi*, *chou*, *yin*, *chen*, *xu*, *wu*, *wei*, *shen*, and *you* days are auspicious.
**Twelfth Month:** The twentieth day; *wei*, *shen*, *you*, *xu*, *hai*, *zi*, *chou*, *yin*, and *mao* days are auspicious.

By this method, visualize the messenger arriving before you from the Dipper’s Mouth, riding golden light, wearing a black cap with a celestial-facing topknot and black robes, bearing a document casket. Next, recite the memorial and burn the chapter in the incense burner with abundant fragrant flames. Then, invoke the messenger, state the purpose, and dispatch them by decree. With both hands, perform the Yin-Yang Dipper gesture to sever the connection, sprinkle water, and visualize the messenger ascending to the Dipper Palace upon golden light.

Then recite the Northern Dipper Salvation-from-Suffering Divine Incantation:
*Hum. Om. By decree. Zha. Svāhā. Hum. Da. By decree. Zha. Svāhā. Mo. Li. By decree. Zha. Svāhā. Hum. [Seal] Li. By decree. Zha. Svāhā. Hum. Na. Ma. Da. Li. By decree. Zha. Svāhā. Hum. By decree. Da. Li. By decree. Zha. Svāhā. Hum. Zha. By decree. Divine Benefit. Svāhā.*

Upon completing the incantation, visualize the incense smoke ascending directly to the Dipper’s Mouth, reaching the True Dipper.

Next, perform the *Tiger-Crossing-Horse Dipper* ritual: position the Dipper’s Mouth above the head, with the Dipper’s Handle pointing directly toward the Dipper’s Mouth. Visualize the petitioner’s spirit riding golden light to the Handle Star, crossing the Immortal Bridge, and arriving at the Dipper Palace. Silently state the petition, then recite the True Words:
*Kudi. Di. She. Su. Zha. Aruo. Mi. Zha. Wu. Du. Zha. Kuqi. Zha. Polai. Di. Zha. Yewei. Ruo. Zha. Wu. Du. Zha. Kuluo. Di. Zha. Qimo. Zha. Svāhā.*

Conclude with the esoteric instructions for seated meditation and union with the spirit.

The petitioner gathers spirit, curls the soles of both feet inward, clasps hands in the *Thunder Crouch* mudrā, and interlocks them at the waist, closing the breath until full. Visualize the *qi* from the *Yongquan* acupoints surging upward to the *Heart Palace*, where crimson *qi* spirals and revolves. Next, with both eyes fixed upon the petitioner’s *Yintang* point, suddenly perceive an aperture opening there. Visualize the heart’s fire blazing like a flue, shooting straight through the *Yintang* point and ascending to meet the Dipper’s Mouth. From the flames, a Jade Maiden slowly emerges, her form taking shape like luminous essence. She faces the petitioner directly. Silently recite the *Great Merit Incantation* seven times, then imagine the Jade Maiden returning speech to you—thus is the connection established.

Practice this union at the noon hour for three days. Thereafter, perform it at will, with the hours of *yin*, *wu*, and *xu* all being efficacious. When practicing this method, three forms of response may manifest: *written response*, *dream response*, or *ash-altar response*.

For a *written response*, first purify the body and recite the esoteric incantation in the heart. Then invoke the *Yellow Emperor of the Central Palace, Controller of Destiny and Hearth Lord*. Next, summon the *Jade Immortal Bright Essence Youth* from beneath the throne. Silently recite the *Numinous Yang Swift Response Great Merit Incantation*, form the *Li* trigram mudrā, and draw the central yellow *qi*. Blow it toward the hearth in the direction of the ritual’s intent. Take a sheet of paper and inscribe the matter at hand, the officiant affixing their seal and rolling it up. Place a brush inside, sealing it together. In a short while, the response will arrive.

When first practicing, use the fifth *xu* day, offering a rice meal as sacrifice. Pray for transmission of the *Orthodox Mind Esoteric Canon* to a designated recipient on a specified date. For all petitions, swift responses are hoped for. Should one betray this trust, a memorial shall be submitted to the *Dipper Palace*, the *True Lord of Upholding Sageliness and Protecting Virtue*, the *Yellow Emperor of the Central Palace, Controller of Destiny and Hearth Lord*, the *Jade Immortal of the Sudden Ascent*, the *Bright Essence Youth*, and the *Venerable Alchemical Maiden*—may they clearly dispatch reproof, not through any malice of mine. If I am not sincere, may they impose punishment, and I shall harbor no resentment.

From this day forth, this decree is made known to all. Let it be openly declared and dutifully observed.

When desiring to receive responses in dreams—whether to meet someone the following day or to seek answers regarding personal matters—one must prepare in advance by performing the incantation and visualization as previously instructed. **Ash-Altar Manifestation Method for Responses**
At the hour of *rending* (9–11 p.m.), use fine ash or lime to sweep clean the area before the hearth. First, arrange a Northern Dipper formation with ash, placing it inverted like the Dipper’s shape at the hearth. Then, take approximately one or two *sheng* of ash and form a circular altar beneath the Dipper. Smooth it with a chicken feather. Proceed to an open space, face the Northern Dipper, and invoke each stellar position in turn. Summon the *Upholding Sageliness* deity, then close your eyes and visualize the True Lord of the Northern Dipper descending, with the *Upholding Sageliness* from the Dipper’s Palace arriving together. Lead them back to the hearth, inviting each to sit upon the corresponding Dipper position previously arranged. Perform seven prostrations in the heart, summon *Bright Hero*, and recite the *Great Achievement Incantation* as before. Visualize *Bright Hero* descending, following the established procedure.

- This trace indicates unsettled enemies or minor ailments such as sores and wounds.

- This trace indicates the joy of being summoned to court for an appointment.
- This trace indicates receiving gifts of silk or utensils.
- This trace indicates inauspicious deaths or the receipt of funeral notices from relatives or friends.
- This trace indicates transactions or the escape of servants.
- This trace indicates the joy of acquiring property or receiving offerings of treasures, or profiting from sales.
- This trace indicates successful business ventures or the acquisition of wealth from others.
- A tiger-patterned trace across the body indicates promotion to a position of authority. For military officers, it signifies an appointment with command; for civil officials, it signifies a high-ranking post. For commoners, it heralds auspicious and noble fortune.
- This trace indicates receiving gifts or the smooth progression of affairs.
- This trace indicates monks or Daoists seeking recommendations or the joy of receiving wine.
- This trace indicates damage to ancestral tombs from wind, water, or excavation, causing ancestral spirits distress.
- This trace indicates relatives sending gifts or female guests visiting.

**The Great Rite of Destiny Petition and Disaster Aversion**
**Celestial Petition to the Dipper**

This method originated in Western Shu and is not commonly known in the world. Later, the Nine Radiant Immortals of the Zhangren Abbey in Chengdu transmitted it to the Xianzhen Abbey on Shaoshi Mountain in Jiangxi, where it spread among the people. Master passed it to disciple by oral transmission, a method for urgent petitions to the Dipper, unknown to the secular world.

The master said: The sins and blessings of humanity are all reported to the celestial authorities. In Heaven, they are governed by the Seven Stars of the Northern Dipper, who oversee human destiny. In the world, this office is held by the Hearth Lord. Moreover, the Lord of Destiny is the chief of the Six Spirits and the manifested agent of the Seven Primes within the Dipper. This deity records the actions of humanity, whether upright or deceitful, and on the last day of each month, ascends to Heaven to submit a complete report. Major transgressions result in the loss of life or the severing of one’s lineage, while minor offenses bring misfortune upon the self. How could one escape?

In recent times, wealthy households and noble officials, when encountering inauspicious years and suffering calamities, have sought Daoist masters and shamans to perform rites of petition and aversion. Some offer prayers to the stars, others hold grand jiao rituals, expending wealth to purchase offerings and mobilizing servants for preparations. Yet they exert no personal effort, merely providing their presence to bear witness. Among them, some fail to abstain from meat, act carelessly, or even laugh irreverently. How can they expect their prayers to be answered?

The masters of old were cultivated persons of high virtue, simple and sincere, yet their methods were inflexible. Thus, the grace of the Most High—who opens the path to deliverance and aids the living—could not be widely extended or equally bestowed, failing to universally benefit all beings. In this way, the advantage lay with the rich, not the poor. By worldly standards, those of modest means, when struck by disaster, lack the vast resources to perform such rites and can only await death helplessly—how pitiful!

The Most High cherishes all life and values contentment, whether noble or base, high or low. Yet the *Mysterious Numinous* scripture states: For the poor and lowly, who lack the means to perform grand rituals, even offering a cup of water or a single flower is dismissed as empty pretense. This is due to the world’s mediocre masters and vulgar practitioners, who refuse to humble themselves, seek teachers, or inquire into the Dao. They concern themselves only with attire, voice, and ornate implements, creating an illusion of beauty. Their practices are mere plagiarism and fabrication, deceiving later students.

In recent times, the *Mysterious Numinous* method of silent petition and the secret rites of the *River Chart* have circulated. Some obtain a few talismanic commands from its texts or memorize a few lines of esoteric incantations, yet they understand nothing of their depth. They deceive households and delude the celestial perfected, performing nothing more than lighting lamps, burning paper, and reciting dedications. The master said: If the Lord of Destiny can report humanity’s sins and blessings to Heaven, then I shall entrust this secret method to him, conveying these sentiments to the stellar heavens and petitioning on their behalf to avert disasters. The response shall be swift as shooting stars.

In my travels among the masters, I encountered a person of high attainment who transmitted to me the *Elbow-Pocket Petition to the Dipper* and other oral secrets. I have since devoted myself to its practice and repeatedly witnessed its numinous efficacy. The cost is minimal, yet its responses are timely. Regardless of gender, those facing peril should first observe three days of purification and abstinence, then perform the method with focused intention. There is no instance where the deities do not respond. The key lies in sincerity—do not harbor disrespect or act recklessly. To violate the celestial statutes is no small matter; Heaven will surely know, and disaster will follow swiftly, leaving no room for prayer.

Now, in strict accordance with my master’s transmission, I set forth these instructions. For all scholars who approach this with reverence, single-minded devotion, and respectful observance, acting as Heaven’s proxy to transform and save beings, the merit is vast and beyond description. Take heed and do not neglect this.

**Sequence of Practice**
For all practices, one must first purify body and mind through abstinence and bathing, dispelling all distracting thoughts. Each morning, burn incense, face north, sit in silent meditation for a short while, and recite the scriptures with utmost sincerity before inscribing the talismans.

This talisman is inscribed in cinnabar on yellow paper, seven inches in length and three inches in width. Hold the paper in the left hand while forming the *sha* mudra, draw in the northern *qi*, and write "Chen Renyong enters the talisman." **Method for Interpreting Lamp Omens**
Flickering dimly: celestial disaster.
Lamp bright and undying: great fortune.
Two flames of unequal length: old vows stirring.
Flower-like beads suspended: great fortune.
Half black, half red: slander and strife.
Flame wavering unsteadily: chronic illness.
Tears of black soot: great misfortune and mourning.
Left side elongated: disaster for a yang person.
Right side elongated: disaster for a yin person.
Red lamp flower: loss of wealth.
White lamp flower: loss or separation.
Pale blue-white lamp flower: ancestral spirits unsettled.
Exploding without light: change in the patient’s condition.
Lamp flame leaping to all four sides: malevolent spirits or wandering ghosts causing harm.

**Dream Interpretation for Verification**
Sunrise: male patient may recover, female patient’s condition lightens.
Moonrise: female patient half-fortunate, male patient otherwise.
Fire appears: red flame auspicious, darkness inauspicious.
Great serpent: half-misfortune, household troubled by malevolent spirits.
Birds or beasts: patient’s condition fluctuates.
Snakes or rats: earth spirits unsettled.
Dogs running: ancestral spirits causing harm.
Woman in white: Dipper immortals descending.
Person in blue: moderate fortune.
Person in yellow: earth spirits causing disaster.
Person in black: life exhausted, spirits pursuing.
Person in red: mountain spirits coming to claim or confront.
Entering an official residence or house and seeing a woman: Dipper immortals descend to resolve calamity.
Entering a temple: minor yin misfortune, perform rites to ensure safety.
Bathing: disaster or loss.
Bright as daylight: golden brilliance, great fortune, patient’s condition may improve.
Dogs or horses: ancestral graves unsettled.
Darkness across the sky: patient’s condition will not improve.
Flying crows: local earth spirits causing harm.
Oxen or swine: epidemics or malarial fevers.
Crows or chickens: inauspicious, unexpected misfortune may arise.
No dream: patient gravely ill and unconscious, no change also inauspicious.

**Fumigation and Stove Inspection**
Observe the stove: ants, centipedes, flying moths, or frogs indicate earth spirits or local shrines.
Other auspicious or inauspicious signs are to be interpreted with discernment.
Stove purification and written petitions follow standard forms.

**Procedure for Ritual Practice**
First, have someone sweep and clean the stove area. Then proceed according to the prescribed method. Place a lamp inside the wok and cover it with a rice sieve, ensuring no layperson or woman sees it.

Bind swiftly, seize without delay.
Mountain specters, *wangliang*, the Five Pestilences, the Six Afflictions—fifteen kinds in all—wayward spirits and perverse demons, swiftly beclouded and bewildered, seized.
Rectify the Mechanism, align the *Gang* and *Heng*, guard the Pattern.

*Right Mudra:*
From the root of the thumb, proceed through *yín*, *mǎo*, *chén*, and *sì*, then press the subduing pattern. Tracing the Dipper and severing the *Gang* is also efficacious.
*Hū* pertains to the *qi* of liver and gallbladder; the Celestial *Gang* resides in *chén*.

After inscribing the talisman, seal this secret within. Then inscribe again a *Kui* Dipper, and recite the *Dharani* of the Great Sage Northern Dipper’s Seven Primordial Star Lords.
To safeguard the prosperity of the six livestock, employ the Heavenly Canopy Mantra to dispatch them.
For treating swine and cattle plagues, append the three characters *xū*, *xiàng*, *xié*.
In ordinary use, this tabooed brilliance need not be employed.
In urgent matters, use the Fire Dipper; its awe-inspiring power manifests instantly.

**The Five *Qi* Transformations:**
Wood flourishes in spring as the East, its color green, its *qi* harmonious, corresponding to the liver’s *xū*.
Fire flourishes in summer as the South, its color red, its *qi* hot, corresponding to the heart’s *hē*.
Metal flourishes in autumn as the West, its color white, its *qi* solemn, corresponding to the lungs’ *sì*.
Water flourishes in winter as the North, its color black, its *qi* cold, corresponding to the kidneys’ *chuī*.
Earth, lodged in the flourishing of the four seasons, is the Center, its color yellow, its *qi* warm, corresponding to the spleen’s *pēng*.

**Transmission of the Perfected Void Heavenly Master’s Shape-Shifting Talisman:**
Inscribe the character for "subduing ghosts," envisioning the brush as a halberd, subduing three thousand *li* of stern subduing officials and soldiers, entering the well and emerging again with the brush.
*Oṃ hūṃ hūṃ tāo tāo xī qīng líng gāng jué Oṃ* □ *sū zhà chì shā shè zǐ wǔ.*
*Oṃ xīn hūṃ zǔ gōng zhà dǎn lǐ*, exhale through the nose, inhale through the mouth, stamp the left foot upon the ground, and shake with fury to expel.
By the Great Honored Emperor’s command, the Eight-Headed Primordial Lord issues the decree.
Nine times, visualize a golden wheel of light, with all the generals manifest within.
Envision the solar wheel in the heart, emitting the character *yì*; envision the lunar wheel in the kidney palace, luminous and clear, emitting the character *zhá* to ascend the gallbladder vase.

**Seated Practice:**
At dawn and dusk, sit in stillness, unstained by a single speck of dust, all thoughts silenced. For three cycles of seven, raise both palms, and knock the teeth nine times.

**Application of the Void-Day Rat:**
Avoid the *Yàn* and *Wēi* months.
Rub the palms together, uniting the water and fire *qi*. Upon seeing a sun-like orb of light in the left palm, recite the *Dharani* of the Taiyin’s Transformation, the Heavenly Canopy Mantra, and the Heart Mantra forty-nine times. Envision *Wēn Qióng* manifesting within the light of the right palm, and silently petition for the matter at hand. Recite the Heavenly Canopy Mantra, and draw the light into the gallbladder. Then draw nine breaths of the Eastern green *qi* into the gallbladder, envisioning it as a lapis lazuli vase, within which the tortoise and snake intertwine, coalescing into a golden orb of light like a silver pearl. Exhale it onto the incense, round as a bright mirror, within which Marshal *Wēn* appears.

*Dharma Ocean’s Lost Pearls*, Scroll Forty-Three concludes:
#1 *The Great Law of the Dark Mystery’s Ghost-Subduing Marshal*: Transmitted by the Northern Emperor.
#2 *The Great Law of the Earth Deity Marshal Wēn*: Transmitted by the Northern Emperor.

*Compendium of Daoist Methods*, Scroll 254, *Secret Methods for Summoning and Examining the Eastern Marchmount’s Marshal Wēn*, Preface to the Numinous Text states:
Marshal *Wēn* is the Eastern Marchmount’s Commander of Troops, the Celestial Inspector General of the World, and the Keeper of Urgent Human Cases. His might and strange manifestations are unparalleled; whatever is petitioned, none fails to meet the heart’s desire.
During the Tang, at the request of the Heavenly Master *Yè Fǎshàn*, he was entrusted with governing the ghosts of pestilence. "To save a sick father, the people of Shu were all cured within a month. Later, he manifested again, saying: 'I wish to assist the world’s ritual officers in their practice, capturing malevolent spirits and curing illnesses. Now, I possess secret talismanic methods; I hope they will be propagated.'" Heavenly Master *Yè* thus transmitted this method to later disciples. In the space of a breath, its responses were resoundingly clear.
The same work’s *Great Law of the Earth Deity Marshal Wēn* belongs to the same lineage and serves as a mutual reference.

*Dharma Ocean’s Lost Pearls*, Scroll Forty-Four:
*The Great Law of Marshal Yīn, Inspector of the Earth Bureau*

The Master of the Law is the Patriarch, Immortal Lord of Southern Prosperity, *Liào Zhēnrén*. The Marshal in Command: *Yīn Yuánshuài*, the Earth Bureau’s Inspector of the Year-Star, Supreme Virtue of the Northern Culmen’s Divine Presence, who aids the Dao, annihilates essences, and extirpates demons—his name is *Jiāo*. He appears as a youthful visage, with a green face, red hair, twin topknots bound in a coiled headwrap, a cyan body, bare legs, clad in a black-green crimson robe, a red skirt cinched at the waist, and a necklace of twelve skulls. In his left hand, he holds a golden bell; in his right, a yellow halberd. Stout and short, he stands amidst black clouds, with a yellow banner and leopard-tail attendants flanking him.

The Deputy Marshal: *Jiǎng Shǐzhě*, the Swift-Seizing Evocator of the Dipper’s Numinous Manifestation—his name is *Ruì*. He resembles a *Kinnara* king: fanged, crimson-lipped, barefoot, with large golden rings in his ears. His complexion is purple or green-faced, with a headband, red hair, a floral red robe, and upturned boots. He wields a noose, with *gongcao* officials at his side.

**Examination and Binding:**

From the feet, reverse the sword mudra upward to the crown, imagining the Three Hun in the form of Daoist adepts—azure, yellow, and white—emerging from the crown in sequence with the sword mudra. **Breaking Ground:**
*Huò líng líng* [syllables obscured] *tiān xīng* [obscured] *dì yào*, *niè*—commonly used for dispersing miasmic harmony to cure pestilence. Cut paper into an octagon, inscribe the talisman, and affix it outside. Take a piece of cat bamboo, one foot and two inches long (add one inch in a leap month), inscribe the talisman upon it, and strike the offending direction forty-nine times with an axe while reciting the *Yù Gào* once, until it is exhausted. Then dispatch the *chén* and *xū* Dipper, alternating *xū* and *chén*, followed by the stars *Poverty, Giant, Wealth, Literature, Humility, Military, Ruin*.

For clandestine repairs, affix the talisman to the eastern pillar of the ridgepole, then strike the ground at the breaking point three times with an axe. When moving earth, affix the talisman to the worksite and dig three times at the starting point.

For celestial pestilence, first offer thanks, then perform the exorcism using the talisman as prescribed. For terrestrial pestilence caused by breaking ground or laying foundations, where the household’s lamps and fires dim, appeal to Marshal *Tǔ Huáng* of the Origin, taking soil from the direction where the earth was disturbed and casting it into the altar.

For ship pestilence, issue a document and dispatch the talisman at will. For prison pestilence, send the marshals to oversee the city god’s seizure. For livestock pestilence, inscribe a bamboo slip and place it in the pen, then strike the talisman into vinegar and charcoal to restore peace.

To recover runaway servants, inscribe the talisman and affix it upside-down above the stove—it will appear at once. For lost cats or dogs, inscribe the talisman on white paper and affix it above the stove—they will appear at once.

To cure malevolence, inscribe the talisman on an iron plaque and drive it in with nails. For insects or birds damaging crops, dispatch the local earth god.

**Right:** Each of these methods requires three impressions of the master’s seal, stamped in sequence to summon and employ agents at will. For major matters, submit a memorial and issue a document with the dispatch talisman. Generally, adjust the prayers according to the situation, then affix the three decrees and seal them. On the reverse of the three-decree talisman, inscribe *Hé Míng Tiān Dì Rì* ("Conjoined Radiance of Heaven and Earth"). An octagonal talisman may be used, affixed to the four directions.
