**Great Method of Thunder Arrows**
When Heaven and Earth convulse,
Yin and yang clash and flay,
All pertain to baleful stars and great luminaries,
The flourishing qi of poisonous thunder,
Thunder arrows, thunder-slayers—
All are transmitted by ancestral masters.
Point and shoot according to the diagrams,
Harmonize and transform creation,
Balance and regulate yin and yang,
Sever and cast down demonic stars,
Verify talismans and observe correspondences.

For example, the *Liúhuǒ* (Flowing Fire) baleful star is the Great Yang.
The *Jīnhǔ* (Golden Tiger) great slayer is governed by the Celestial Stem—
This is the star of the Western *Tàibái* (Venus), the flowing metal,
Presided over by the Great Yin, the thunder-slayer.
The *Hēiléi* (Black Thunder) and *Léihǔ* (Thunder Tiger) slayers
Are the gods of the *Fāntiān Fùdì* (Heaven-Overturning, Earth-Covering) slayer.
When the talismanic mandate of the *Liúhuǒ* baleful star offends the *Jīnhǔ*,
It responds through the black slayer of thunder and rain.
This star pertains to metal, that talisman to fire—
The principle of fire overcoming metal.

The gods of *Fāntiān Fùdì*
Are to be met with the flying-sword talisman for severing corpses.
To offend them is to slay and subdue the thunder master’s family.
Cover and shield with the Heavenly Emperor’s command,
Or the ritual master will suffer the calamity.
Moreover, on *jiǎ-sì* days,
When the dragon soars and the rooster crows at dawn,
Arriving at the land of *Hēiléi*, *Hēihǔ*, and *Jīnhǔ*,
It is especially swift and efficacious.

Generally, when the Grand Year resides in its palace, arise,
Seek the dwelling of the thunder-slayer,
And shoot it with the thunder arrow—this is critical.
Each arrow has its own method of activation and diagram.

At the appointed hour, observe the White Tiger’s direction for activation.
Return to pacify and circulate the scriptures.
At dawn, observe whether qi is present.
Prepare four recall-slayer talismans,
Secretly burn them together in the incense burner—

If the qi is black and the slayer’s arrival fierce,

Press the thunder talisman, and urge the thunder and rain unceasingly.

If unresponsive, next use the *xīn* talisman to urge the summons,

*Dharma Sea’s Lost Pearls, Scroll Forty-Four Concluded*
*Dharma Sea’s Lost Pearls, Scroll Forty-Five*

*The Purple Palace Mysterious Writ*

It is said that of all afflictions that plague human breath, none is more grievous than consumptive wasting. No physician or shaman in the world can cure it. Once one person falls ill, the malady spreads through the entire clan, even to the point of extinguishing the family line. None dare approach, hence it is called "corpse-transmitted consumption." Some burn the dead in the mountains and wilds; others cast them into rivers, refusing burial. Descendants sever ties of bone and flesh; husbands and wives lose the bond of mutual regard. How tragic indeed!

Those who treat this illness fail to suppress the Three Corpses and Nine Worms. Talismans prove ineffective—how could mere physicians or shamans succeed? Now, a treasured secret is revealed, to be imparted only to those deemed worthy, transmitted through the heart. If one whose nature and conduct are not gentle and sincere obtains this text without the master’s guidance, recklessly practices it, or carelessly divulges it, the calamity will extend to nine generations—an unforgivable sin. Beware, beware!

Households afflicted by this malady must submit a written petition to the altar, declaring their life’s origin and detailing when the illness began and its present symptoms. If they experience inauspicious nightmares or see ghosts of deceased kin, they must clearly describe these omens. Upon verification of the worms’ presence through talismanic fumigation, a memorial is submitted to the Celestial Emperor and the Ancestral Master, dispatching generals to seize the corpse-transmitting ghosts and the wrongfully deceased kin. After imprisonment and interrogation, talismans are issued to expel the corpse-worms.

After ingesting the talisman, within twenty-one days the disease’s source is expelled. If the body sweats and itches as though worms crawl beneath the skin, swiftly wipe the entire body with cloth and burn it. Some may vomit worm-like forms; others may experience abdominal rumbling and pain, followed by diarrhea. The talisman’s power, infused with thunder-fire and lethal qi, incinerates the corpse-worms, leaving no chance of escape. The worms vary in form, but once the disease’s source is expelled, place them in a vessel and cast it into flowing water.

Then, administer the *Report-and-Response Talisman* to determine which organ is depleted, and use the *Tonifying Talisman* to restore what was damaged. For those with qi and blood stagnation, it is also essential to cultivate a calm mind and nurture their nature, avoiding overexertion. The method requires eighty days of treatment, and after a thousand days, the body is purged—such a person is reborn into the world. If they fail to abstain from the bedchamber or regulate their activities appropriately, survival remains uncertain. The utmost care must be taken, as with a woman in childbirth. Without proper nurturing, if the illness recurs, the danger is grave.

Transmitted by Yan Daolong, styled Zilong, of the Tianpeng lineage.

The method for pursuing and eradicating consumption is indeed the most secret text of Heaven and a rare treasure in the world below. Yet today’s practitioners, without examining the root, merely grasp at the branches, vainly attempting to practice it. I first studied under Master Wu Youkai, who received the transmission from Guo Jundaguan. Guo’s master was Chen Zangxiu, whose master was Guo Jun Huangxi, a disciple of Fan Xuan. Though I obtained this transmission, I remained uncertain whether the root and branches were complete.

My neighbor, Master Xueya, received the lineage from Fan Xuan. Having traversed rivers and lakes, he was a pioneer in this art, reviving the dead and saving lives beyond count. In his later years, he returned home, and I became his disciple. How rare is such a text! I served my master for years, fulfilling the duties of a disciple, even providing his burial shroud and coffin. Fan Xuan, pleased with my devotion, imparted all the profound mysteries of the methods.

For over forty years, I wandered rivers and lakes, and the efficacy of my master’s teachings was as responsive as an echo. Though many sought the Dao, few were deemed worthy of transmission. As the saying goes: "Disciples seek masters easily, but masters seek disciples with difficulty." This is no idle claim.

Moreover, today’s practitioners often corrupt talismans and incantations, rendering them flawed and erroneous. When applied to healing, no response is received. Is the method itself inefficacious? No—it is the failure of transmission. At seventy, I met you, who have studied diligently and whose aspirations are admirable. I shall fully transmit the master’s teachings to propagate the true doctrine.

To future learners: unless you offer gold and treasures, pledge your devotion, and swear before Heaven and Earth, do not lightly divulge this. This is my wish and the fortune of the method. I, Yuanchang, have faithfully upheld my master’s transmission, and its efficacy in practice has long been known. Thus, I compile this volume as a treasured inheritance for saving the world. Should later scholars obtain this text, cherish and practice it, and the ranks of immortals may be attained. To carelessly divulge or profane it invites severe retribution from the Mysterious Tribunal. May the generals and officials of the Ancestral Master bear witness.

Respectfully inscribed by Zhang Yuanchang, fourth-generation descendant of the Tianpeng lineage.

*The Origins of the Tianpeng Lineage*

Long ago, the lineage’s founder, Master Pinlefeng, suffered from consumption. In a dream, a divine being said: "Seek the true immortals of Mount Hua, and your illness may be cured." The master ascended the mountain and resided there for over two months, but his condition worsened. The mountain’s Daoists, fearing his death, refused him lodging. Leaning on his staff, he descended, and halfway down the slope, exhausted, he sat. Suddenly, three Daoists appeared and asked: "Why are you here?" The master explained his plight. The Daoists replied: "Return to the mountain. I have a prescription beneath the seat of the Perfected Wang. Seek Lu Yanghao, and memorialize your illness—it will soon be cured." With that, they vanished.

The master marveled and returned to the mountain. Beneath the seat of the Perfected Wang, he indeed found the text. Lu Yanghao had just ascended the mountain, and the master had him copy and memorialize it. His illness was immediately cured. Thereafter, the master practiced this method among rivers and lakes, achieving manifest responses, and many sought the Dao.

In truth, this transmission employs the Four Generals of the Dharma’s Expedient Methods and the Four Immortals of Mount Shenshan as its foundation, establishing a method to deliver people, called the *Four Generals*. The *Purple Court* incorporates common medicinal herbs like *Yi* and *Qi*, which also prove efficacious.

At that time, Yan Tongpan of Fuzhou, styled Jing’an, established a Daoist abbey to welcome masters of the Dao from across the land. One day, the master arrived, and Yan received him with great courtesy.

Jing’an’s younger brother, Fan Yuanxuan, served him with even greater reverence. The master, pleased by his devotion and recognizing his aptitude for receiving the Dao, transmitted this method to him. Yuanxuan practiced it with remarkable efficacy, though he had yet to deliver others. In his later years, beset by worldly upheavals and family poverty, he relocated to Lixian Township in Chongren, beneath an osmanthus tree on Huolu Ridge. He married a woman of the Zhao clan, whose nature inclined toward drink.

At that time, Guo Xueya of Huangxi, a clansman of the master’s elder brother, also studied under Yuanxuan, and both received the transmission of the *Eight Generals*. Xueya’s practice yielded verification, and he issued a talisman declaring: *"The Daoist methods are further refined across the land, yet the* Purple Court *remains unmatched among rivers and lakes."* Upon seeing this, Yuanxuan remarked, *"Even I have no end to my harmony."* From then on, Huang and Han incurred the master’s displeasure.

Yet Xueya remained at Yuanxuan’s door day and night, serving with labor and obedience beyond that of a slave, though he had still not received the full transmission. When Yuanxuan’s illness grew critical, he said to Xueya, *"Among my four or five disciples, none have served me as you have. I shall die soon, yet I regret that my burial clothes, shroud, coffin, and outer casket remain unprepared—what is to be done?"* Xueya replied, *"Master, do not trouble yourself over this; your disciple will see to each detail."* Yuanxuan, pleased, swore an oath: *"If you provide me with garments, I shall ensure you wear brocade. If you furnish the planks, I shall return two coffins to you."*

He then instructed, *"Bring down the chest from my bed frame."* One by one, he examined the method texts within and handed them to Xueya, saying, *"All has been thoroughly entrusted to you. Yet the method for pursuing consumptive ailments still holds the profound mysteries of the Inner Court—all of which are transmitted orally. Now I pass them to you."* And so he revealed all his secrets.

After Yuanxuan’s death, Xueya clothed him in the prepared garments and buried him in the coffin from his own hall. By this method, Xueya’s name resounded across rivers and lakes. Though some of his disciples received the transmission, only my late father and Shi Yuru did so in full. The two families exchanged letters frequently yet never met, each unaware of what the other had attained.

When Xueya transmitted the method to my late father, he said, *"A hundred taels for the* Purple Court*, fifty taels for the* Flowing Water *method—this is all I teach you. If your son is unteachable, I shall not transmit further. If your grandson proves worthy, you must teach him for me."*

One day, my late father again prepared a token of sincerity and presented it, knowing Xueya had urgent need. Seizing the opportunity, he sought to exhaust all secrets. Xueya smiled and said, *"The method is already complete; there is no need to ask further. The texts you may copy, but you must answer my urgency as I answer yours—like unending gold, I teach you so your descendants may benefit without end."*

From my youth, I followed my late father in treating consumptive ailments for twenty years. Practicing this method for over twenty more, I have seen swift and resonant responses, aided by the efficacy of my late father’s spirit and the authority of his assisting generals.

I have often reflected that those afflicted with consumptive illnesses, as the saying goes, *"hide their ailments."* Truly, this is so. Those who contract such diseases fear others knowing or speaking of it—yet how can they not speak? The afflicted are deluded by ghosts, despising any mention of their condition. By the time they awaken and seek treatment, the illness has already deepened.

Moreover, some physicians, though aware of the consumption and their own inability to cure it, conceal the truth to mislead the patient. Even as death approaches, they claim the illness is harmless. Alas, how can such medicine effect a cure?

Consumption arises from five sources: *wine exhaustion, sexual exhaustion, depletion exhaustion, qi exhaustion,* and *transmitted exhaustion.* Their symptoms appear similar, but *transmitted consumption* involves worms and malevolent spirits, bringing calamity that even kin cannot sever.

Transmitted consumption stems from five causes: contracting the illness from the clothing or fabrics of a consumptive household (*clothing transmission*); acquiring it through the utensils of an afflicted family (*utensil transmission*); inhabiting a consumptive’s dwelling (*dwelling transmission*); consuming food or drink sent by a consumptive household, or partaking of their wine and meat (*food transmission*); or mourning the dead and inhaling the *qi* of their corpse (*corpse transmission*). Those who fall ill without cause suffer from *flying corpse* or *wandering consumption*, often due to grudges, curses, or oral hexes.

When one first contracts the illness, symptoms include alternating chills and fever, aching joints, vexing heat in the five centers, withered hair, dizziness, coughing with phlegm, vomiting or coughing blood, nausea, palpitations, shortness of breath, chest oppression, abdominal distension or pain, heartburn, bitter taste, dry tongue, sallow complexion, weakness, cravings for meat, or sudden aversion to food, swollen lymph nodes, nightmares of ghostly unions, seminal emissions, turbid urine, pain radiating from the back to the heart, throat sores, throbbing headaches, and disrupted yin-yang balance. Over years, the symptoms grow increasingly strange: worms may move throughout the body, or one may feel biting in the abdomen or back, or sense them intercepting food in the throat, or emerging from the genitals or anus—such bizarre manifestations are limitless.

In prolonged cases, symptoms worsen: edema, diarrhea, spontaneous sweating, night sweats, emaciated calves, loss of complexion, sore throat, wheezing, chest tightness, crimson lips, flushed face, blood-spotted skin, involuntary seminal emissions in men, uncontrolled vaginal discharge in women, blocked menstruation, throat sores—all dire signs, with ten out of ten cases proving fatal.

For those seeking treatment, one must first compose a sincere petition, detailing the symptoms and their causes. Relying on this, issue talismans for fumigation and verification, submit memorials to the spirits, pursue the worms, and administer restorative treatment to dispel the symptoms. The afflicted must cultivate themselves with utmost care, avoiding physical exertion. If they fail to observe the precepts—succumbing to cold or heat, excessive joy, anger, sorrow, or anxiety, overindulging in food or drink, neglecting hunger or overeating, or violating abstinence from wine and sex—if they disregard restorative care and moderation, the illness will soon recur, leaving no hope for recovery.

On the first day of the jiashen year of the Zhizheng era, fifth-generation descendant Zhang Shunlie respectfully inscribed.

**Procedures for Practice**

For all who come to the altar seeking treatment, first write three *Wash-Hand Talismans*, then seven *Fumigate-Brush Talismans*. Have the patient wash their hands with the *Wash-Hand Talisman* and soap, without drying with cloth to avoid lint, allowing the hands to air-dry. Some claim medicinal ingredients are used in the talismans, but I employ only water for washing. Once the hands are dry, rub them together briskly, then examine them closely.

Next, light incense in a censer and burn one *Fumigate-Brush Talisman*, folding it into the flame. Have the patient hold their hands over the smoke, repeating the process for each talisman. Some may show results after one, others after three or five. If fine hairs appear in the smoke or upon re-fumigation, it confirms *consumptive transmission*; if none appear, the condition is not present. Careful observation is essential—mistaking lint for hairs wastes effort in treatment.

When hairs emerge, note their color and location. The five viscera—green, yellow, red, white, and black—each correspond to specific afflictions. The hairs reveal which organ is damaged, their length, thickness, quantity, and whether they stretch, contract, soften, stiffen, or fork. If they appear at the *Heavenly Gate*, *Tiger’s Mouth*, *Ghost’s Door*, palm center, beneath fingers, on the back of the hand, or the upper joints of fingers—left for men, right for women—red or black, long or thick, contracted or extended, numerous, soft, or forked, with strange colors, these are all inauspicious signs. Careful examination reveals the depth of the illness.

If others have been preemptively sought for treatment and fumigation, and hairs appear, pursue the worms; if none appear, return to this altar for re-fumigation. The absence of hairs may result from improper invocation of the spirit-generals to restrain the worms during the initial talisman use, allowing them to escape into the bodies of the patient’s family or hide within walls. Use the proper method to summon and confine them to the patient’s original site of injury. After one or two days, reapply the talismans for fumigation—hairs will surely appear.

In cases where the worms have damaged the kidneys, fumigation often yields no hairs, yet pursuit may still reveal worms. This is a known occurrence.

When hairs appear during fumigation, record the symptoms and submit a petition to the *Northern Emperor*, the *Northern Dipper*, the *Four Saints*, and the *Zongshi of Mount Hua*. Issue talismans to pursue the worms: first, place one *General Talisman* at the front of the room. Then, use forty-nine talismans, ingesting seven daily while awaiting a response.

When the worms descend, signs will manifest akin to the three therapeutic methods of sweating, vomiting, and purging in medicine. Three, seven, or fifteen days after ingesting the talismans, the body may grow hot and sweat—remain still until itching arises, as if insects crawl across the skin. This is the *sweating* response. Wipe the body clean with clothing, then boil and rewear it. Burn the bedding as well.

If nausea and retching occur, the patient will vomit worms, foul phlegm, or undigested food—examine the contents for worms. This is the *vomiting* response. If the abdomen rumbles or aches, signaling a bowel movement, avoid using the latrine. Collect the excrement in a chamber pot; whether loose or hard, worms will be present. This is the *purging* response. Worms expelled through vomiting or purging are large and visible, while those in sweat are small and hard to see.

The forms of worms vary: some resemble infants, snakes, rats, loaches, eels, toads, tadpoles, mosquitoes, gnats, ants, lice, or other creatures; others appear as tangled silk, rotting floss, flesh balls, hair, horsehair, palm fiber, grass seeds, hemp, millet, fruit pits, essence-blood, glue, lacquer, rotting dough, or phlegm—countless shapes, impossible to describe fully. Examine them closely and burn them to prevent recurrence. If discarded outdoors, rain and dew may revive them. The worms, pressed by thunder and fire, may die if small, but larger ones survive—this has been observed in expelled worms.

The original method of pursuing worms relies on the three responses of sweating, vomiting, and purging. After years of practice, variations have emerged. Some patients sweat first from the feet, then the legs, followed by the buttocks, arms, flanks, and head, recovering in stages. Others, after twenty-one days of pursuit, show no response but nosebleeds; upon washing and examining the blood, worms as thick as shoelaces and over six inches long were found. Still others expelled centipedes from their ears, or worms the size of ants crawled from their beards and faces. Such strange phenomena are limitless. Without proper method, worms may flee.

When pursuing worms with talismans, proceed gradually—do not invoke the *Seven Ghosts* or impose deadlines for responses. Trust in the spirit-officers’ discretion. If the talismans are ingested too hastily, the worms may thrash and die within the consumed organs, worsening the damage and making restoration difficult. The patient may soon perish. A gradual approach allows thunder and fire to weaken the worms, preventing further feeding until they perish from exhaustion. The talismans in this tradition include restorative treatment, so by the time the worms descend, the damaged areas have already begun healing—delay is thus preferable. Premature expulsion leaves the viscera depleted and *original qi* weakened, making restoration difficult. Delay ensures the viscera remain firm and *original yang* intact, facilitating easy recovery. Other traditions prioritize swift responses, but many fail to recover.

In households where many have perished from this illness, the worms grow large and gain intelligence, able to move in and out of bodies, hide in walls, circulate *qi*, and spread toxins to infect others.

Moreover, the worms may exit the body of the afflicted and enter the body of one yet uninfected, roaming and feeding before returning to the sick. In critical cases where the five viscera are failing, the corpse-worms emerge one month—or even half a month—before the patient’s death, hence the saying: *"When the worms depart, the person perishes."* Some claim the worms must not be expelled, warning that their removal leads to death—this is a grave error. Others, observing the patient’s critical state, advocate first restoring then expelling, but this too is misguided. If the worms are not pursued and eradicated, they will fester within, consuming the flesh like maggots, spreading corruption—how then could the patient survive? After expelling the corpse-worms, restoration must begin at once, not delayed even a single day. One must obtain a pig’s leg bone. For coughing, add pig’s lung, simmer until tender, then mix in a little rice. Once cooked, cut fifteen strips of the restorative talisman into fine pieces and stir them into the broth, ensuring the paper does not clump. Take this at dawn each day, and after consuming it, do not return to sleep, for this is most harmful. Salt must not be added.

After consuming the talisman for four or five days, the abdomen settles, food becomes palatable, daily meals increase, and the symptoms gradually recede—even the critically ill may recover. If, however, the stomach rejects it, the abdomen swells, or diarrhea persists, or if one feels nauseous after eating, even a mild case may turn perilous. Strict dietary restrictions must be observed: pond fish, leavened bread, baked cakes, sesame cakes, beef, lamb, goose, sow pork, rapeseed oil, fried or roasted foods, cured meats, alcohol, raw or cold items, and all toxic substances must be avoided with utmost care. Daily meals should not be excessive, nor should one undertake long journeys, carry heavy loads, or strain the sinews and vessels, lest the injured areas suffer further damage and the illness relapse. Sexual abstinence is imperative, and one must maintain vigilance for a full year, allowing the injured flesh—both old and new—to knit together, so that movement and rest may proceed without hindrance. Even in mild cases, convalescence for half a year is essential to ensure lasting vitality and longevity.

*Upper Scroll of the Purple Palace Mysterious Writ*
**Principal Rites**

The Celestial Star Who Subdues the Myriad Demons, the North Pole Purple Tenuity Great Emperor.
The Central Heaven Great Sage, the Nine Sovereigns of the Northern Dipper, the Divine Perfected Sovereign of the Great Dao.
The Nine Heavens’ Supreme Assistant, the Spiritually Potent and Eminent Deity, the Jade Perfected of Primordial Void and Longevity, the True Lord of the Azure Heaven and the Solar Fiery Heavenly Worthy.
The True Lord of the Azure Heaven and the Solar Fiery Heavenly Worthy.
The Great Sage of the Celestial Stem, the Purple Court Perfected, the Golden Radiance Heavenly Lord.
**Lineage of the Dao’s Origin**
The Sagely Master, Teacher of Humans and Devas, the Great Perfected of the Threefold Numinous, Threefold Blessings, and Threefold Responses, Protector of the Realm.
Ancestral Master, the Flying Rosy Clouds Perfected Dong.
Lineage-Confirming Ancestral Master, the Golden Florescence Perfected Lu of Nurturing Vitality.
First-Generation Ancestral Master, the Joyously Impoverished Perfected Fang.
Ancestral Master, the Tranquil Hermitage Perfected Yan of Dao-Nature.
Second-Generation Ancestral Master, the Carriage Terrace Perfected Yan of Dao-Prosperity.
Third-Generation Lineage Master, the Snow Cliff Perfected Guo of Responding to Auspices.
Fourth-Generation Lineage Master, the Celestial Vault Perfected Zhang of Primordial Longevity.
Fifth-Generation Scripture Master, the Clear Stream Perfected Zhang of Shun’s Ardency.

**Principal Generals**
The Marshal Zhao Guangyuan, Commander of the Primordial Qi of the Supreme August Palace, Catcher and Slayer of Ghosts.
Three heads, six arms, wielding the marshal’s seal, binding rope, bow, arrows, sword, and fire bell.
The Marshal Mao Weiba, Great General Who Imprisons, Interrogates, and Torments Ghosts, Governing the Myriad Demons of the Three Realms.
The Marshal Tong Liyang, Great General Who Captures and Restrains Ghosts, Commanding the Myriad Demons.
The Marshal Xiong Shisheng, Devourer and Consumer of Ghosts.
Crowned with a cloud-wreathed cap, clad in golden armor, azure robe with wind-swept sash, black boots, brandishing a great blade.
The Marshal Deng Xingwen, Scorcher and Illuminator of Ghosts under the Fiery Emperor’s Wrath.
The Marshal Li Shijin, Breaker of Bones, Slayer and Annihilator of Ghosts in the Four Netherworlds.
The Marshal Tian Zhen, Commander of the Golden-Armored Flying Hawks.
The Marshal Jia Zhen, Commander of the Silver-Armored Hunting Dogs.

**Deputy Generals**
The Four-Eyed Elder, Celestial General Li Guozhen.

With a face the hue of jujube, large eyes, four pupils, wearing a gold-threaded net cap, a crane-feather cloak of azure mist, black boots, and wielding an iron brush—High Northern Elder Gao Bozhen.

Crowned with a snow-curled cap, clad in a black robe, green boots, a wind-swept sash, and brandishing a great blade—Long-Skulled Beast Zhou Zhongda.

Topknot bound toward the heavens, black boots, green robe, wind-swept sash, and holding a white staff—White Owl of the Three Spirits, Liu Biwen.

Curved-topknot, yellow headband, golden armor, azure silk robe, wind-swept sash, black boots, and lifting a three-legged white-backed magpie—Mighty Sword Spirit-King Zheng Xianli.

Topknot bound toward the heavens, golden armor, green robe, red boots, and wielding twin swords—Body-Broad-as-the-Wind Zhang Xi.

Crowned with a snow-curled cap, red robe, wind-swept sash, golden armor, green boots, holding a blade and clenching twin swords in his mouth—Heavenly Courier of Fierce Fury, Liu Yi.

Topknot bound toward the heavens, golden armor, black robe and boots, both hands lifting a green banner emblazoned with four beasts—Scorching Blood Messenger of the Fiery Emperor, Long Xu.

With a crimson face, three eyes, fangs, vermilion hair, a Heavenly Guardian’s crown, scarlet robes, red shoes, riding a wheel of fire, left hand forming the Purple Tenuity mudra, right hand wielding a flame sword, his entire body wreathed in fire, the blade’s tip blazing fiercely—Heavenly General Gao, Pursuer of Consumptive Spirits and Slayer of Wasting Ghosts.

Heavenly General Li, Collector of Lingering Curses and Seizer of Poisons.

Marshal Xiong, Great General Who Pursues Consumptive Spirits.

Great General Who Fills Essence and Replenishes Marrow.

Thirty-Six Heavenly Generals.

Seventy-Two Talismanic Officers.

**The Master’s Wondrous Application**
The Master draws upon the Northern qi to suffuse his body, transforming his spirit, forgetting form and severing thought. Closing his eyes, he inwardly visualizes the radiant light within his heart’s aperture. Then, directing the divine light of his right eye, he inscribes the Nine Characters before him. With both hands, he projects two Dipper stars forth, envisioning their starlight blazing brilliantly. The Master exhales his true qi, which shoots into the Dipper, emanating from the Nine Orifices to manifest the Seven Primordial Star Lords—hair unbound, swords in hand, vividly present upon the altar.

Thereafter, he recites the Tianpeng Incantation once, visualizing the true form of Tianpeng: four heads, eight arms, each wielding halberd, spear, halberd-sword, imperial bell, seal, fire lance, and fire rope; clad in a purple robe and golden armor, head adorned with the Xiaoyao Huayang turban, emerging within the Dipper. His countenance is wrathful, his might shakes heaven and earth, his entire body radiates the killing qi of thunder and fire.

The Master inhales qi to suffuse his body, declaring, “I am the Emperor.”

Next, he recites the Purification of Heaven and Earth Incantation and the Tianpeng Incantation.

**Solemnly Summoning:**
The Qi-Unifying Marshal Zhao of the Primordial Responding Great August Prefecture, Commander-in-Chief Who Seizes and Slays Ghosts;
Marshal Mao, Overseer of the Three Realms Who Imprisons, Interrogates, and Torments Ghosts;
Marshal Tong, Commander Who Captures and Restrains Ghosts;
Marshal Xiong, Devourer and Consumer of Ghosts;
Marshal Li, the Four-Eyed Elder;
Marshal Gao, the High Northern Elder;
Marshal Zhou, the Long-Skulled Beast;
Marshal Liu, the White Owl of the Three Spirits;
Marshal Zheng, the Mighty Sword Spirit-King;
Marshal Zhang, Body-Broad-as-the-Wind;
Marshal Liu, Heavenly Courier of Fierce Fury;
Marshal Long, Scorching Blood Messenger of the Fiery Emperor;
Marshal Gao, Commander of the Golden-Armored Flying Hawks;
Marshal Gao, Commander of the Silver-Armored Hunting Dogs;
Marshal Gao, Pursuer of Consumptive Spirits;
Marshal Xiong, Great General Who Pursues Consumptive Spirits;
Marshal Li, Collector of Lingering Curses and Seizer of Poisons;
Marshal Qiu, Rear-Guard Great General;
Great General Who Fills Essence and Replenishes Marrow;
Thirty-Six Heavenly Generals;
Seventy-Two Talismanic Officers—
Hasten to the altar, awaiting commands to act. *Swiftly!*

The Master forms the Living Luminary mudra with his left hand, gazing toward the northwest’s loftiest heights, and draws forth the purple-black golden light of the Supreme Mystery’s qi to spread before him. The Generals emerge from the killing qi. Upon completing the mudra, the true Dipper vanishes, leaving only the Generals manifest within the killing qi, ready for service.

**General Command Talisman**
This talisman employs the Tianpeng Incantation to inscribe the killing character, infusing it with killing qi. Above it, the character for "Commander-in-Chief" is added, followed by the auxiliary talisman.

**Talisman Formula**
Solemnly invoke the Qi-Unifying Great General of the Primordial Responding Great August Prefecture, the Primary and Deputy Marshals, and the Six Heavenly Generals Who Pursue Consumptive Spirits. Command them to lead their entire host of soldiers, follow the talisman’s decree, and station themselves to oversee the afflicted chamber, guarding the patient’s body, capturing and restraining corpse-worms and ghostly entities. Permit no escape, awaiting the order to pursue and strike. Furthermore, bid them work ceaselessly day and night to encircle and seize the ancestral kin of consumptive ghosts and vengeful dead, relentlessly executing them until all measures are fully enacted.

Once inscribed, recite the Tianpeng Incantation forward while brushing the talisman in the same direction; recite it backward while brushing in reverse. Draw the Supreme Mystery’s qi from behind the elbow into the brushstroke, then lift upward and seal with three sets of seven strokes.

**Snow Cliff’s Cloud:**
This talisman commands all Generals. Whenever fumigation reveals even the slightest trace, instruct the patient’s household to offer incense and lamps before the afflicted, lest the corpse-worms escape.

When inscribing talismans, first recite the Tianpeng Incantation, transforming the spirit into the Emperor. Recite the Tianpeng Incantation again, drawing the qi of thunder and fire. Invoke the Black Emperor of the North, infusing the Supreme Mystery’s qi. Then, channel the thunder-fire qi into the brush, envisioning the flame sword wreathed in blazing fire. The paper represents the patient—with blade and sword, slay the corpse-worms. Thereafter, summon true wrath to embody the killing and punitive force. If pursuing and striking, wait until stillness and calm prevail, embodying the power of generation.

**Qi-Unifying Commander-in-Chief Talisman**
Scorching Blood of the Fiery Emperor.

**Fourfold Clarity Shatters the Corpse**
**Heavenly Strategy Annihilates the Kindred**
With one stroke of the divine blade,
the myriad ghosts dissolve themselves.

**Heaven-Slaughter, Earth-Slaughter,**
**Year-Slaughter, Month-Slaughter, Day-Slaughter, Hour-Slaughter,**
**Calamity-Slaughter, Tribulation-Slaughter—**
all myriad ghosts, upon encountering this talisman, self-destruct.

**Left: Six Ding**
**Right: Six Jia**
Mao Gongwei, Tong Liyang, Li Shijin, Deng Xingwen,
Zhao Guangzhou, Gao Tianzhen, Gao Jiazhen.

After inscribing the names with the Tianpeng Incantation, draw in the Supreme Mystery’s qi. Then, gaze toward the Kun direction to summon the Commander-in-Chief. Next, inscribe *Li Zi Zhuang Xiang*, adding the primary and secondary slaughters.

**Reverently invoke the Heavenly Generals,**
descend directly into the afflicted’s body.
Slay the malevolent forces within so-and-so,
corpse-worms and ghostly entities—
pursue and strike them with clarity,
expel them from the body’s field,
manifesting distinct retribution.
Repair the inflicted harm,
regulate and harmonize qi and blood,
dispel the ailment of so-and-so,
swiftly bringing response.

If the afflicting ghost is as described above, then say:
**Reverently invoke the Heavenly Generals,**
seize and restrain the lineage of consumptive corpse-ghosts and kindred spirits,
enter the patient’s dreams to reveal their forms,
reporting the cause of the affliction with haste.

Add the **Three-Seven Seal**.
**Primary and Secondary Eight Generals Talisman.**

High Bozhen, Li Guozhen, Zhou Zhongda, Liu Biwen, Zheng Guangli, Xiong Shisheng, Zhang Xi, Liu Yi—
If treating *flying corpse*, use plain owl.
For *running influx*, use the great beast.
Add all talismans, recite the **Heavenly Penetrating Mantra**, and proceed as before.

**Five-Fire Talisman** (also called **Flame Emperor Talisman**)
Heavenly Fire, Earthly Fire, Yang Fire, Yin Fire, the True Fire of My Heart, the True Fire of the Great Yang, the Wandering True Fire of the Four Seasons and Five Thunders—
For each "fire" character, draw in the *qi* of thunder-fire, inhale through the *yin* and *wu* constellations, and exhale into the Five-Thunder Fire, directing it through the seven orifices into the talisman.
Then, with the eyes fixed on the *xun* direction, assist the fire’s eruption.

**Break through, shatter, sever the ghost’s head, snap the ghost’s limbs—**
chant without cease.
**Flame Emperor Mantra**, swiftly summon into the talisman.
Firmly visualize a ball of fire within the cinnabar field, with fierce blood inside.
With the brush’s intent, split open the cinnabar-field fireball to reveal the fierce blood, then stir it with the brush’s force, circulating it upward to the heart and out through the Heavenly Eye before you.
Draw the fierce blood back into the Central Palace, blend it, and stir again with the brush’s force, driving it up to the Mud-Pill Palace.
Sound the *tian* tone with the eyes, directing the generals thrice into the talisman.
Visualize the fierce blood within the raging fire, and in wrathful fury, draw in thunder-fire with a shout to reinforce it.
Chant seven revolutions of wrath, painting the mouth as you intone:
*First revolution: Heaven and Earth quake,*
*Second revolution: Sun and Moon darken,*
*Third revolution: The Dipper’s handle stirs,*
*Fourth revolution: Thunder-fire erupts,*
*Fifth revolution: Thunderclaps roar,*
*Sixth revolution: Corpse-ghosts perish,*
*Seventh revolution: Seize and restrain all rebels against Heaven, all lawless transmitters of consumptive corpse-disease and latent afflictions, all demonic essences.*
*Come beneath my talismanic command—*
*submit to death, motionless and inert.*

Dip the brush, assume wrathful posture, and subdue the corpse-worms.
Next, add the primary and secondary *xuan-qi*, summoning them in.
Alternatively, add the *sha*-subduing command for fumigation, reciting:
*Heaven subdues, Earth subdues,*
*Year subdues, Month subdues,*
*Day subdues, Hour subdues.*
**Reverently invoke the Heavenly Generals,**
descend directly with the talisman into so-and-so’s body,
pursue and subdue as instructed all contagions of consumptive transmission and toxic influx.
If the influx-*qi* lingers in the body,
request the Heavenly Generals to extract the worms and effluvia,
manifesting them clearly in the patient’s two hands
for evident treatment—
swiftly bring response.

After the incantation, add *zhuang-xuan* and infuse *qi*.
When, after pursuit and attack, the chest and heart grow hot,
this is *empty tide*—
use cinnabar to inscribe a talisman, dispelling the three *huo-qi* of fire.
Form the talisman into a pellet, mix with well-flower water and cinnabar,
face north, inhale the smoke of aloeswood, and swallow.

**Flame Emperor Mantra Inscription**
The master enters stillness, visualizing fierce blood within the cinnabar field,
circulating it to the heart, then to the Mud-Pill’s divine chamber, and projecting it forward.
Draw it back into the Central Palace, then inflate the *qi* with the Seven-Revolution Mantra, painting wrathfully.
Draw thunder-fire from the *xun* direction, and with the eyes, guide the fierce-blood generals and thunder-fire, exhaling with the brush’s force into the talisman.
Visualize all within the talisman as raging fire, then add the *sha*-subduing strokes:
paint outward in the *shun-peng* direction, inward in the *ni-peng* direction.
Flick the brush straight downward, chanting *Divine Blade*—one stroke—
and visualize the fire-sword’s fury.

To subdue corpse-worms, add *zhuang* to dispel cold.
Inscribe the fierce blood into the master’s name, chant the mantra,
and dispatch the marshal from the *xun* direction.
The master inhales the *qi* of thunder-fire from *xun*, seals it within, and fills to bursting.
With a flash of the eyes, lightning strikes—
then draw down the marshal’s single stroke into the talisman.
Form the mudra, paint with the Seven-Revolution Mantra, and circulate the thunder-fire brush-force.
Draw in *xun*-fire, then inscribe the two "subdue" characters—
omit the *sha* character.

For the third talisman, follow the Seven Ghosts’ method, infusing fierce blood.
Apply the inner fire to the two "subdue" characters,
visualizing the talisman’s thunder-fire surging forth to fill the patient’s chamber,
the fire-*qi* pressing upon all within.
When the body grows intensely hot,
the master directs his own *qi* to the point of dissolution, then shouts to halt and seal.

**Reviving Passage Talisman**
Exhale red light, circulating heart-fire downward.

Exhale black *qi*, circulating kidney-water upward to rise.
*Tai Shang* decrees: Mighty officers, silver fangs guard and uphold the true *qi*,
sweeping away baleful spirits—thunder-fire, celestial pivot, *xun*-triple *qi* exhaled within.

For the right talisman, use a single sheet of yellow paper, six rows and six columns.
Compose the spirit and settle the mind, sit suspended with legs spread,
left hand forming the *sha* mudra, right hand grinding ink.
Recite the Heavenly Vanguard Mantra, drawing in thunder-fire with the exhalation,
then the northern mantra to summon dark *qi*,
the Six Palaces Mantra to invoke *Feng*-*sha*,
the Golden Light Mantra to summon the pivot’s breath.
Five *qi* are called into the inkstone.
As before, sequentially gather *qi* to infuse the paper,
then gather *qi* to charge the brush.
Recite the Heavenly Vanguard Mantra again,
drawing *xun*-*qi* to exhale upon the brush-tip,
emanating a single streak of golden light—
as the light stirs and surges, begin writing.

Upon completion, as before, gather all *qi* to charge the brush and trace the central boundary once,
then gather all *qi* to charge the brush and trace the left and right boundaries twice.
Recite the incantation:
*Above it flows upward, below it streams downward—*
*where true* qi *arrives,*
*demonic essence perishes.*

Recite without fixed count, ensuring the brush-force is vigorous and unbroken,
the spirit’s radiance ever attending.
Thunder-fire, lightning’s glow, true *qi* congeals—
all blends and coalesces.

Xue Ya says: This talisman unblocks *qi* in men and regulates menstruation in women,
specifically treating disharmony of *qi* and blood,
obstructed menses,
yin-yang separation,
and cold-heat sores or toxins lodged beneath the skin.
After ingesting the talisman, true *qi* pursues and expels demonic *qi*—
if the abdomen rumbles like thunder, or in treating cold damage,
its efficacy is profound.

**Tonifying Talisman**
Exhale.

Exhale with *chui*, *xu*, *xi*, *hu*.
Recite the incantation:
*One, two, three, four, five—*
*Metal, Wood, Water, Fire, Earth.*
*Heart’s one, two, three, four, five—*
*qi* governs the myriad dharmas’ source.
Where water pains arise, swiftly gather and fill.
Exhale: *Lao Jun*, come to relieve suffering.

Metal stores the liver’s *hun*,
lungs store the *po*,
the heart stores *qi*,
kidneys store will,
the spleen stores intent.
May the celestial numinous nodes flourish,
granting long life’s preservation.
Of the Great Mystery’s One,
guard its true form.
The Five Viscera’s Spirit Lords,
each safeguard peace and tranquility.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and command!*

Once the *Metal Radiance Incantation* concludes,
the master half-opens the mouth,
tongue pressing the upper palate,
drawing the Five *qi*, Thunder-Fire, Metal Radiance, and *Gang qi* into the *Flower Pool*.
Close the mouth, await the nectar to fill the pool,
then grind the ink anew, reciting the prior incantation as before.
Again, guide the *qi* into the *Flower Pool*,
nurturing the true fluid,
swallowing the Jade Knack,
sending it into the Spirit Palace,
blending into the Great Void.
Within true mindfulness, a great general coalesces,
like an infant dwelling in the Spirit Palace.

Proceed to inscribe the talisman,
focusing intent upon the great general.
Prepare thin paper in the Five Phases’ five apertures,
inscribe the talisman’s first and second incantations,
concentrating intent within.
Gather and blend the Five *qi*,
harmonizing and overflowing,
exhale into each inscription in turn.

Once more, concentrate spirit,
hands forming the Sword Mudra,
holding the talisman before you,
lifting with intent,
visualizing the general’s entry with clarity.
Recite the prior incantation again,
drawing the Five *qi*, Metal Radiance, and Celestial *Gang*,
merging them within.
Exhale to secure the general,
radiance fusing, spirit gathering,
*qi* like rouge.
Draw *qi* once more, exhale into it,
directing your spirit’s radiance
to infuse and illuminate the talisman.

Pray thus:
*Reverently summon the Great General of Marrow-Filling and Essence-Replenishing,*
*the Five Viscera’s Mighty Deity of Benefit,*
*the Three Origins’ Five Virtues’ Direct Talisman General.*
*Divide the true, descend the qi,*
*swiftly enter the talisman!*

Upon concluding the prayer,
envision the general seated within the Golden Radiance Talisman.
The master then folds and divides it,
cutting finely for men or women,
placing it into the meat of the meal,
avoiding salt.
For deficiency, use ginseng and astragalus,
pounded to extract their natural juice.

Xue Ya says: Borrow the five grains and meat’s flavors
to lodge true *qi*’s supplementation.
After consumption, avoid sleep at all costs,
for sleep harms the spleen.
Best taken before dawn or at noon.
If all symptoms recede, this marks successful tonification—
even the perilous may stabilize.
If symptoms worsen, treatment is difficult.

**For Pain Connecting Back to Heart**
Recite the *Celestial Canopy Incantation*,
summon the Four-Eyed Elder,
drawing Mysterious *qi* to manifest the general,
wielding an iron brush to expel baleful *qi*,
directing *qi* to the brush for use.
Take a breath of the Great Marshal’s brush-tip *qi*,
infuse it into the talisman,
seizing the toxin within the void.
Then firmly declare:
*Reverently summon the Four-Eyed Elder, Marshal Li,*
*leading the Great Mystery’s Stern Execution Officers and Soldiers,*
*swiftly enter the talisman,*
*urgently halt the pain connecting back to the heart in the afflicted!*

The master again inhales the brush’s *qi*, exhales onto the brush,
shouting once to halt,
adding *Gang* and *Li* *qi*.
Hastily apply three to seven layers of Great Celestial *qi*.
This talisman is mixed with flour and applied to the painful area.

**Talisman for Ghostly Intercourse**
Inscribe the right talisman using the *Celestial Canopy Incantation*,
inverting the *Commander-in-Chief’s* endorsement:
*Summon the Celestial General to slay and subdue the lingering corpse,*
*severing demonic dreams.*
*Swiftly!*

For households where the husband seeks the deceased wife,
or the wife seeks the deceased husband,
resulting in mutual harm in dreams,
or for lingering corpse intercourse or lustful unions,
this talisman governs.
Affix it to the bed’s foot where it meets the ground.
For permanent severance, select a *Fu Duan* day,
notify the master to inscribe an iron talisman,
nailing it to the bed’s foot or doorframe.

**Talisman for Cough**
Inscribe using the *Celestial Canopy Incantation*.
With both hands, trace the Yin-Yang Dipper,
emerging from the body to unite the Dipper,
clearly visualized before you.
For heat-induced cough, add the *Commander-in-Chief*;
for cold-induced cough, add the Five Fires.
Add primary and secondary as needed.

Pray:
*Reverently summon the Northern Dipper’s Seven Origins Star Lords,*
*the Seven Origins’ True Essences,*
*descend into the talisman,*
*swiftly enter the afflicted one’s body,*
*flowing into the Five Viscera.*
*Lung Metal flourishes,*
*all spirits find peace,*
*myriad ghosts vanish.*
*Swiftly!*

Envision the Dipper’s truth starkly present in the altar.
Inhale the Dipper’s *qi*, exhale into the talisman,
imagining yellow *qi* misty and vast,
drawing central *qi* to exhale.
Next, envision the West’s white *qi* misty and vast,
inhale through the nose, exhale into it.
Then imagine the North’s water *qi* misty and vast,
blow into it.

Next pray:
*Mysterious Heaven’s numinous power,*
*Dipper Constellation’s essence,*
*Primal August One’s decree,*
*Nine Stars descend!*
Upon concluding the incantation,
direct the gaze to merge the Seven Stars into one,
vast as a chariot wheel.
The master inhales through the nose, draws in the Golden Radiance Star’s *qi*,
exhales into the talisman.
Then inscribe *Peng* in alignment, reciting the incantation slowly while tracing;
for urgent reversal, trace in opposition.
Project your own *Gang* before you,
brush lightly.
With the left hand, press down the Thunder Formation,
swallow the *Flower Pool’s* fluid,
directing it to the Cinnabar Field below.
Await the body’s response as verification,
then add the seal.

**For Vomiting Blood**
Inscribe using the *Celestial Canopy Incantation*,
adding the Five Fires above.
Trace the Yin-Yang Dipper,
emerging from the body to unite the Dipper,
envisioning the Dipper’s stars distinctly.

Recite:
*Northern Dipper Star Lords,*
*Seven Origins’ True Essences,*
*descend into the talisman,*
*swiftly enter the afflicted one’s body,*
*flowing into the Five Viscera.*
*Liver Wood flourishes,*
*all spirits find peace,*
*myriad ghosts vanish.*
*Swiftly!*

Envision the Seven Origins starkly present,
the North’s water *qi* misty and vast,
drawing *qi* through the nose, inhaling, and blowing into the talisman.
Next imagine the East’s wood *qi* lush and dense,
inhaling through the nose,
firmly exhaling into the talisman.
Then draw in Fire *qi*,
envisioning their intermingling without dispersion.

Next recite:
*Mysterious Heaven’s numinous power,*
*Dipper Constellation’s essence,*
*Primal August One’s decree,*
*Nine Stars descend!*
Upon concluding the incantation,
direct the gaze to merge the Seven Stars into one,
a golden radiance coalescing.
Guide it into the talisman with the eyes,
adding left and right alignments,
pressing the Thunder Formation straight down to center,
without lifting the brush.
Swallow the *Flower Pool’s* fluid,
awaiting the body’s response,
then add the seal.

**For Stopping Diarrhea and Purging**
Recite the *Peng Incantation* while inscribing,
adding primary and secondary baleful *qi*.
Baleful *qi* follows *Peng*’s alignment,
moving from outer to inner,
shouting *halt, halt!*

Reverse the alignment to counter *Peng*,
moving from outer to inner,
press the brush and shout *halt, halt!*
For stopping vomiting:
perform thus—
inhale *qi*, swallow, and settle at center,
awaiting the body’s response.
For stopping diarrhea:
perform thus—
draw in *qi*, seal the body’s ghostly gate,
settling at center before adding the seal.

**For Stopping Tidal Fever**
First add the primary and secondary seals,
then append baleful *qi*—*Mysterious Baleful*, *Ram Baleful*, *Dhāraṇī Baleful*—
envisioning the three *qi* within the talisman,
cold and pressing, undispersed.
Inscribe the Northern incantation with two alignments:
outer to inner, then inner to outer,
again from outer to inner,
brushing straight down.
With the Thunder Formation, drive out the fever *qi*,
expelling it from below.
Apply the third talisman without lifting the brush,
envisioning the baleful *qi* cold and pressing,
congealing within the talisman,
pervading the entire chamber.
The master directs their own skill,
sensing the response,
holding the brush at center,
then adding the command for ingestion.

**Dispelling Tidal Fever**
On the right, use the *Heavenly Peng* incantation,
inscribing the *Commander* inverted above.
With both hands, trace the Four Seats of the Yin-Yang Dipper.
Recite:
*Essence of Supreme Yin,*
*formed of Metal and Water.*
*Hear my summons,*
*swiftly enter the talisman.*
The master exhales a golden radiance,
a bridge suspended in the void.
Envision within the Dipper the two envoys—
*Ram* and *Dhāraṇī*—
appearing as comely women,
their bodies enveloped in black *qi*,
descending beneath the golden bridge.
The master inhales the *qi* of the two envoys and blows it in,
then draws in three breaths of *qi* into the talisman,
until the teeth grow cold.
After the two alignments, inscribe:
*Summon the Heavenly Generals to swiftly dispel*
*the tidal fever from the afflicted body.*

If the five centers are vexed, swallow with cinnabar-infused cold water, then inhale the smoke of aloeswood incense and swallow facing north.

**Boiling Ghosts**
When boiling ghosts, first summon the Commander to lead the five boiling-ghost generals to the altar. Once the Commander’s name is inscribed, invert the feet upward. Within, write: *Five Thunders, General Summons to Slay Corpse Ghosts, Dragon Dawn*. Follow the Five Fire Talisman to conclude. Fashion a paper twist, and with a single breath, ignite it from the talisman’s foot.

First light it beneath the afflicted one’s bed, then add it to the Earth God’s hall, and again to the Household Deities’ shrine. Have someone listen for the report of its crackling. If the scent of burning bone arises, it signals ancestral ghosts, female ghosts drawn by blood, ghosts of childbirth, or those transmitting corpse contagion through roasted flesh. Other malign influences include wine and vinegar vapors, sulfur and orpiment fumes, flames of grievance, ancient essence of lotus fragrance, the stench of Buddhist and Daoist bronze and iron, the reek of blades and beasts, the grassy breath of maternal uncles and aunts, the foulness of various *xiao*-spirits, or the consumptive miasma of neighbors. If these manifest in the patient’s dreams or sleep-talk, someone must listen for the response and proceed as deemed fit.

**Seven Ghosts, Four Illuminations, Shattering the Bones**
When inscribing this talisman, invoke the master to commence pursuit and summon the generals with clear intent. Infuse three breaths of *qi* into brush and ink, then inscribe with focused visualization.

On the right, use the *Heavenly Peng* incantation to write the talisman. For the Nine Slayings, write the Slaying with *ding* on the left and *jia* on the right. The master visualizes a fireball in the cinnabar field, imagining the brush as a fire sword. With one stroke, the fireball splits open, and the marshal appears. The master seals firmly, drawing the *qi* from the Ninefold Mud Pill into the body. With a single opening of the eyes, thunder and lightning swirl, and fire erupts from the talisman. Envision the stars’ radiance distinctly.

Recite:
*Reverently invite the Seven Stars of the Northern Dipper, the Seven Thousand Divine Generals, to descend into the talisman and slay the corpse ghosts. Swiftly compel their manifestation.*

Visualize the Dipper’s Perfected Ones, hair unbound and swords in hand, entering the talisman’s locus. Mobilize the Five Thunders into the intermediate realm, drawing the *qi* of the Central Heaven into the Mysterious Pass. Blow it toward the northwest’s highest point, envisioning the Purple Tenuity Emperor Star vast as a cartwheel, its light illuminating the earth. With both hands, trace the Northern Emperor’s command to slay and compel, and the *Kuigang*’s rousing decree to slay and compel the two Dippers. Shatter the Purple Tenuity Enclosure, and suddenly behold the Northern Emperor above, mounted on a crimson-maned white horse, attended by the Four Saints. Draw in the star *qi*.

Recite:
*Your servant reverently summons the Northern Culmen’s Great Emperor of Purple Tenuity, whose imperial carriage enters the talisman to personally lead the slaying and subjugation.*

The master concentrates the spirit, guiding the Emperor into the talisman with the gaze.

**Mysterious Void Incantation**
Reverently invite Marshal Heavenly Peng, Marshal Heavenly You, Marshal Winged Saint, and Marshal Protector Saint to lead their troops into the talisman. Visualize the Four Saints and their armies from the four directions entering the talisman. Then inscribe the Dipper among the Four Saints, with *Breaking Army* pointing *Gen* to shoot the Ghost Gate.

The Great Emperor of Purple Tenuity commands the Three Origins and the Three Officials’ Great Emperors to lead their troops into the talisman to slay and subjugate the corpse ghosts. Visualize the Three Officials entering.

The Great Emperor of Purple Tenuity commands the Great Emperor of Fengdu to lead his troops into the talisman to slay. Visualize their entry from the north.

The Six Cavern Chiefs and Kings, Spirits of Consumption Pursuit, receive the Emperor’s command to lead their troops in slaying. Envision them arriving from the *Gen* direction, wielding wolf-tooth clubs.

The Three Officials’ Great Emperors decree slaying and compulsion. The Great Emperor of Fengdu decrees slaying and compulsion. The Six Cavern Chiefs and Kings behead and compel. Recite the Northern Incantation, rise, and perform the inner *qi* technique with three breaths. Then, in sequence and reverse, draw *Peng* into left and right to compel and expel anger, applying it with the brush.

**Three Sovereigns’ Sealing Dispatch**
When inscribing this talisman, one must embody great wrath to manifest Heaven’s majesty and enable slaying and subjugation. Never employ it lightly, nor profane the Emperor. For it possesses the power to revive the dead—how could it respond without true sincerity and true wrath?

**Volume Forty-Six of *Pearls from the Ocean of Dharma*: *The Purple Imperial Mysterious Writ***

**Generals of the Ranks**

**Grand General Xiong Gui, Marshal of Pursuit and Consumption**
Three heads, six arms; crimson face, fierce and majestic; clad in purple robes, golden armor, and green boots; wielding halberd, sword, bow, arrows, spear, and ji.

**Grand General Liu Qi, Marshal of Severing Curses**
Face of a green ghost, fanged; dressed in purple robes, golden armor, and green boots; brandishing twin great blades.

**Grand General Ji of the Deaf Legions, Zhou**
Blue face, fanged, with flaming red hair; grasping a ji; neck hung with twin skulls.

**Grand General Wei of the Mute Legions, Li**
Date-hued face, three strands of beard; one eye phoenix-like, the other apricot-shaped; clad in mirror-bright golden armor; wielding a great blade, barefoot.

**Grand General Ji of the Shattered Brow, Zhao**
Round crimson face, long beard; head crowned with a mountain; dressed in green robes and black boots.

**Fishermen, Netters, Hunters**
**Grand General of the Blood Basin, Great Marshal of the Fire Bells**

**The Peerless Sage of Mount Chu**

**Officers of Devouring Demons and Consuming Ghosts**
**Officers of Slaying Evil, Razing Shrines, Seizing Curses, and Consuming Afflictions**

**Divine Kings of the Constellations, Warriors of Battle and Strife**
**Officers and Soldiers of Talismanic Execution, Eradicating Ghosts and Traces**

**The Radiant and Wondrous Legions under the Jade Maidens**
**Envoys of the Five Directions’ Hawks and Hounds**
**Officials and Generals of the Inner Court’s Conjoined Forces**

**Sequence of Posthumous Ritual Execution**

For households afflicted by consumption where the sick cannot rise, the talisman is to be inscribed on catalpa wood, six *cun* in length—adding half a *cun* in leap years—one and a half *cun* in width. Present the petition to the master on an *shen* day, then offer sacrifices and provisions to the deceased. The talisman is held by the bereaved—men on the left, women on the right—before burning the petition in each chamber.

Upon completion of the ritual, proceed to the place where the coffin rests. Calm the mind and concentrate the spirit, then trace a well within the coffin, envisioning it as a withered pit. Invoke the marshals to seize and confine the flying corpse, corpse-worms, ghostly entities, curses, and affliction-*qi* into the well.

Recite the seven-turn incantation, strike with the Thunder Formation, and drive them in with the Thunder-Fire Mantra. Then seal the coffin.

Thereafter, select an auspicious day to perform the posthumous severance according to the method.

The Patriarchs have sworn: to employ this method lightly is to invite calamity upon oneself. One must approach the altar with utmost reverence before proceeding. Only through perfect sincerity can resonance be achieved. Strictly adhere to these precepts; do not treat them as mere common text.

**Summoning and Assembly**

The master draws the *qi* of the Central Heaven, enters the central [aperture] to stir it, and exhales toward the extreme northwest heights. He envisions the Purple Tenuity Emperor Star, vast as a chariot wheel, its light illuminating the earth, and parts his hands. The Northern Emperor issues his command to restrain and seize. The *Kui*-*Gang* roars into motion, enforcing the seizure. The *Zi-Wu* Dipper and the Second Dipper clash open the stellar enclosure; the master perceives the Great Emperor within. He inhales *qi* to suffuse his body, declaring, "I am the Northern Culmen," and summons at once.

"Fiery Emperor’s scorching blood, the Four Luminaries shatter the corpse; Heavenly Strategist annihilates the kind. With one stroke of the divine blade, ten thousand ghosts scatter in rout."

Solemnly he summons the Fiery Emperor’s Scorching Blood Envoys: "Hasten to the altar at my command." The summons complete, the master faces south. He circulates kidney-water upward to strike the heart-fire, and the envoys ascend the twin passes of the spine, traverse the twelve-storied tower, and emerge from the spirit chamber, merging with the southern quadrant into one. They manifest instantly in *Li*. The master unites with primordial *qi*, and with his gaze directs the characters "one," "three," and "seven" upon the left-hand Jade Seal—golden light is the Dao.

Once the Scorching Blood Generals have arrived at the altar, he raises the imperial decree and commands them to proceed directly to the Purple Tenuity Enclosure, summoning Marshal Xiong, the Great General of Consumptive Pursuit; Marshal Liu, the Great General of Affliction-Severing; Marshal Zhou, the Great General of Deafening Troops; Marshal Li, the Great General of the Mute; Marshal Zhao, the Great General of the Furrowed Brow; and all their subordinate officers and generals. "Hasten to the altar at my command."

The summons complete, the master wields his sword-finger to sever, bestowing upon the great marshals the breath of command. They ascend directly to the Purple Tenuity Enclosure. The master grasps the Purple Tenuity Enclosure Seal and recites the Black Emperor’s incantation of the North:

"Northern Black Emperor, supreme among the myriad sages.
Great Tenuity’s Six *Jia*, the Five *Qi* Spirit Lords.
Radiance surpassing sun and moon, might encompassing heaven and earth.
Flying talismans seize the registers, severing the gates of ghosts.
Marching spirits deploy *qi*, dispelling the Five Pestilences.
Left and right officers and soldiers, the Three and Five Generals.
Thunder Lords and thunderbolts, lightning flashing through racing clouds.
Blades like rain, ranks like clouds.
Holding the imperial chime, crowned with Kunlun.
Patrolling the world, hunting demonic essences.
The Earth Gods of the Nine Provinces, the blood-feeding guests—
none dare resist.
Should any dare to spread their scales,
the Star of Stability binds their hands,
the Northern Emperor seizes their souls,
the Three Terraces and Seven Stars wield swords to sever their bodies.
Crimes shall not be lightly punished; calamity shall befall yourselves.
Demonic essences and *wangliang*—let not your ears hear.
Whoever hears my incantation shall have their heads shattered, brains split,
scattered like fine dust."

Solemnly he summons Marshal Xiong, the Great General of Consumptive Pursuit; Marshal Liu, the Great General of Affliction-Severing; Marshal Zhou, the Great General of Deafening Troops; Marshal Li, the Great General of the Mute; Marshal Zhao, the Great General of the Furrowed Brow; and all officers and generals of the Heavenly Pen Inner Court. "Hasten to the altar at my command." The master extends the Purple Tenuity Seal with his left hand, raises the golden light, and guides the gaze of the generals, clearly manifesting them within the altar from the Purple Tenuity Enclosure, ready to be dispatched at will.

This posthumous-severing jade talisman is inscribed while reciting the Heavenly Pen Mantra. Upon completion, it is infused into the *Du-Tong* over the corpse-killing ghost. Before the third seven-day period, the principal and secondary talismans are applied to the demonic essence. Using the Northern Black Mantra, the names of the five generals are inscribed upon the *Du-Tong*, infused with primordial *qi* and sealed with three seven-fold presses. As commonly employed, this ensures total subjugation, swiftly extinguishing corpse-demons and demonic essences.

Next, he mobilizes thunder:
"Reverently I invoke the Heavenly Thunder, the Heavenly Emperor Shi;
the *Qian* Earth Thunder shakes the earth to the heavens.
*Kun*’s left harbors the Poisonous Thunder, ever shining;
its right holds the Poisonous Thunder, flashing with lightning.
Spring thunder constantly strikes flying sky-demons;
summer thunder strikes earthly evil to annihilation.
Autumn thunder flashes, racing through the clouds;
winter thunder strikes ten thousand evils to extinction.
The halting thunder, the great tree without shelter—
may it ever protect the myriad people and descend auspiciousness.
*Om du-liu, da du-liu, fei du-liu*, restrain and seize!"

With the left formation, he turns once beneath the left flank—heaven and earth quake.
The second turn darkens sun and moon.
The third turn at *Xun* stirs the *Kui*-*Gang*.
The fourth turn at *Li* ignites thunder-fire.
The fifth turn at the center shakes with thunderbolts.
The sixth turn at *Kun* crushes the malevolent.
The seventh turn at *Gen* captures and seizes those who defy heaven and lack the Dao—
consumptive transmission, hidden contagion, all demonic essences.
Swiftly they submit beneath my Five Thunder *Kui*-*Gang*,
bound to die, motionless and inert.

With the right formation, he visualizes beneath the waist: the two hands as the Direct Thunder Envoys, the two kidneys as the Thunder-Climbing Prefecture, the lower abdomen as the Penglai Capital Water Bureau, the heart as the Thunderclap Capital Bureau, the twenty-four vertebrae as the Halting Thunder Great Tree. He stabilizes the two formations, rising from the lower abdomen to the heart, then back to the abdomen, channeling directly from the flanks to the ears as the Thunder Cavern. With one strike, the talisman is infused, envisioning heaven and earth overturned, drawing *qi* into the center through the dual formations.

Next, he recites the Five Fire Mantra:
"Heavenly Fire, Earthly Fire,
Yang Fire, Yin Fire,
the true fire of my heart,
the true fire of the Great Yang,
the Five Thunders of the Four Seasons,
the roaming true fire.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by law!*"

The incantation complete, the master hooks his little fingers together, pulling from *Yin* to *Wu* to ignite. He envisions raging flames scorching heaven and earth, annihilating demonic essences. Those who witness it are driven ten thousand fathoms into the earth. With three stomps of the left foot, he envisions the gods and demons seized beneath ten thousand hounds.

Solemnly he summons the Great General of the Primordial Unity, Commander of the Supreme August Prefecture, along with Marshal Xiong, the Great General of Consumptive Pursuit; Marshal Liu, the Great General of Affliction-Severing; Marshal Zhou, the Great General of Deafening Troops; Marshal Li, the Great General of the Mute; Marshal Zhao, the Great General of the Furrowed Brow; and all their subordinate officers and generals. "Follow the talisman’s command, station yourselves here, and single-mindedly exterminate consumptive transmission, flying corpses, corpse-worms, ghostly entities, and seize affliction-toxins and affliction-*qi*. Protect the household and kin, severing the source of calamity forever."

"Great Marshals, lead your troops into the talisman and station yourselves here."

Next, he invokes the Heavenly August Thunder Sovereign:
"Heavenly August’s decree commands—
all generals hasten to attend.
Who dares disobey shall have their heads struck off, their roots destroyed.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by law!*"

Calming his spirit, he envisions the Heavenly August Emperor manifesting in the Southern Palace. His tongue presses against his upper palate as he inscribes the talisman, his brush and gaze uniting as one. His gaze welcomes the Great Emperor into the talisman.

Next, he inscribes the character *ni* (聻), sealing off all subsequent generals by sweeping his brush from the right forehead across to the left. The upper stroke severs flying corpses; the middle, human transmission; the lower, wandering consumptive *qi*—his left foot crossing over *gen* to halt it.

Then he recites the Golden Light Mantra once, envisioning all generals enveloped within its radiance. Golden *qi* spreads above, resplendent with golden light.

Next, he visualizes the heavens darkening and the earth blackening, holding his breath to observe the karmic retribution. Transforming his spirit into the Purple Tenuity Great Emperor, he draws the Great Heavenly Northern *qi* to suffuse his body, then inscribes the □ character within.

Following this, he intones the *Xu Xuanyu* Mantra, summoning Tianpeng, Tianyu, Yisheng, and Yousheng to lead their troops into the talisman, eroding and consuming it. He then envisions the Four Saints arriving from the four directions to enter the talisman.

Next, he recites the Tianpeng Mantra, solemnly invoking:
The Primordial Responding Great August Prefecture’s Tianpeng Supreme Emperor, with three hundred thousand troops, entering the talisman from the east.

Then the Tianyu Mantra, solemnly invoking:
The Primordial Radiance Cinnabar Heavenly Prefecture’s Tianyu Supreme Emperor, with three hundred thousand troops, entering the talisman from the south.

Then the Yisheng Mantra, solemnly invoking:
The Primordial Illumination Purple Void Prefecture’s Yisheng Perfected Lord, with three hundred thousand troops, entering the talisman from the west.

Then the Yousheng Mantra, solemnly invoking:
The Primordial Harmony Relocation Prefecture’s Yousheng Perfected Lord, with three hundred thousand troops, entering the talisman from the north.

Next, he envisions all generals within the talisman, enveloped in the *qi* of slaughter. After serving the Thunder Rites, no fire is used—only the inscription of the Heavenly August Emperor’s seal and the Golden Light Mantra. He visualizes the generals within, then inscribes the Four Saints’ summons to enter, drawing upon the Great Heavenly Slaughter *qi* for efficacy, and seals it with □.

For nocturnal operations, the sequence is as follows:
Initiate the sacred rites, summon the generals, offer sacrifices to dispatch them, conduct thorough searches, perform the *xinggai* ritual, assemble and ascend the altar, send off the deceased, and conclude.

Upon ascending the altar, prepare black water and seal the five cosmic locks of Heaven and Earth.

The master concentrates his spirit in silent prayer:
"Rosy light illumines golden hues,
I gaze in reverence at the master’s majestic form.
Slaughter-*qi* congeals like frost,
From afar, I behold the marshal’s solemn might."

The disciple of the lineage, [Name], prostrates and offers incense, respectfully invoking:
The Heavenly Teaching Master, Lord of Humanity and Devas, the Manifestly Efficacious and Divinely Responsive Protector of the Realm Perfected Lord;
The Wondrous Dao Teaching Master, the Right-Assisting and Wondrously Efficacious, Thoroughly Responsive Great Void Perfected Lord;
The Sincere Teaching Master, the Manifestly Assisting and Karmically Responsive, Wondrously Distant Perfected Lord.

"With utmost reverence, I beseech the sagely master to witness and illuminate. Today, on behalf of [Name], I establish the Supreme Black Prison of Grievances. I humbly implore the sagely master to preside over the altar, uphold the teachings, empower the talismans, and guide the household’s unrepentant, unenlightened karmic ghosts and vengeful spirits into the Golden Towers and Jade Chambers, that they may be bound and eradicated. I earnestly pray for the sagely master’s manifest response."

Summoning the Generals:
The master draws the Golden Light *qi*, exhaling it into the prison, envisioning it as the Golden Towers and Jade Chambers, adorned with rare treasures, exotic flowers, and sumptuous delicacies, all arrayed in perfect clarity. The sagely master stands at the forefront to receive them, then summons Zhe’e:

"By the decree of the Northern Bureau,
Wind and fire shall not cease.
Zhe’e Great General,
Swiftly reveal your true form!"

Issuing the command, he summons the great generals to descend from the northwest, guard the prison, and await further summons.

"The Heavenly August Emperor’s decree descends,
The Northern Emperor takes command.
Above, summon the Thunder Department;
Below, summon the mountain, marsh, and local deities of the sacrificial register.
Hasten to obey the imperial edict,
Array the troops in formation.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by law!*"

In silence, he envisions the thunder deities and sacrificial register spirits stationed on all sides for protection. He instructs trusted attendants to maintain vigilant guard, ensuring no movement.

Then, entering each chamber, he presents the catalpa-wood talismans, proclaims the official documents, and burns them. Executing the Fire Wheel Mudra, he envisions a raging inferno scorching the heavens and slaughtering the earth. Stamping his foot thrice, he sees the malevolent consumptive ghosts and *zha* spirits seized and cast ten thousand fathoms into the earth.

Next, he employs the Heavenly Thunder and Heavenly Emperor’s Release, arranging the formation to mobilize thunder, overturning Heaven and Earth to gather *qi*.

Then he recites:
"The Dao of Heaven severs,
The Dao of Earth at *hai* severs.
The human Dao at *xun* flourishes,
The ghost Dao at *kun* severs.
*Gen* severs all transmission of consumptive ghosts forever,
A thousand years shall they not meet,
Ten thousand ages shall they not encounter.
My talisman severs once,
All ghosts are eternally eradicated at the root."

Again, he mobilizes thunder, overturning Heaven and Earth. Holding his breath, he seals the Nine Orifices with his left hand covering his face like Mount Tai, his right sleeve concealing them, preventing any *qi* from escaping. The Yellow River flows backward as he observes the *qi*’s karmic response.

Next, he solemnly invokes:
The Primordial Responding Great August Prefecture’s Unified *Qi* Commander-in-Chief;
The Consumptive-Pursuing Great General, Marshal Xiong;
The Consumptive-Severing Great General, Marshal Liu;
The Deafening Troops Great General, Marshal Zhou;
The Mute General, Marshal Li;
The Zhe’e Great General, Marshal Zhao;
And all attending officials and generals.

"Today, lead your troops into the talisman and station yourselves here, dedicated to exterminating consumptive transmission, flying corpses, corpse-worms, ghostly entities, and seizing affliction-toxins and affliction-*qi*. Protect the household and kin, severing the source of calamity forever. Rely upon your divine might to enforce these prohibitions."

The master proceeds through each chamber, performing the rites accordingly. He envisions each chamber’s light penetrating the altar, the entire space engulfed in thunder and fire, driving the corpse-ghosts to flee into the Jade Chambers.

As the master performs the rites, he exhales three mouthfuls of slaughter-*qi* onto the altar, envisioning the *qi* of Heaven and Earth coalescing in slaughter. The altar transforms into the Northern Culmen Demon-Subduing Heavenly Palace, the Jade Chambers into the Northern Prison. The master becomes the Great Emperor, exhaling the mudra to dispatch the generals and seize the spirits.

Employing the Urgent Net-Forming Mudra, he traces from *gen* into the prison, beseeching the heavenly generals to apprehend the ghosts and imprison them. Casting the divination blocks to deploy the net, he seizes them one by one. If any remain unseized, he secretly dispatches the Consumptive-Severing Great General to pursue them.

Now, he proclaims aloud:
"By imperial decree, the supervisory marsh officials are jointly commanded to ensure the capture of the household of [Name], who have defied Heaven and Earth, disobeyed the imperial decree, and harbored the vengeful ghosts of consumptive ancestors and karmic spirits. Seize them and imprison them, that their transgressions may be manifestly revealed and requited."

The altar’s light vanishes. With the **Arcuate Seven-Circuit Incantation**, he binds them with rope, pressing them down with the **Tai Mountain Seal** in his left hand, then commands: *"See the **Yá’é** Ridge fly, sealing the prison!"*

**Ziwen**, the **Northern Qi**, and the **Black Waters** enter within. The **Scattered Incantation** is chanted universally—all generals, heed the order!

As he reaches the **collapsing peaks**, he envisions **heaven and earth trembling**, soldiers gathering like clouds, **ten thousand armies massing**, filling half the realm.
